* Take weeks to deliver results
* Are not used to feedback from Product Managers, Engineers and QAs
* Rely solely on visual aesthetics or general design trends
* Prefer not to take ownership and show initiative

**Benefits**

**What We Offer**

* 100% remote job – work from anywhere.
* Annual paid vacation – 20 working days per year, increasing to 25 days after three years.
* Paid sick leave and holidays.
* Flexible working hours.
* Accounting assistance.
* Well-being budget to support your personal growth.
* Maternity/Paternity leave.
* Reimbursement of professional development courses/certifications (up to 100% with managerial approval).
* Hardware provided based on business needs.
* A strong, positive engineering culture with a tightly-knit, collaborative team that values quality and creativity.

**Hiring process:**


We value your time and ours and make the process fast and easy. Our interview process takes the following steps: HR interview, test challenge, technical interview with COO/CTO, Head of Product and Lead Designer, Offer.

**Join us!**

title: Kravanalytiker som vill skapa IT-stöd som gör verklig nytta!
description:
**Vi söker fler engagerade och drivna kravanalytiker som brinner för att arbeta med IT-stöd som gör verklig nytta!**  

  

**Stationeringsort:** Stockholm.

 **Vill du vara en del av vårt framgångsrika team?**

  

Agio har lång erfarenhet inom offentlig sektors digitalisering. Hos oss arbetar några av Sveriges vassaste konsulter inom området och vi ska bli fler!


**Din kommande roll**
  

Du kommer att ingå i vårt team med erfarna verksamhetsutvecklare och kravanalytiker med expertkompetens inom myndigheters digitalisering.


Som kravanalytiker hos oss kommer du att arbeta i längre uppdrag hos våra kunder med att omvandla verksamhetens behov till tydliga och realiserbara krav för IT-utveckling eller vid anskaffning av standardsystem. Du samlar in, analyserar, strukturerar och kvalitetssäkrar krav och säkerställer att de blir begripliga och användbara för både verksamhet och utvecklingsteam.


Uppdragen varierar från övergripande behovsinsamling och förstudier till detaljerad kravställning i nära samarbete med utvecklare. Du kommer också att arbeta med att kartlägga och visualisera processer för att skapa gemensam förståelse och tydlighet.

  


**Du och dina erfarenheter**
  

Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som kravanalytiker. Du är van att driva arbetet med att detaljera krav utifrån verksamhetsbehov.

  



Du har utbildning inom Systemvetenskap, Informatik, Datavetenskap eller annan relevant universitets-/högskoleexamen.


Som person söker vi dig som har en förmåga att sätta dig in i olika verksamhetsområden för att förstå behov och verksamhetsnytta. Du är flexibel, prestigelös och trivs med att samverka och kommunicera med andra.

**Vi erbjuder dig**
  

Agios personalidé är att det skall vara kul och utvecklande på jobbet. Vi arbetar i en stimulerande miljö som genomsyras av engagemang, kunskap och ansvar. Vi erbjuder en miljö där människor trivs.  



Du kommer att tillhöra affärsområdet Digital transformation med 20 andra drivna konsulter med kompetenser inom bl a kravhantering, UX, verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, projektledning och informationshantering, Tillsammans i teamet och med våra säljare formar ni våra erbjudanden och hur vi bäst hjälper våra befintliga och nya kunder.


Uppdragen är oftast på heltid hos våra kunder och matchas utifrån dina erfarenheter, dina drivkrafter och din individuella utvecklingsresa.


Vi erbjuder en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal — vi tar ansvar för Dig och Dina kollegor.


**Är du redo för nya utmaningar då är vi redo att satsa på dig! Vänta inte – ansök nu!** Sista ansökningsdag är den **1 november 2025.** Vi hanterar ansökningar fortlöpande**,**  

  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

**Kontaktinformation**  

Annika Sällström
  

annika.sallstrom@agio.se
  

070-373 33 10

title: Clinical Research Assistant
description:
Natural Cycles is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.
  
As a Clinical Research Assistant, you will be the main point of contact for research participants. You play a vital role in ensuring the well-being and engagement of participants throughout their clinical trial journey. You will be part of the MAD (Medical Algorithm and Data) team and collaborate with several other teams, including the Regulatory Team, Product Team, UX Team, Logistics Team, Finance Team and People Team. This role involves supporting a global team and engaging with participants across different time zones, and therefore, we are looking for someone who can work flexible hours when needed. This may include occasional communication with contacts in regions such as the United States, outside of standard Swedish working hours. Your primary focus will be communicating (both verbally and in writing) with participants in the US territory, so excellent English communication skills are essential.
  
Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.
  
What you will be doing
  
You will assist the team in the operational management and oversight of clinical trials, from setup to conduct and archiving. Your main tasks will include monitoring onboarding, data collection, communication, and participant follow-up. Assisting tasks include documentation management and distribution, as well as preparing, assembling, and distributing study materials.
  
  

**Manage trial daily operations:** address participants' questions and issues, schedule additional meetings when necessary, send out follow-up emails and surveys.
  
  

Assist with the preparation, review, and distribution of all operational trial-related documents (e.g., study consent, guides, etc.).
  
  

Assist and monitor the recruitment of the trial participants; monitor the collection of signed documentation.
  
  

**Assist with setting up systems for filing:** prepare documentation to safely store participants' information and data.
  
  

**Assist with the onboarding of the trial participants:** for in-person onboarding, schedule sessions with each participant and prepare relevant documentation; for remote onboarding, schedule sessions and shipment of trial material if applicable.
  
  

**Assist with the offboarding of the trial participants:** collect relevant feedback from the participants, gather the study material when applicable, and coordinate with the Finance team to ensure the compensation is granted.
  
  

Assist with study supplies and inventory management.
  
  

Contribute to the optimization of processes related to clinical trials.
  
  

What skills and experience we think you have
  
  

Minimum of 1-year experience in a customer support role, research assistant role, or similar.
  
  

You are skilled at conveying complex information in a simplified and straightforward manner
  
  

You are organized and structured, and you are good at preparing and maintaining documentation
  
  

You can work independently
  
  

You have good attention to detail while maintaining an overview of the whole project, making sure everything is taken care of
  
  

You can collaborate with key stakeholders in the company, as well as with external partners
  
  

Full professional proficiency in English (both written and spoken)
  
  

You are passionate about women’s health and research
  
  

Based in the Stockholm area
  
  

Ready to adjust to a flexible schedule and occasionally work in the evenings
  
  

Available to work from November 2025
  
  

What we offer
  
  

Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
  
  

Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
  
  

Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
  
  

Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
  
  

Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development
  
  

Location
  
We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the MAD team you will work with is located in Geneva and Stockholm.
  
Sounds interesting?
  
If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
How to apply
  
To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
  
At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates. Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies

title: Product Manager – API
description:
**About our client**


Our client runs one of Europe’s most advanced SaaS platforms in expense management. More than 30,000 companies and 290,000+ users already rely on their solution to simplify financial routines – securely, efficiently, and with ease. They are not just building tools – they are shaping the future of business finance.

**About the role**


We are looking for a Product Manager to own, build, operate, and scale the API-first experience for partners and developers. You will be responsible for the full customer journey of the API product, including technical documentation for the Developer Portal to ensure smooth integrations.


As Product Manager API, you will work closely with other product managers, UX, developers, and QA in a cross-functional squad. You will execute on the product vision and roadmap, transforming customer needs into innovative solutions.

  


**Key responsibilities:**

* Manage and prioritize the API product backlog in line with roadmap and strategy.
* Work with your squad to run sprint planning, backlog refinement, and reviews.
* Create visions for new features, translate into user stories, and define acceptance criteria.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure delivery, testing, and release of high-quality features.
* Monitor product quality and act on business-critical bugs and errors.
* Support business and support teams with knowledge of product changes.
* Validate insights, roadmap, and go-to-market plans with stakeholders.
* Translate business objectives into actionable user stories and scale the customer journey for the API product.

**Must-have qualifications:**

* 4+ years of experience as Product Manager or Product Owner, preferably with APIs.
* Fundamental understanding of coding.
* Experience with software product development.
* Experience working with Scrum teams and agile methods.
* Strong collaboration skills across product and engineering teams.
* Fluent in English, spoken and written.

**Nice-to-have qualifications:**

* Background as a developer.
* Experience in B2B SaaS, fintech is a plus.
* Experience with technical writing and developer documentation.

**Location & scope**

* **Location:** Stockholm
* **Workload:** 100%
* **Employment type:** Direct recruitment (not a consultancy assignment)

**Apply now**


Excited to shape the future of our API-first product? Send us your application in English as soon as possible!

title: SAP Technology Consultant
description:
Are you passionate about solving complex challenges with cutting-edge SAP technologies? Join Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group and help shape the future of digital transformation.


With over 40 years of partnership, Accenture and SAP lead some of the region’s most ambitious transformation programs. Our SAP Technology team is at the core—working across cloud strategies, integration, infrastructure, security, UX, and platform operations.

**What You’ll Do**


You will play a central role in delivering large-scale transformation projects using the latest SAP cloud and platform solutions. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze, design, and implement business processes based on SAP.

  

You’ll apply your expertise across platforms like SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP BTP, Ariba, and SuccessFactors, while also contributing to innovation initiatives, internal capability building, and thought leadership within our SAP community.


At Accenture, continuous learning and collaboration are part of our DNA. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to deepen your expertise, grow into leadership positions, and collaborate with top Nordic companies to deliver impactful solutions that drive efficiency, sustainability, and growth.


  

**Job Requirements**

* Experience with SAP technologies such as S/4HANA Cloud, SAP BTP, Ariba, SuccessFactors, or SAP RISE.
* Understanding of cloud platforms, integration technologies, infrastructure, and SAP Basis.
* Ability to analyze, design, and implement business processes using SAP best practices.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in diverse, global teams.
* Fluency in English and at least one of the Nordic languages (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish or Finnish)

**What’s In It For You*** Work with leading SAP clients on global implementation projects.
* Be part of high-impact, innovative transformation programs.
* Access tailored development paths, mentorship, and career growth support.
* Build your consulting, technical, and leadership skills in a collaborative environment.
* Leverage global tools, expert networks, and industry benchmarks.
* Enjoy a human-centered work culture that values inclusion, flexibility, and wellbeing.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.
* Make a real difference through sustainability and digital innovation.


Ready to bring your talent and passion to Accenture? Let’s create change—together.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
🔹 100% remote | 🌎 Global team | ⏳ Full-time
   

  

**About NineTwoThree Studio**
 NineTwoThree Studio is a dynamic product design and engineering studio specializing in creating innovative apps and AI-powered digital solutions for a wide range of clients. With over 11 years of experience, we have built 14 internal startups and 60 client apps, collectively generating over one billion dollars in revenue.
   

  

 We have been recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in America for four consecutive years by Inc., and one of Massachusetts' 50 fastest-growing companies by the Boston Business Journal. Our passion lies in leveraging clever technology to transform businesses and create exceptional user experiences.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Senior UI/UX Designer to join our design team. In this role, you will create intuitive, user-centered, and visually compelling experiences for AI-driven platforms, mobile apps, and web applications. You will work closely with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to develop solutions that balance user needs and business goals. You will also get to design for products across all sorts of industries and platforms, making this an exciting place to exercise your design muscles.
   

  

 This role requires a high level of creativity, collaboration, and attention to detail. The ideal candidate has a strong background in UI/UX design, an eye for aesthetics, and a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences.

* Lead the end-to-end design process, from concept to implementation for individual clients and the NineTwoThree brand and set the standard for Figma best practices across the team
* Deliver well-structured Figma boards with components, symbols and brand styles that remain consistent throughout the design process and have a single source of truth for all elements that update entire systems
* Develop wireframes, interactions, and high-fidelity UI designs using Figma
* Create prototypes when delivering design ideas to illustrate different design solutions and test hypotheses
* Conduct competitive analysis and usability testing to inform design decisions and rely on industry best practice (AirBnB, Spotify, etc) to demonstrate forward design thinking.
* Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to translate complex requirements into user-friendly designs
* Ensure smooth handoff of high-quality, developer-ready components to engineering teams, proactively anticipating technical needs, edge cases, and providing necessary specs, assets, and documentation.
* Speed up design process using AI tools and lead adoption of new practices in the team
* Articulate and defend design decisions to internal stakeholders and external clients, grounding your rationale in user needs, business goals, and established design principles
* Help build a design culture at NineTwoThree, ensuring high-quality craft and attention to detail
* Actively participate in multiple projects across the company
* Explain projects through design language on our website and work with marketing to tell the story of why each project solved our clients problems.
* Stay updated with the UI/UX standards and guidelines to ensure our applications are intuitive and follow familiar usage patterns


**Requirements**
* At least 5 years of experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing knowledge of UX principles, user flows, and visual design for established brands
* Experience working in structured, fast-paced environments with clear processes, tight deadlines, and asynchronous collaboration across departments
* Experience working as part of a multi-designer team, contributing to shared systems and giving/receiving design feedback
* Proficiency in Figma, including team libraries, auto layout, component properties, and prototyping
* Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and usability best practices
* Knowledge and experience with Google and Apple Design Guidelines
* Strong graphic design fundamentals, including typography, composition, layout, grids, and color
* Excellent English skills (Upper-Intermediate or higher)
* Experience designing for AI-driven applications, mobile apps, and web platforms
* Strong understanding of responsive and interactive design principles
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment and manage multiple projects
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in a remote work setting
* Attention to detail and a strong sense of visual aesthetics


**Will be an advantage:**
* Proven experience designing complex, data-intensive platforms and interfaces
* Motion design experience
* Experience as Illustrator or Brand Designer


**You'll Thrive If You:**
* Enjoy designing non-trivial web apps
* Like to be challenged and learn fast
* Can work independently through the full design cycle
* Communicate clearly in writing and through presentations


**You Might Struggle If You:**
* Take weeks to deliver results
* Are not used to feedback from Product Managers, Engineers and QAs
* Rely solely on visual aesthetics or general design trends
* Prefer not to take ownership and show initiative


**Benefits**
**What We Offer**
* 100% remote job - work from anywhere
* Annual paid vacation - 20 working days per year, increasing to 25 days after three years
* Paid sick leave and holidays
* Flexible working hours
* Accounting assistance
* Well-being budget to support your personal growth
* Maternity/Paternity leave
* Reimbursement of professional development courses/certifications (up to 100% with managerial approval)
* Hardware provided based on business needs
* A strong, positive engineering culture with a tightly-knit, collaborative team that values quality and creativity


**Hiring process:**
 We value your time and ours and make the process fast and easy. Our interview process takes the following steps: HR interview, test challenge, technical interview with COO/CTO, Head of Product and Lead Designer, Offer.
   

  

**Join us!**

title: Product Designer - Kids shoes
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Kids Shoe Designer with a strong creative eye, attention to finer detail and fashion sensibility to join us at H&M's head office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 You will be part of a fast-paced environment and work with youthful, elevated fashion products that welcome everyone! This role is designing across both Boys and Girls from Newborn, Baby, Child and Teenager.
   

  

 As a Product Specialist, you'll drive and identify key products, translating them into commercial collections. You should have strong design process skills and be able to communicate your vision clearly with a creative, fashion-forward focus.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You'll collaborate with a team to provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide through H&M's omni channels. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion trend awareness and genuine passion for shoes! Maintaining a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while being cost-conscious throughout the design process, is essential. The role demands high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching and leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion Footwear/Product Design
* Minimum of 4 years’ work experience as a Designer with a strength in overall collection building
* High knowledge of materials, technical details, and processes of footwear
* A visionary mindset with true passion for women’s fashion, current and future trends
* A strong customer focus and commercial mindset for the H&M customer
* Experience working with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Skilled in working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent and proactive approach
* Able to set priorities with an organized & structured approach
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
 *In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications,
 **apply asap with CV and design portfolio** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading). Assessments will start immediately.
   

  

 All documents should be in English. This is a full time permanent position starting as soon as possible at our H&M Head office in Stockholm, Sweden working on site.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Product Designer - H&M Womenswear Light Woven
description:
**Job Description**
 Exciting new opportunity to join H&M as a Fashion Designer within our Womenswear Light Woven department. As a Product Designer, you'll lead the way in identifying key products and crafting the perfect assortment for our target customers. We seek a passionate Designer skilled in building strong collections.
   

  

 Able to communicate your vision and product ideas in a clear way with a creative, fashion forward and commercial focus. Essentially you will have the ability to work close to season with a high pace proactive approach and able to build & maintain strong relationships both internally and with external partners.
   

  

 If you're a Designer who loves to collaborate, work in a team, and provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide than H&M could be the brand for you. This role will be handling a collection with a focus on light wovens across dresses, blouses, skirts and light trousers. It is key to have a high fashion sense of style and trends for our target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  

 The role requires strong drive, high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching & leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Qualifications**
 A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design
   

  

* Minimum of 3 years’ work experience as a Designer for Light Woven product types
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer
* International experience is meriting
* Attention to detail with strong knowledge on light woven products
* A creative mindset with sharp eye for both current and future trends
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D CLO is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Additional Information**
 This position is based in Stockholm, to start asap. You will report into the department Assortment Manager and work with a like-minded team of passionate Designers/Product Developers and Planners.
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading) Portfolio should include vision/mood boards, full design process and final collections and products from a variety of fashion design projects. All documents should be in English. Please ensure to include some work clearly relatable to the aspirational H&M Women’s target customer.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H & M here.

title: Accessibility Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a Accessibility Engineer to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.* 




  





***Period:***
*ASAP 2025-12-31 to (full-time), with a possibility of extension.* 




  





**About the role** 




 Are you passionate about accessibility and building inclusive experiences? Excellent! We are looking for an experienced Accessibility Engineer contractor to join our client's in-house accessibility team.
 



  





 Solving for inclusion requires empathy with users, building influential relationships, proposing bold ideas, and introducing new processes that integrate accessibility thinking into product development. Your work will have a high impact as you partner with other engineers, designers, and user researchers to build the tools, processes, and frameworks needed to ensure experiences are accessible and inclusive for all millions of users.
 



  





**What you'll do** 



* Work day-to-day with an agile team of engineers, designers, user researchers, and product managers to build and maintain their central approach to accessibility
* Collaborate with other engineering teams on code reviews, evolving shared processes and tooling to support many teams working on the client's exciting range of products
* Propose and lead initiatives that help achieve their goal of scaling accessibility and ultimately making the Spotify experience more inclusive
* Educate, inspire, and influence colleagues by sharing your knowledge and experience of accessibility through guidelines and accessibility training based on findings from user research
* Drive the adoption of accessibility across the company by partnering and occasionally embedding with their product teams as they update existing and build exciting new features
* Find innovative approaches, improve the developer experience, and remove any friction teams may have when building accessible experiences



  





**Who you are** 



* You have good knowledge and understanding of WCAG criteria and accessibility best practices
* You are aware of the needs and challenges people with disabilities face when using software
* You understand and are able to articulate the difference between web accessibility and mobile accessibility
* You are comfortable using assistive technologies such as screen readers and accessibility features across various platforms (incl. VoiceOver, Talkback, Browser extensions, JAWS, and NVDA)
* You have experience auditing and testing digital products for accessibility
* You enjoy mentoring and supporting peers and engineering teams, fostering the best engineering and accessibility practices
* You are eager to learn new technologies (the client will support you with training & mentoring)



  





**We are Market Partner** 




*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: Senior Product Designer, AI & Learning
description:
Learning is one of the newest verticals on Spotify. We believe that we can make a real difference in how people learn and upskill, with our massive consumer and creator scale, personalisation technology and global brand love. This will be the next big step-change for Spotify after music, podcasts, and audiobooks.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to work alongside a world-class R&D team and key decision-makers. This role requires a broad remit, and we are looking for someone who thrives as a generalist builder – combining expertise in product design and AI.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

* You are passionate about Learning and Education: You possess a genuine enthusiasm for the space of learning and education. You are driven by your desire to create impactful experiences that transform how people learn now and in the future.
* You’ve shipped products that people love: You know what it takes to transform ideas and concepts into well-crafted products that make a difference to people and the business.
* You demonstrate clarity of thought: You can cut through ambiguity and get to the heart of things. You can balance creativity with pragmatism and drive principled decision-making across the product development process.
* You care about Design excellence: You are adept at foundational design principles and the ability to apply them to create exceptional user experiences. You have a discerning eye for visual and content design, typography and layout – consistently delivering high-quality, bar-raising work.
* You’ve experience with building AI-first workflows and products: You have a strong understanding and hands-on familiarity with AI tools, evals, and the unique challenges and opportunities of designing AI-driven products.
* You’re growth and impact-minded: You can operate in fast-paced entrepreneurial environments and know how to stay adaptable to changes and pivots – using change as an opportunity to grow.


 What You'll Do
   

  

* You'll be responsible for design quality and cohesion of learning-related products across mobile and web.
* Invent the future through rapid prototyping: You’ll demonstrate prototyping as a vehicle for exploring, testing, and creating momentum for our forward-looking strategies and ideas. You know how to use new-generation prototyping tools to get from ideas to findings quickly.
* Bring a human-centric mentality in everything you do: You are relentlessly curious about understanding the needs, motivations, and behaviors of people we’re designing for, especially in the context of AI. You'll be a champion for user-centered design principles, prioritizing usability, accessibility, inclusivity, and ethical considerations when building with AI.
* Inspire and influence through compelling storytelling: You will leverage the power of stories, narratives, and strategic positioning artifacts to drive impactful change and alignment across the team.
* Be ultra-collaborative: You’ll work everyday in deep-partnership with tech, product, and insights colleagues, to brainstorm, build, and drive the project forward, humanizing complex technology into valuable user experiences.
* Define and design AI interaction patterns: Develop innovative interaction models, feedback mechanisms, and error handling strategies specific to AI-driven features, ensuring transparency and user control.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 2-3 times per week.
* The team is based in Sweden and the UK. We are looking for someone who can work in the EMEA time zone.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: People Services Specialist (9 month contract)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**Job Description**
 People Services is the heart of operational HR support at H&M. We provide fast, consistent, and high-quality service to managers, employees, and HR teams through harmonized and digital processes. As a
 **People Services Specialist** 
 , you’ll be part of a collaborative and forward-thinking team that continuously evolves to meet the needs of our business. It is a hands-on role focused on delivering first-line HR support through case management and administrative processes.
   

  

 This is a temporary role covering a parental leave, offering a unique opportunity to gain experience in a global HR environment and contribute to impactful work.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Handle HR-related requests in our case management system (ServiceNow) with accuracy and efficiency.
* Provide proactive support and solutions with a customer-centric mindset.
* Collaborate on complex cases and prioritize tasks based on urgency and impact.
* Stay updated on relevant policies, procedures, and guidelines.
* Focus on continuous improvement, compliance, and user experience.
* Identify opportunities for automation and process enhancements.


**Qualifications**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about service excellence. You’re a problem solver with an eye for details and a holistic understanding of HR operations.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you bring:**
* Experience in HR, preferably within a shared services or operational HR setting.
* Knowledge of Swedish labour law, collective agreements, and company policies.
* A service-minded approach and understanding of how HR operations support business outcomes.
* Experience with HR systems and administrative processes.
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* A curious mindset—you enjoy exploring new ways of working, asking questions, and continuously learning to improve how we deliver services.


**Bonus points if you have:**
* Experience in Mobility and/or Payroll.
* Familiarity with SAP and ServiceNow.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time parental cover of 9 months based in Stockholm with start date January 1st. Please apply as soon as possible. Interviews will be held continuously.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: Director of Innovation & Technology
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Are you our new Director of Innovation & Technology at Getinge Critical Care in Solna? At Critical Care we develop tomorrow’s intensive care products and equipment, and we are in an intensive period of change and expansion. In this role you will be a key player within our R&D organization and have the possibility to take an active part in shaping our future products. The Innovation & Technology team has deep knowledge in our products, legacy and work together with external partners like hospitals and tech-companys to create the solutions for tomorrow always keeping the customer need in focus.
   

  

 The position offers you a great opportunity to be part of the R&D management team and influence how we prioritize and drive our Innovation, Product Development and Sustaining.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 In this position you will be responsible for securing that we have the right setup to drive innovation with deep technical expertise, rapid prototyping, usability and concept development. Today, the team consists of about 12 highly experienced engineers with a broad expertise in the technology and clinical applications of Ventilation, Anaesthesia, Data Analysis, Simulation, prototyping with mechatronics etc. The R&D organization within Critical Care currently consists of 250 dedicated employees in Sweden and Germany.
   

  

 The position gives you the opportunity to join a winning team, helping to continue the growth of our market leading and life saving products. You will interface with a wide variety of stakeholders on all levels.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities And Tasks Will Be**
* As a member of the R&D management team, participate in the portfolio discussions and drive the Innovation funnel
* Implement continuous improvement through new ways of working, and when needed apply Change Management
* Drive partnerships with Universities, Hospitals, Tech-partners and relevant Institutes world-wide
* Develop team competences and drive the strategy of Innovation forward to secure Getinge’s future competitiveness
* Daring to dream and feel comfortable being Visionary, but keep your feet on the ground


 The position is based at our site in Solna but offers the flexibility to work from home when suitable, though not more than 1-2 days per week. The role requires occasional international travel. You will be reporting to the Head of R&D in Critical Care.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To fit in this role, we believe that you have the following experience:
   

  

* PhD or MSc within Engineering or relevant field
* Excellent leadership skills, and experience from leading a cross-functional team for integrated technology development
* Experience from Concept development with rapid prototyping, speed design reviews, customer workflows and UX validation
* Experience from leading a team where you are more the facilitator than the expert, they are the experts
* Experience from implementation of TRL (Technology Readiness Levels) will be useful
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Experience of working in a regulated industry and especially development of medical device
* A proven track-record of cross-company collaboration aligning expectations and stake holder management


 To succeed in this position, you need to be a strong and business oriented leader who is able to self drive, inspire others and set direction, priorities and goals. To work with Critical Care products means to work in a complex and fast changing environment, hence you are a change driver who creates results by successful implementation of new ways of working in a fast-paced environment. We believe that you are inspired by leading and motivating others, making continuous improvements and that you see this as an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our product development. Additionally, communication, influencing and stakeholder management skills are highly important.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 For this position we will conduct a background check on the final candidate.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Magnus Tunklev at magnus.tunklev@getinge.com or Recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Performance Designer
description:
**Join us in marketing world-class creativity apps used by millions of people** 





 Appostrophe is a Stockholm-based mobile app studio creating easy-to-use design tools that help millions unlock their creativity. We’re looking for a Performance Designer to join the team working on our flagship app, SCRL, a top-ranked tool for social media content creation that blends collage-making, storytelling, and photo editing.
 



  





 We’re a collaborative, ambitious team, and we’re excited to bring on someone who shares our passion for design and empowering creators.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As a Performance Designer, you will produce marketing assets that drive results, blending creativity with data-driven insights. You’ll be part of the in-house creative team and drive SCRL’s growth by producing high-performing digital ads.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Create high-quality ads for social platforms that drive results according to defined KPIs
* Mix user-generated content with motion graphics
* Use data to figure out what's working and keep iterating
* Stay on top of social media trends to stay relevant and competitive
* Make ads in English plus localized versions that actually connect with different audiences



  





**You should have** 



* 2+ years of motion design and video editing experience, especially for social media and performance marketing
* Advanced proficiency in tools like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite (After Effects especially)
* Understanding of digital marketing metrics and passion for coming up with ideas for creative A/B tests
* Clear communication skills to explain your ideas to teammates and stakeholders
* Ability to work at a high pace without compromising quality
* Agency experience or working with apps is a nice bonus



  





**What we offer** 



* Opportunity to drive the company’s global growth through impactful design
* Work with talented colleagues at our central Stockholm office
* Competitive salary



  





**Ready to join us?** 




 We believe creativity should be accessible to everyone, and we’re excited for you to help bring this vision to life. Ready to shape the future of creativity? Apply now!

title: Frontend Engineer
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 In this role, you will be a part of a team building our intelligent freight management platform for electric vehicles - Saga. As a Frontend Engineer, your focus will be on building customer-facing products
   

  

 You will
   

  

* Use modern technologies for frontend development, using React, TypeScript, ViteJS, and GraphQL as your primary development tools. For more information about Einride's technology stack, see our Frontend Tech Radar.
* Contribute to enhancing our frontend technology stack and architecture by having a good perception and anticipation of customer needs.
* Work in a modern organization of empowered product teams, who value a fast flow of customer value, take accountability for what you build, and ship to production daily.
* Understand and solve complex system requirements rooted in real-life business-to-business use cases in the transportation domain.


**We Expect You To**
* Have experience working with techniques and tooling such as CI/CD, testing, REST, GraphQL, and feature flags.
* Are fluent in modern React and TypeScript.
* Are eager to work in a cross-functional, highly collaborative, and entrepreneurial team.
* Enjoy close collaboration with our frontend engineers and architects regarding frontend tooling and architecture to evolve the frontend technology stack and technical strategy.
* Are curious and open-minded about technologies and help in areas other than frontend development. Our engineers strive towards T-shapedness.


 This position is based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Senior Product Manager - Core Experience
description:
Delivering the best Spotify experience possible. To as many people as possible. In as many moments as possible. That’s what the Experience team is all about. We use our deep understanding of consumer expectations to enrich the lives of millions of our users all over the world, bringing the music and audio they love to the devices, apps and platforms they use every day. Know what our users want? Join us and help Spotify give it to them.
   

  

 We’re hiring a new Senior Product Manager for the Core Experience team to help shape the future of our free, offline, and social experiences. You’ll work with a cross-functional team to define and deliver experiences that expand access, strengthen connections, and unlock the next wave of innovation across Spotify’s experience. These innovations will play a critical role in shaping Spotify’s consumer experience and help users discover, share, and engage in new ways.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Develop a product vision and strategy for your area, aligned with the broader consumer experience vision
* Prioritize a long-term product roadmap for your team
* Drive alignment for your strategies, roadmap, and metrics across the organization
* Use data, insights, and experimentation to inform decisions and sharpen strategy.
* Work in a cross-discipline team and partner with engineers, data scientists, researcher and designers on multiple projects from idea to launch
* Demonstrate product craft by shipping impactful, high-visibility features that move Spotify’s topline metrics
* Collaborate with many people inside the product area and across the company
* Build and manage cross-functional relationships to keep stakeholders informed and engaged
* Build a broad network across Spotify to align with adjacent strategies and maximize impact


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a consistent track record of taking new consumer products to market.
* Skilled at distilling complexity into clarity and guiding teams through ambiguity.
* Experienced in building ambitious, compelling product visions and strategies for widely used products.
* An excellent communicator and storyteller, skilled at tailoring ideas for different audiences and contexts.
* Comfortable using research, analysis, and A/B testing to inform decisions.
* Excited about the potential of AI and personalization, with the ability to link today’s product decisions to tomorrow’s evolving ecosystem.
* Growth-minded, always learning and adapting.
* Collaborative, prioritizing team success over individual recognition.
* A clear thinker, equally comfortable with conceptual models, design trade-offs, and data-informed iteration.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Design Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re seeking exceptional Design Engineers to help build the future of AI. You’ll work closely with both design and engineering to build world-class interfaces that empower the next generation of creators and builders.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. Solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We’re at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

* 5+ years of years experience, shipping products users genuinely love
* Portfolio demonstrating sophisticated interactions and thoughtful user affordances required (if you don’t have a portfolio - please check out our other roles!)
* Ability to make smart trade-offs between speed and polish, knowing when to ship and when to refine
* Expertise in React/TypeScript and the broader frontend ecosystem
* Experience translating scrappy explorations into production-ready experiences
* Strong product sense with an eye for detail, accessibility, and usability


 What you’ll do
   

  

 In one sentence: Own and scale the user-facing experience of Lovable products, turning powerful capabilities into intuitive, magical interfaces.
   

  

* Design and build world class product experiences
* Drive front-end execution - pioneering new interaction patterns, micro-animations, and delightful details that elevate the entire experience
* Implement features in React/TypeScript with obsessive attention to detail
* Collaborate with backend, ML, design, and product teams to bring complex features to life in a seamless way
* Explore and iterate on visual designs with designers, translating explorations into scalable, web-native implementations
* Build and maintain reusable components that enhance consistency while enabling creativity across the product


 Our tech stack
   

  

 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React, Tailwind
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, , infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

 How we hire

* Show us how you approach problems during technical interviews.
* In some cases, we may opt to do paid, trial work.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Clinical Research Assistant
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 As a Clinical Research Assistant, you will be the main point of contact for research participants. You play a vital role in ensuring the well-being and engagement of participants throughout their clinical trial journey. You will be part of the MAD (Medical Algorithm and Data) team and collaborate with several other teams, including the Regulatory Team, Product Team, UX Team, Logistics Team, Finance Team and People Team. This role involves supporting a global team and engaging with participants across different time zones, and therefore, we are looking for someone who can work flexible hours when needed. This may include occasional communication with contacts in regions such as the United States, outside of standard Swedish working hours. Your primary focus will be communicating (both verbally and in writing) with participants in the US territory, so excellent English communication skills are essential.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 




 You will assist the team in the operational management and oversight of clinical trials, from setup to conduct and archiving. Your main tasks will include monitoring onboarding, data collection, communication, and participant follow-up. Assisting tasks include documentation management and distribution, as well as preparing, assembling, and distributing study materials.
 



  




* Manage trial daily operations: address participants' questions and issues, schedule additional meetings when necessary, send out follow-up emails and surveys.
* Assist with the preparation, review, and distribution of all operational trial-related documents (e.g., study consent, guides, etc.).
* Assist and monitor the recruitment of the trial participants; monitor the collection of signed documentation.
* Assist with setting up systems for filing: prepare documentation to safely store participants' information and data.
* Assist with the onboarding of the trial participants: for in-person onboarding, schedule sessions with each participant and prepare relevant documentation; for remote onboarding, schedule sessions and shipment of trial material if applicable.
* Assist with the offboarding of the trial participants: collect relevant feedback from the participants, gather the study material when applicable, and coordinate with the Finance team to ensure the compensation is granted.
* Assist with study supplies and inventory management.
* Contribute to the optimization of processes related to clinical trials.



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* Minimum of 1-year experience in a customer support role, research assistant role, or similar.
* You are skilled at conveying complex information in a simplified and straightforward manner
* You are organized and structured, and you are good at preparing and maintaining documentation
* You can work independently
* You have good attention to detail while maintaining an overview of the whole project, making sure everything is taken care of
* You can collaborate with key stakeholders in the company, as well as with external partners
* Full professional proficiency in English (both written and spoken)
* You are passionate about women’s health and research
* Based in the Stockholm area
* Ready to adjust to a flexible schedule and occasionally work in the evenings
* Available to work from November 2025



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the MAD team you will work with is located in Geneva and Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Carbon data manager
description:
Are you excited about allometric equations, data management and carbon accounting following Gold Standard methodology? We want to hear from you!
 






 ﻿
 





**The role** 




 This role is central to ensuring the scientific, technical, and data integrity of our reforestation projects through the Gold Standard certification process.
 



 You will work at the intersection of
 **carbon modeling, field inventory data, monitoring design and Gold Standard methodologies** 
 , ensuring our submissions meet the highest transparency requirements.
 



  





 You will thrive in this role if you are detail-oriented, enjoy working with Gold Standard methodologies, comfortable working with
 **large datasets in Excel** 
 , and able to translate field data (plot-level tree measurements, biomass equations, uncertainty analysis) into
 **auditor-ready carbon accounting outputs** 
 .
 



 In our small team, you’ll wear multiple hats — from supporting field protocol design, to ensuring QA/QC in data collection, to building transparent, verification-ready workbooks.
 



  





 Qualifications
 


* Degree in
 **Environmental Science, Carbon Accounting, or related field** 
 .
* 3+ years of work experience with
 **carbon standards** 
 (Gold Standard, or similar)/ carbon accounting.
* Strong skills in
 **data analysis** 
 , including uncertainty and CI calculations.
* Knowledge of
 **allometric modeling, biomass estimation, and stratified sampling** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **remote sensing & GIS tools** 
 (QGIS, Landsat, drone mapping).
* Experience or strong interest for
 **GHG accounting and SDG impact metrics** 
 .
* Excellent documentation and reporting skills in line with third-party verification standards.
* Sense of humour and strong sense of ownership.
* Fluent in English and preferably French.



  





 What We Offer
 


* The opportunity to shape one of the
 **largest reforestation initiatives in the Congo Basin** 
 .
* A role at the
 **core of Gold Standard certification.**
* International exposure, working with partners across
 **Africa, Europe, and global carbon markets** 
 .
* Remote work and flexible working hours.
* Competitive compensation package and wellness allowance.
* Start date: Flexible



  





**About United Eco Solutions** 




 We are committed to building a sustainable future by restoring one of the world’s largest rainforests – the Congo Basin. Our work advances over multiple UN Sustainable Development Goals while generating high-quality, nature-based carbon credits, now under review for Gold Standard certification.
 



 With operations expanding across Africa and Europe, we are pursuing an ambitious mission: to become a global leader in certified, high-integrity carbon credits.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Come join us at Kivra! We’re looking for people with a passion for software development, love solving problems, and that thrive in agile development environments. We are looking for an iOS engineer that can turn the Kivra app into an identity wallet. You’ll be part of the Kivra Identity team and engineer next generation technology around authentication and identity verification.
 



 At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we are saving trees with a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As an iOS engineer in the Identity team, you will develop an identity wallet allowing people to own and control all aspects of themselves. We value security, reliability, and user experience high, and it will be central to the work you do.
 



 You will join a highly experienced cross functional team with end-to-end responsibility of identity functionality and systems. You will be the lead engineer for the iOS identity software and collaborate frequently with your Android counterpart to ensure consistent functionality and integration into the Kivra app. You will also be a member of the iOS engineering community ensuring quality and alignment of functionality across all Kivra product teams.
 



 Kivra currently has over 6 million users, and over 50,000 companies and organizations send documents, invoices, doctor appointments, vaccine certificates, receipts, pay slips, contracts and much more. And this number is constantly increasing. Next up is to offer all these users a digital identity, where they can identify themselves and sign-in to services.
 



 Engineering the identity wallet capabilities in Kivra goes beyond UX, data and HTTP. It is a matter of developing security features, authentication, and signing. We are looking for you who don’t only enjoy app engineering from a touchscreen-in-your-pocket perspective, but also for the device’s native capabilities such as NFC, camera, bluetooth, deeplinks and secure enclave.
 



 Kivra has adopted the Devops Methodology and strongly believes in the “You build it - you own it”-attitude. You will be actively involved in developing, testing, deploying and managing incidents, contributing to the overall success of the team.
 



  





**What we are looking for** 




 Knowledge is important but so is attitude! Kivra’s culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive and the desire to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important, and just like us, we believe that you thrive on being nice, helpful and always encouraging growth.
 



  





 This job is for you who provide:
 


* Deep experience in Swift, SwiftUI and related frameworks.
* Openness to cross platform frameworks and willingness to contribute using other adopted technologies such as Typescript and Kotlin.
* Contribution to CI/CD workflow engineering and test automation.
* A thoughtful approach to testing and troubleshooting with a zero-bug mindset.
* An interest in thinking beyond just code - caring about how things fit together as a whole.
* Clear communication, technical judgment, and a high signal-to-noise ratio.
* Bonus points for experience with authentication, app security and various iOS native capabilities.
* Extra credit if you’ve worked with decentralized identity, verifiable credentials, mobile driving license or related technologies.



  





 Moreover we believe that you:
 


* Are a do-er that gets excited about developing new ideas and proposing innovative solutions
* Use feedback and reflection to develop self-awareness, personal and professional strengths as well as address new development areas
* Can collaborate with other product teams to help and provide the best end-user experience
* Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance
* Use straightforward feedback, in a structured and constructive way, when communicating with others
* Seek opportunities to automate and document your work



  





 We value previous experience in agile methodology and that you enjoy working within all aspects of agile development. To solve problems we strive to pair-program when possible and we think that you have the same mindset. Just like us, you are passionate about your craft and take ownership over your own development.
 



  





**We offer** 




 Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.
 



 We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com!

title: Master Thesis: AI-Driven Performance Analysis in Radio Access Networks
description:
**Join our Team**

 Are you ready to explore how Artificial Intelligence, including Generative AI (GenAI), can transform telecom network performance analysis? This master’s thesis at Ericsson offers you the chance to innovate in Radio Access Network (RAN) performance evaluation, using AI-driven techniques to enhance customer experience. You will work hands-on with anonymized lab and field data, applying advanced analytics to identify key performance indicators, detect anomalies, and even automate report generation. Alongside Ericsson’s RAN Services team in Stockholm, you’ll help shape the future of network intelligence.

 If you want to see your research turn into real-world impact and help redefine how next-generation networks are monitored and improved, this thesis opportunity is for you
