 With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University and SciLifeLab an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favourable conditions.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 Further information about the position can be obtained from Dr. Marta Carroni, phone: +46 8 16 10 13, marta.carroni@scilifelab.se, and Stefan Fleischmann, stefan.fleischmann@scilifelab.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the position at Stockholm University’s recruitment system. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: Media Analyst (Measurement & Attribution)
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a
 **Media Analyst** 
 (Measurement & Attribution) to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This is a hands-on, insight-driven role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, media, and business impact. You’ll deliver actionable insights to global and regional marketing teams, helping optimize media investments and drive marketing effectiveness across channels.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Media Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Analyse media performance across channels by applying insights from advanced marketing analytics techniques such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Regression-Based Attribution (RBA), scenario modeling, and media mix evaluation.
* Generate actionable insights, recommend budget reallocations, and guide strategy adjustments to improve ROI and support growth.
* Build and present reports and dashboards that clearly communicate insights to global and regional stakeholders.
* Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy.
* Partner with regional marketing teams to support local implementation and ensure global consistency.
* Collaborate closely with the Attribution Lead to align on methodology, priorities, and the measurement roadmap, while contributing to a test-and-learn culture by continuously refining approaches based on performance insights.
* Work with cross-functional teams including media, CRM, strategy, finance, and technical product teams to embed insights into planning and execution.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Global Marketing function, collaborating with media operations, CRM, strategy and planning, controlling, technical product teams, and regional marketing teams. You’ll also work closely with the Attribution Lead to ensure insights drive measurable business impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone with...
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience in media analytics, preferably from a media agency, global retailer, or measurement supplier.
* Strong understanding of media KPIs and how to steer performance across digital channels.
* Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling.
* Experience with tools such as GA4, Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, and visualization platforms like Power BI or Looker Studio.
* Understanding of privacy-first innovation in measurement systems.
* Strong business acumen with the ability to connect insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
* Proactive team player with strong communication skills, able to simplify technical concepts and drive data-driven marketing in a global, fast-paced environment.
* Background in digital marketing or paid media is a strong plus, especially if combined with analytical capabilities.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Technology Specialist - Support Team
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Join our dynamic team and play a vital role in delivering unparalleled support for our groundbreaking technology while being part of a passionate global community!** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE POSITION** 




 Join our Support Team as a Technology Specialist and become a key figure in our global software and installation support division. As a Technology Specialist, you'll immerse yourself in the world of Toptracer Range technology, providing expert assistance to both customers and colleagues facing various technical challenges.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 
 Expert Technical Support: Serve as a Toptracer Range technology expert, offering technical assistance, issue resolution, and acting as a liaison for escalations to development or other business units.
 



**Global Support:** 
 Assist international customers, ensuring clear and effective communication on issue progress, risk assessment, and impact analysis for all stakeholders.
 



**Community Engagement:** 
 Engage with the global community, contributing positive suggestions to enhance the customer experience.
 



  





**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS** 




**Experience:** 
 Minimum 2 years in a similar technical support environment.
 



**Technical Proficiency:** 
 Comfortable with command line applications, experience in Linux and Ubuntu environments.
 



**Independence and Collaboration:** 
 Ability to work independently and proactively as well as within a team structure.
 



**Communication:** 
 Fluent in written and spoken English, with exceptional communication skills for internal and external correspondence.
 



  





***Preferred Experience or Background:***




**Customer-Centric Approach:** 
 Prior experience in supporting international customers with a clear understanding of risk assessment and impact analysis.
 



**Knowledge Management:** 
 Proven ability to build and maintain an internal knowledge base for efficient knowledge sharing.
 



**Innovative Mindset:** 
 Actively contribute to the global community with positive suggestions to elevate the customer experience.
 



**Passion for Golf:** 
 Enthusiasm for golfing or an interest in the sport is a plus!
 



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




  





 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Solution Architect – AI and Cloud
description:
*Design and deliver future-proof AI and cloud architectures, guiding enterprise clients from strategy to execution.* 




***Join a client-facing team designing and delivering the future of scalable AI and cloud solutions.***




 Algorithma is scaling from trusted advisory into a full-fledged AI services company. We are building scalable, high-quality AI offerings that deliver real value to clients across industries.
 



  





 As part of this journey, we are expanding our Solution Architecture team. This team is part of the CTO organization and is client-facing, working in the space between business needs and delivery execution. We design future-proof architectures, guide enterprise clients through adoption of AI agents and automation, and make sure what gets built is both scalable and secure.
 



  





 This role is not about sitting behind the scenes writing slide decks. It is about sitting with clients, shaping solutions, and then working alongside delivery teams to bring them to life. If you have done your time in a big organization and want to get closer to the tech and the impact, this is the place for you.
   




**Your role** 

 You will be working closely with our CTO and senior architects to:
 


* Design and deliver AI agent solutions that integrate into enterprise environments.
* Architect and deploy scalable cloud-based systems (Azure, GCP, AWS).
* Support the build-out of reusable frameworks, libraries, and knowledge systems.
* Ensure solutions meet governance, security, and scalability standards.
* Explore new LLMs, orchestration frameworks, and automation opportunities.
* Collaborate with delivery teams to bridge technical design and client needs.


**About you** 

 We welcome applicants from different backgrounds and levels of experience, from early-career technologists with strong potential to experienced architects. What matters most is your ability to learn quickly, collaborate, and apply technology to solve client problems.
 



  





 You bring some mix of the following:
 


* A minimum of two years’ experience in a relevant role. More senior applicants are very welcome too.
* A master’s degree in a relevant field is considered a plus but not required.
* Experience or strong interest in large language models (LLMs), prompt engineering, or agent frameworks.
* Hands-on knowledge of cloud services (Azure, GCP, or AWS).
* Understanding of APIs, containerization, and CI/CD.
* Curiosity for solution design and system architecture.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.


**What we offer** 
* The chance to help shape Algorithma’s AI-first delivery model.
* Direct mentorship from senior colleagues.
* A collaborative culture focused on learning and innovation.
* Career growth opportunities, whether you are starting out or already experienced.
* Competitive compensation and the energy of a company on the path to global expansion.



  




**Ready to join?** 

 If you want to move beyond PowerPoints and actually design and deliver the future of AI services, we would love to hear from you. Send your CV and a short note on why you are excited about working with AI agents and cloud solutions.

title: Business Analyst – Banking & Payments Domain
company_industry: Information Services, Design Services, and Architecture and Planning
description:
**Job role:** 
 Business Analyst – Banking & Payments Domain
 



**Work Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Work mode :** 
 Hybrid ( 2-3 days work from office)
 



**Experience Level:** 
 7–10 years preferred
 



  





**Job Summary:** 




 We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with deep domain expertise in Banking, particularly in the Payments space. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of core payment functionalities, payment methods (e.g., SEPA, SWIFT, RTGS, ACH), and hands-on experience in data analytics projects. Familiarity with SAFe Agile methodologies and the ability to work across business and technical teams is essential.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 •Gather, analyze, and document business requirements related to payment systems, transaction processing, and regulatory compliance.
 



 •Work closely with stakeholders to define end-to-end payment workflows, including SEPA, SWIFT, and domestic payment schemes.
 



 •Collaborate with data teams to support data sourcing, data quality, and analytics initiatives.
 



 •Translate business needs into functional and non-functional requirements for development teams.
 



 •Support UAT planning, test case creation, and defect triaging for payment and data-related features.
 



 •Participate in SAFe Agile ceremonies including PI Planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
 



 •Act as a liaison between business users, product owners, and technical teams to ensure alignment and delivery.
 



 •Contribute to the creation of process models, data flow diagrams, and user stories.
 



  





**Required Skills & Experience:** 




 •7–10 years of experience as a Business Analyst in the Banking domain, with a strong focus on Payments.
 



 •In-depth knowledge of payment systems, clearing and settlement, and cross-border transactions.
 



 •Familiarity with SEPA, SWIFT, ISO 20022, ACH, and real-time payments.
 



 •Experience working on data analytics or data management projects.
 



 •Strong understanding of data governance, data lineage, and data quality frameworks.
 



 •Proficiency in tools like JIRA, Confluence, Excel, SQL, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
 



 •Excellent documentation skills – BRDs, FRDs, user stories, and process flows.
 



  





**Soft Skills:** 




 •Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
 



 •Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
 



 •Ability to work in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities.
 



 •Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and compliance.
 



 •Proactive, self-driven, and adaptable to change.
 



  





**Agile & SAFe Ways of Working:** 




 •Experience working in SAFe Agile or similar scaled agile environments.
 



 •Participation in PI Planning, backlog grooming, sprint planning, and system demos.
 



 •Ability to write clear and concise user stories and acceptance criteria.
 



 •Familiarity with Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and Program Increments (PIs).
 



  





 Preferred Qualifications:
 



 •Certifications such as CBAP, PMI-PBA, or SAFe Agilist.
 



 •Experience with data platforms or cloud-based analytics solutions.
 



 •Exposure to regulatory reporting and compliance frameworks in banking.

title: Junior Software System Architect
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Are you a recent graduate eager to make a real-world impact through technology? At Getinge, we invite you to launch your career with a one-year internship as a Junior Systems Architect, where your passion for innovation can help shape the future of healthcare. Join us and play a key role in harmonizing our digital product offerings with leading interoperability standards and designing software that directly contributes to saving lives worldwide. As part of our agile and supportive team, you’ll have the chance to learn from experienced professionals while working at the forefront of medical informatics and advanced analytics
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct pre-studies for new product initiatives.
* Analyze and map information to standardized concepts, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and standards.
* Contribute to the specification and development of proof-of-concept designs.
* Support development teams in implementing and effectively utilizing interoperability standards.


 This position is based in our newly renovated facilities in Solna and offer a hybrid setup with 3 days at the office and 2 days from home on average.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To be successful in this position, we believe that you have the following qualifications:
   

  

* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Medical Technology, or a related field
* Demonstrated interest in medical interoperability (e.g., through coursework, student projects, or similar experiences)
* Familiarity with relevant standards such as FHIR, HL7 v2, or SDC
* Demonstrated interest in software product development (e.g., through coursework, student projects, or similar experiences)
* Strong motivation and willingness to learn
* Excellent communication skills
* Fluency in English


 Experience in the following areas will be considered an asset:
   

  

* Completion of thesis projects in medical technology, life sciences, or related domains
* Hands-on experience with artificial intelligence, including machine learning or data analysis applications
* Participation in hackathons, innovation challenges, or industry competitions
* Prior internships or work experience in medical technology, healthcare IT, or software development teams
* Knowledge of cybersecurity principles as applied to healthcare environments
* Experience with programming languages commonly used in medical informatics (such as Python or Java)
* Involvement in open-source or collaborative software projects


 In addition to your technical skills, we highly value your personality. At Getinge we see ourselves as proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organization's capabilities.  We are Team Players, Forward Thinkers and Game Changers. We think you will thrive in a high-expectation environment and have an interest in our products.
   

  

**Why join Getinge**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than Oct 20th.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Jonas Andersson at Jonas.l.andersson@getinge.com or Recruiter Sofia Ekstrand at sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Student Worker - AI Prompt Engineer
description:
****Join Telavox as an AI Prompt Engineer 🎙️****
 Are you fascinated by the intersection of language, creativity, and AI? We’re expanding our AI Voice Agent Platform and looking for a part-time Prompt Engineer who thrives on shaping how humans interact with technology.
   

  

 In this role, based in Malmö or Stockholm, you’ll help us design the words and structures that bring our AI Voice Agents to life. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers, product designers, and AI specialists to refine conversations that feel natural, helpful, and engaging.
   

  

 If you’re curious about AI and excited by the challenge of blending technology with human expression, this is your opportunity!
   

  

**About The Job**
 You’ll be working on evolving the conversational layer of our AI Voice Agents. Your mission is to craft, test, and refine prompts that guide our AI toward high-quality, human-like interactions. Together with the team, you’ll experiment with different scenarios, analyze results, and iterate until the conversation feels just right.
   

  

**Your Day-to-day Work May Include**
* Developing, testing, and refining prompts for a wide range of conversational contexts.
* Collaborating with product and engineering teams to design voice interactions that feel natural and user-friendly.
* Analyzing AI outputs to improve clarity, tone, and effectiveness.
* Helping shape the voice and personality of our AI agents.


**About You**
 You’re detail-oriented and creative, with a knack for understanding how language works. You enjoy experimenting, iterating, and fine-tuning until things “click.” You’re motivated by creating user experiences that feel smooth, natural, and human.
   

  

**Key Skills And Traits We’re Looking For**
* A strong feel for language and tone, with excellent communication skills.
* Comfortable with technology and eager to learn.
* Creative, curious, and systematic in your problem-solving.
* Interested in AI, voice, and shaping the future of human–machine interaction.


 This is a part-time role with flexible hours. You’ll have the freedom to work remotely, but we also expect you to join us in Stockholm or Malmö for collaboration when needed.
   

  

****Join us at Telavox 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect.
   

  

 Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication.
   

  

 We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
   

  

**How to apply!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

  

  

**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Investment Analyst
description:
At Multitude, we’re more than just a listed European FinTech company—we’re a team driving financial innovation. We provide digital lending and online banking services that empower consumers, SMEs, and FinTechs to grow and succeed.
   

  

 Powered by our Growth Platform, we operate through three business units: Ferratum, offering seamless mobile banking for consumers; CapitalBox, providing flexible financing for SMEs; and Multitude Bank, supporting non-bank lenders and FinTechs.
   

  

 In 2024, we achieved €263.7 million in revenue and €20.2 million in net profit, reflecting strong financial growth. With 700+ employees across 25 countries, we’re shaping the future of finance in 17 markets. Founded in 2005 in Finland, Multitude is listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange (MULT).
   

  

 Multitude Bank, regulated by the Malta Financial Services Authority, specialises in wholesale banking. As part of Multitude Group, it provides credit facilities and payment solutions to non-bank lenders and FinTechs, helping them scale operations. With a strong focus on security, innovation, and financial ecosystem growth, it plays a key role in Europe’s evolving digital finance landscape.
   

  

 We are looking for a detail-oriented and inquisitive Investment Analyst to support the strategic growth of Multitude Bank’s investment portfolio. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to a high-impact cross-border investment strategy that aligns with our financial goals and risk appetite.
   

  

**Your Focus**
* Assist in the construction and optimisation of the Bank’s investment portfolio.
* Review and assess potential investment opportunities in line with portfolio strategy and risk-return objectives.
* Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders for due diligence and post-investment reviews.
* Prepare reports, models, and presentation materials for investment committees.
* Monitor investment performance and market trends to support data-driven decision-making.
* Track compliance with investment covenants and portfolio risk metrics.
* Contribute to ongoing investment research and innovation within the team.


**Must-have**
 Required skills & qualifications:
   

  

* 2–3 years of experience in investment management or financial analysis.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, or finance.
* Exceptional attention to detail and organisational skills.
* Strong analytical capabilities with an inquisitive and proactive mindset.
* Clear and concise communication skills.


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience in banking or fintech investment portfolios.
* Understanding of structured finance or credit-based investments.
* Familiarity with investment reporting and risk frameworks.


**We Offer**
 At Multitude, we believe in empowering our employees to thrive personally and professionally. Here's what you can look forward to:
   

  

* A Truly Global Workplace – work with professionals from 40+ nationalities, bringing diverse expertise, perspectives, and a collaborative international culture.
* Hybrid & Flexible Work – we support work-life balance with remote work options and modern office spaces across Europe.
* A Culture of Growth – we invest in your future, offering LinkedIn Learning, mentorship, and professional development programmes, including HiPo and leadership development initiatives to support career advancement.
* Financial Growth Opportunities – benefit from our share purchase matching programme, allowing you to invest in your future with matched contributions and long-term financial rewards.
* Workation Programme – work remotely from different countries for up to 2 months per year, experiencing new cultures while staying connected and productive.
* Private Health Insurance – access comprehensive medical coverage to support your health.


 Kindly note that by proceeding, you confirm that you have read and accepted our Recruitment Privacy Policy - https://www.multitude.com/~/media/Files/M/Multitude/financial-reports/2025/Multitude\_Groups\_Recruitment\_Privacy\_Policy.pdf

title: Business Expert - Store Payments
description:
**Job Description**
**ABOUT THE ROLE**
 As a Business Expert within Store Payments, you will play a critical role in delivering seamless payment experiences for customers and smooth financial integrations for our stakeholders. You will work closely with product managers, business experts, engineers, and other stakeholders across the H&M Group, you will focus on prioritizing desired product outcomes and translating them into measurable business value.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify, analyze, implement and document business needs related to store payments enablement, ensuring clear and actionable requirements for solution development in line with strategic goals
* Act as a global project leader, driving and coordinating cross-functional payment process changes and delivering new payment solutions across various sales markets
* Contribute specialized expertise to enhance the value of store payment solutions for both in-store end-users and customers.
* Partner with payment stakeholders across the organization, such as the sales organization, treasury, core platforms, operations layers and commercial procurement to explore improvements that increase customer satisfaction and enable new business opportunities.
* Support solution implementation by conducting UAT, acceptance testing, and change management while ensuring stakeholder engagement and smooth adoption.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 The Store Payments Enablement team is a vital part of H&M’s Business Tech organization, operating in the Component layer within the Product Development & Engineering Tech Center. You will work with a team of Technical Engineers, Solution Architects, Program Manager and Business Experts to drive our mission to design and deliver secure, composable payment solutions that are cost-efficient and meet competitive time-to-market demands. As a global team, we support card and alternative payment methods for all stores, brands, and markets. Our team is led by a Product Manager and our vision is to enable fast, secure, and frictionless payments. With a passion for technology while being flexible and open minded, we strive to deliver best-in-class services for our customers and stakeholders. Join us in shaping the future of in-store payments at H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We’re looking for people who have:*
* Ability to act as a global project leader, driving and coordinating cross-functional payment process changes and delivering new payment solutions across various sales markets
* Experience in Payments/Finance: Background in payments, finance, or working with external vendors, including negotiating and defining requirements.
* Knowledge of Payment Systems & Financial Integrations: An understanding of payment processing, financial flows, and integrations, particularly in retail systems.
* Project Management Expertise: Proficient in leading projects through different project management methodologies, including Agile (Scrum, Kanban) and traditional approaches (e.g. Waterfall) with experience delivering projects using diverse frameworks.
* Business/Product Development: Experience in business development, product development, or product management as well as providing user training for system adoption.


*And people who are:*
* Analytical and have a strong ability to analyze data and use insights to drive decisions and improvements.
* Able to lead independently and have strong self-leadership skills with the ability to make informed decisions and drive strategic direction.
* Able to communicate in English, with the ability to explain complex concepts clearly.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
* In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: IT-ansvarig | Tenneco | Mölnlycke/Arendal
description:
Vill du vara med och driva digitalisering och utveckling i en global industrikoncern? Trivs du med att kombinera praktisk IT-support med strategiskt arbete kring infrastruktur och system? Lockas du av att arbeta nära både produktion och verksamhet i en internationell miljö? Då kan rollen som IT-ansvarig hos Tenneco vara helt rätt för dig - skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som IT-ansvarig på Tenneco ansvarar du för att stödja och utveckla IT-infrastrukturen vid anläggningarna i Mölnlycke (Powertrain) och Arendal (Clean Air). Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt med allt från incident- och ärendehantering till drift och utveckling av servrar, nätverk, backup-miljöer och säkerhetslösningar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med globala IT-team, leverantörer och lokala verksamheter för att säkerställa stabilitet, efterlevnad och effektivitet i IT-miljön.
   

  

 Du driver även anläggningsspecifika projekt, exempelvis utveckling av produktionsnära system till exempel ERP Jeeves, Axxos, QlikView), digitaliseringsinitiativ samt integration av data mellan lokala system och koncernens lösningar. En viktig del av ditt arbete blir att förenkla och förbättra processer, stötta verksamheten med tekniska lösningar och bidra till en modern och framtidssäker IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din profil** 
 Vi söker dig som trivs i en bred roll där du får kombinera support, drift och utveckling. Du är analytisk, strukturerad och självgående, samtidigt som du uppskattar samarbete och är duktig på att kommunicera både på svenska och engelska. Du har lätt för att prioritera och gillar att arbeta nära verksamheten i en internationell miljö.
   

  

**För att lyckas i denna roll bör du ha följande kvalifikationer:**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, datavetenskap eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av drift och support av servrar, nätverk (WAN/LAN), backup-miljöer och klienthantering.
* Erfarenhet av EDI och systemintegration.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Active Directory, SCCM/SMS och Outlook.
* Erfarenhet av produktionsnära system (ERP, automation, PLC, RF-teknologi med mera).
* Kunskap i Power BI och andra BI-lösningar.
* Tidigare arbete i en global organisation med höga krav på regelefterlevnad och informationssäkerhet.


**Vad du blir en del av** 
 Tenneco är en av världens ledande utvecklare, tillverkare och marknadsförare av fordonsprodukter för både originalutrustning och eftermarknadskunder. Företaget har cirka 78 000 medarbetare vid mer än 300 anläggningar världen över. Genom sina fyra affärsområden - Motorparts, Ride Performance, Clean Air och Powertrain - driver Tenneco utvecklingen av global mobilitet genom att leverera teknologiska lösningar till en mångfald av marknader, inklusive personbilar, lastbilar, off-highway-fordon, industri, motorsport och eftermarknaden.
   

  

**Ansökan** 
 Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Experis för Tennecos räkning, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd direkt av Tenneco. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryterare Susanne Alderling på susanne.alderling@se.experis.com och Mark Ferrer på mark.ferrer@jeffersonwells.se
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, ansök gärna så snart som möjligt dock senast den 31 oktober 2025.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: System Technician
company: SYSTEM INTEGRATION AIR TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT AB
company_industry: Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing, Technology, Information and Media, and Computer and Network Security
description:
*Vill du kombinera ditt intresse för Linux, nätverk och IT-miljöer med möjligheten att resa och arbeta internationellt? Detta är en unik chans för dig som trivs i en varierande roll där du både får arbeta med installationer, support och drift i avancerade IT-miljöer. Bli en del av SiATM och bidra till att utveckla och drifta system som används av flygledare världen över!* 




  





**Information om tjänsten** 




 SiATM är ett svenskt teknikbolag som utvecklar och levererar skräddarsydda applikationer inom ATM (Air Traffic Management). Slutanvändarna är flygledare som styr, övervakar och kommunicerar med trafiken både på mark och i luftrum.
 



  





 Professionals Nord söker i samarbete med SiATM en systemtekniker. Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering, vilket innebär att du anställs direkt hos SiATM. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Professionals Nord och alla frågor om tjänsten besvaras därför av oss.
 



  





**Du erbjuds att vara en del av** 



* Ett teknikdrivet bolag med en viktig samhällsfunktion
* En roll med stor variation – från drift och support till installationer och resor
* Möjlighet att arbeta internationellt och vara delaktig i implementeringar på plats hos kund
* En miljö med hög teknisk nivå och stort fokus på säkerhet



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som systemtekniker hos SiATM kommer du arbeta i företagets interna IT-miljö samt med kundprojekt. Rollen innebär både daglig drift och teknisk support samt resor för att stötta kunder internationellt.
 



  





 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Drift och underhåll av interna IT-miljöer, inklusive nätverk, servrar och klienter
* Installation och konfiguration av system och mjukvara i Linux-miljö
* Support vid kundprojekt – exempelvis installation av hårdvara, kabeldragning, racks
* Arbeta med säkerhet och VPN-lösningar i internationella projekt
* Delta i implementeringar och systeminstallationer på plats hos kund, ofta utomlands några månader per år



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har utbildning inom IT (exempelvis högskoleingenjör eller likvärdig bakgrund)
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Linux och grundläggande nätverk
* Är tekniskt nyfiken och gillar att arbeta nära hårdvara, operativsystem och IT-arkitektur
* Är bekväm med att resa i tjänsten, både kortare resor och perioder utomlands
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. För att trivas i rollen är du lösningsorienterad, strukturerad och tycker om att hugga i där det behövs. Du gillar en miljö där arbetsuppgifterna varierar från detaljerad felsökning till installationer och kundkontakt.
 



  





**Praktisk information** 




**Start:** 
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Plats:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
 



**Urval:** 
 Sker löpande
 



**Kontakt:** 
 filippa.furugren@pn.se

title: Data Scientist, BizOps
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**Data Scientist (BizOps)**
 The Business Operations Team at Wolt focuses on solving country- and region-specific marketplace challenges and is tasked with growing revenue and profitability. To do this, the team works to understand the underlying drivers of growth at the market level and identifies the best opportunities to have an impact.
   

  

 We take on a diverse set of challenging questions in the geospatial, logistics, and economics spaces, focused on helping balance Wolt's multi-sided marketplace across an ecosystem of courier partners, customers, and merchant partners to achieve our topline and bottomline plans. Our work sees us optimizing the experience of our customers, contributing to providing growing income opportunities for our courier partners and merchants, and driving growth, efficiency, and profitability for Wolt overall.
   

  

 We work with operations teams across 30 markets globally. Our core work covers customer retention, the economic efficiency of all our markets, and geospatial analysis - but our scope frequently expands to tackle issues beyond these topics.
   

  

**The role:**
 In this role, you will work closely with the regional leadership team,
 **partnering with our General Managers and heads of operations and marketing in multiple markets.**
 This isn’t a normal Data Science role. You’ll combine strong technical skills and
 **business acumen** 
 to partner with our regional leadership team. You will be the regional expert on connecting the dots across the business to help optimize our multi-sided marketplace. You will provide recommendations and consultation on business-critical issues through rigorous analysis paired with structured, big-picture thinking.
   

  

**Day-to-day activities:**
* Running data-driven research to uncover new insights and opportunities to help drive growth in the regions and fast track our operational strategy on a daily and weekly basis.
* Working with Country GMs and Heads of Marketing and Operations to size and prioritize initiatives.
* Some traveling to the local markets is expected.


**About you:**
 You’re not the typical Data Scientist. You have a passion for understanding the details behind the numbers and finding opportunities that really help the business hit its goals rather than building perfect models.
   

  

 You understand how to balance rigor with speed and can help your business stakeholders navigate those tradeoffs as well.
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, consulting, or a related quantitative role.
* Ability to delve into ambiguous problems for “treasure-hunting” with data and find creative new ways to think about our business.
* Determination to initiate and lead/own strategic projects to completion in a scrappy environment with a cross-functional team.
* Innate curiosity to understand how things work and a first-principles approach to problem-solving.
* Proficiency in at least one programming language, preferably Python.
* Ability to support & influence senior leadership in making critical decisions.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Head of Customer Service to Speeron!
description:
*Do you want to lead a customer service function in transformation and create real impact for customers and the business? Do you thrive on driving digitalization, building teams, and working data-driven with SLAs and KPIs? Then apply for the Head of Customer Service at Speeron!*
**Your workday**
 As Head of Customer Service at Speeron, you’ll lead the shift from traditional email and phone support to a modern, portal-based service—introducing digital tools and new workflows that make it easier for customers to log issues, track progress, and access help articles independently. You own the operating model: workflows, processes, SLAs, and KPIs that deliver faster responses, higher quality, and better customer experience. You’ll implement and drive adoption of tools (e.g., Microsoft Dynamics 365/CE), build a knowledge base and reporting, and ensure consistent ways of working across sites.
   

  

 As Head of Customer Service, you will lead the Stockholm-based support team and collaborate closely with project leaders and technicians who also contribute to support and installations. The wider organization spans Sweden, Poland, Finland, Norway, Denmark Baltics and Germany, so you’ll coordinate across locations and time zones, handle escalations, run regular reviews with key customers, and partner tightly with Sales, Projects, and Finance as well as system vendors.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To succeed in the role Head of Customer Service, we believe you have:
   

  

* Proven experience building and leading customer service teams, ideally internationally
* Strong change leader who can introduce new ways of working and drive portal/self-service adoption
* Comfortable working with data, SLAs, and KPIs to steer performance
* Experience with CRM/ERP (ideally Microsoft Dynamics 365/CE, Sales / Business Central)
* Excellent collaboration skills with internal and external partners
* Confident in customer dialogue, escalation handling, and expectation management
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written


 As a person, you are customer-focused, clear, and empathetic. You take ownership, inspire through change, and enjoy combining daily operational follow-up with long-term improvement. Analytical, curious, and pragmatic describe you well.
   

  

**Contact**
 In this recruitment, Speeron collaborates with Wise IT. If you want to know more about the job, contact the responsible Recruitment Consultant, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se. Unfortunately, Wise IT cannot accept applications via email, as we protect your personal privacy. You can read more about how we process personal data according to GDPR in Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

**Are we a good fit**
 Speeron is the leading integration and technology partner for the hospitality industry in the Nordic Region. We help create the Digital Guest Journey by streamlining hotel guest flows and adding sales opportunities throughout the guest experience – from arrival to check out. All parts of the Digital Guest Journey are fully integrated with the Speeron NEXT Platform. With contactless solutions and support for any PMS, Payment and Locking system, our solution will help any hotel to serve their guests more securely and fast. Speeron provides all infotainment and communication needs for hospitality, including networks, wireless HSIA and back office solutions, IPTV, digital signage, head ends and 24/7 support. https://speeron.com/

title: Administrativ koordinator med It-ansvar
description:
**Administrativ koordinator med It-ansvar** 





 Skeppsholmen Sotheby’s International Realty
 




  





**Plats:** 

 Stockholm (100% på plats)
 




**Anställningsform:** 

 Tillsvidare, heltid (100%)
 




**Arbetstider:** 

 Enligt schema, våra öppettider är månad -
 

 fredag kl 8-18
 




**Start:** 

 Omgående
 




  
 



**Om oss** 





 Skeppsholmen Sotheby’s International Realty är Sveriges ledande fastighetsmäkleri inom premiumsegmentet. Vi finns representerade i Stockholm, Göteborg, Helsingborg, Båstad, Torekov, Skanör-Falsterbo, Gotland och Åre och är en del av ett globalt nätverk med kontor i över 80 länder. Vi hjälper våra uppdragsgivare att sälja sina drömboenden, alltid med kvalitet, diskretion och service i fokus.
 




  






 Nu söker vi en 
 
**Administrativ koordinator med It-ansvar** 

 till vårt Stockholmskontor. Här blir du en central del av vårt team och en viktig länk mellan mäklare, kunder och våra system. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där kvalitet, professionalism och servicekänsla genomsyrar allt vi gör. 
 




  





**Rollen** 





 I rollen som 
 
**Administrativ koordinator med It-ansvar** 

 kombinerar du klassiska administrativa uppgifter med It-stöd till våra mäklare samt tar självklart hand om våra kunder på bästa sätt. Du ser till att våra processer fungerar från prospekt till system och dokument. Du fungerar som kontaktperson mot externa leverantörer och säkerställer en smidig administration. Erfarenhet av mäklarsystem, gärna Vitec Express, är meriterande.
 




  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Stödja mäklarna i deras dagliga arbete med administration och kundkontakt på kontoret.
* Kontaktperson till externa it och telefoni leverantörer.
* Arbeta i mäklarsystem (Vitec Express).
* Koordinera dokument, avtal och register.
* Vara en serviceinriktad kontaktperson för It frågor och administrera Office 365, SharePoint, OneDrive avseende behörigheter och struktur.
* Ansvara för licenser, inköp av datorer och mobiler med hjälp av vår It- leverantör.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Är strukturerad, noggrann, och har en problemlösande inställning.
* Är ansvarstagande och trivs i en roll där du både har kundkontakt och är support till våra mäklare i form av It- stöd och administrativa uppgifter.
* Har goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office/356 (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook).
* Är trygg i svenska och engelska.
* Meriterande: Vitec Express (mäklarsystem), World Press, Adobe InDesign/Photoshop.



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i ett väletablerat företag med ett premiumvarumärke och global räckvidd.
* Varierande och utvecklande arbetsdagar där It och administration möts.
* Möjlighet att utvecklas och ta ansvar i en organisation med höga ambitioner och hjärtlig stämning.



  






 Är du vår nästa kollega? Skicka din ansökan till 📧 
 

 Emelie.s@sothebysrealty.se
 

 . 
 




  






 Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas så snart vi hittar rätt person.

title: HEAD OF AGILE & AD PRACTICES
description:
**Head of Agile & Application Development Practices**
 Are you someone who thrives on driving transformation and enabling teams to deliver high-quality digital solutions? Do you have a passion for agile ways of working and a strategic mindset for modern application development? If so, our Head of Agile & Application Development Practices role might be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

 As Head of Agile & AD Practices, you will lead the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working by embedding a unified, business-integrated agile operating model across Digital & IT and the wider SAS organisation, while also driving the evolution of application development practices to enable scalable, high-quality software delivery.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this exciting and dynamic role, you will oversee the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working and application development practices.
   

  

 You will tackle the intricate task of designing and implementing a mature agile setup anchored in agile frameworks, while modernizing engineering capabilities across teams. As the main point of contact for agile enablement and development excellence, you will coordinate with Digital & IT, SAS business units, and external partners to embed agile principles, roles, and ceremonies into cross-functional teams. Your ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders will be crucial in driving agile adoption, uplifting technical capabilities, and aligning delivery with strategic goals.
   

  

**Your Ability To Collaborate Will Be Crucial As You**
* Lead and coach a team of agile professionals (coaches and scrum masters) to support agile adoption across business and IT.
* Define and implement agile metrics, governance models, and continuous improvement practices.
* Facilitate agile training, onboarding, and capability uplift across SAS and its partners.
* Act as a change agent to foster a culture of collaboration, transparency, and adaptive delivery.
* Lead the transformation of application development practices, including the adoption of modern engineering principles such as CI/CD, DevOps, automated testing, and cloud-native development.
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to align agile delivery with technical excellence and scalable architecture.
* Ensure integration of agile ways of working with robust application development lifecycles and tooling.


**The Team**
 As the Head of Agile & AD Practices within our newly created Office of the CIO in Digital & IT, you will play a pivotal leadership role in shaping how SAS delivers value through agile ways of working and modern engineering practices. You will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to collaboration, innovation, and excellence.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead the alignment of agile and application development practices across SAS, working closely with product owners, developers, scrum masters, and transformation teams. You will set the direction for how agile principles and engineering standards are embedded into cross-functional teams, ensuring consistency, scalability, and continuous improvement. As a key driver of SAS’s agile community of practice, you will foster a culture of transparency, learning, and delivery excellence—communicating effectively across the organization to champion agile and technical maturity.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Deep understanding of agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and scaling agile in large organisations.
* Strong leadership, coaching, and facilitation skills.
* Ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Strategic thinking with hands-on delivery mindset.
* Excellent communication and change management capabilities.
* Strong grasp of software development lifecycle, engineering principles, and agile technical practices.
* 7+ years of experience in agile roles, including 5+ years leading enterprise-level agile transformations.
* Proven track record implementing SAFe or similar frameworks in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.
* Experience working with both in-house and offshore delivery models.
* Demonstrated experience leading large-scale application development transformations, including modernizing engineering practices and delivery pipelines.
* University degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) certification or equivalent is a strong plus.
* Commitment to work from the office 3 days per week.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/12/25
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About 0TO9:** 




  






 Team Is All
 




 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
 



  






 0TO9 exists to change that.
 




 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
 



 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
 



 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
 



 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
 



  





**About the role:** 



* Design, build, and maintain scalable ELT pipelines into
 **Snowflake** 
 using
 **dbt** 
 and
 **AWS** 
 services (e.g., S3, Lambda)
* Develop clean, well-tested dbt models and enforce version control and CI/CD.
* Implement robust data quality, observability, and alerting across pipelines; proactively troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
* Define and evolve data models (star/snowflake schemas) to support analytics, product, and operational reporting.
* Partner with business stakeholders to translate requirements into reliable data products with clear SLAs.
* Ensure security, governance, and compliance (IAM/roles, data access controls, lineage, PII handling).
* Contribute to engineering best practices (code reviews, reusable components, automation, documentation).
* Support downstream BI/analytics teams with well-documented datasets and performance guidance.



  





**About you:** 



* Strong SQL and Python, hands-on experience with Snowflake and dbt
* Solid AWS data experience (at least S3 and Lambda)
* Proven track record building and operating reliable ELT/ETL pipelines in a modern cloud data stack.
* Sound data modeling skills (dimensional modeling) and understanding of data lifecycle, quality, and lineage.
* Good business grasp: can clarify use cases, challenge requirements, and deliver data products that drive decisions.
* Git-based workflows and CI/CD familiarity



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience with Fivetran and/or modern BI tools such as Omni (Analytics) or Looker.
* Data observability tooling experience; orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Dagster) exposure.
* Security/governance knowledge
* Previous FinTech or finance experience



  





**What we offer:** 



* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm
* Strong opportunities for growth and development

title: Product Operations Lead (Fixed-Term)
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Operations Lead to join the Courier group. The Courier group at Wolt operates with the mission of providing a high-quality delivery experience for our Consumers, becoming the most-loved platform for Couriers, and being the most efficient logistics engine in the industry.
   

  

 As a Product Operations Lead, your core responsibility is to coordinate and support cross-functional teams to ensure that the Courier group’s product initiatives align with Wolt’s strategic goals while maintaining a focus on long-term sustainable growth and innovation. You’ll play a crucial role in driving strategic alignment and operational excellence within the Courier group. This includes centralizing and harmonizing key processes, allowing the Product Leads to focus on building innovative products that drive the business forward.
   

  

 You will work with an incredibly talented team of product managers, designers, engineers, and data analysts in a high-visibility role. You’ll be responsible for leading the roadmap planning for the Courier group, ensuring transparency and alignment across teams. This involves setting the direction for multiple projects throughout the product lifecycle, partnering with business and operations stakeholders, and gaining a deep understanding of our end-users.
   

  

 You will also lead high-profile initiatives, such as AI- driven product innovation. Additionally, you will facilitate best practices, drive innovation through ideation and pilot programs, and provide financial modeling support to enable data-driven decisions. You'll help build a strong product community, celebrate team achievements, and support Product Leads in their career growth.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 You could come to this role from a variety of backgrounds, but ideally, you have:
   

  

* Plenty of experience in Product Operations and / or Product Management, preferably in e-commerce or marketplaces
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and proven ability to influence cross-functional teams
* A mixture of a deep understanding of product processes, ability to drive efficiency and growth targets, and a go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in collaborating with cross-functional teams, particularly product managers, designers, finance experts and data analysts


 Next steps
   

  

 Fixed term contract for 12 months with a possibility to prolong it.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for operational excellence and product innovation, we want to hear from you! The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Security Engineer - Network Security
description:
**Job Description**
 Join our Cyber Security Engineering unit, where innovation and security drive us. We are transforming technology with modern Network Security, integrations and cloud services. We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced
 **Senior Cyber Security Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Network Security** 
 Engineering team. This role involves architecting, designing, implementing, and maintaining robust security measures to protect our global network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will blend theoretical knowledge with hands-on expertise. This role requires a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, Network Security technologies, and the ability to collaborate across multiple globally dispersed stakeholders and teams.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead design efforts for new and upgraded Network Security solutions across various physical sites (branches, stores, data centers). Support business initiatives by incorporating new functions and services
* Develop, manage, and modernize the Network Security, transitioning from legacy systems to a modern SSE and ZTNA solutions
* Ensure adherence to architectural policies and guidelines, aligning network design with the established roadmap, and implementing best practices for overall Network Security engineering
* Create and maintain roadmaps, policies and implementation plans, analyzing, designing, and evolving Network Security infrastructure to meet evolving business needs
* Ensure Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of H&M Global Network
* Oversee performance, availability, and reliability of the Network Security, conducting monitoring activities and implementing necessary improvements
* Advise on Network Security design, collaborate with stakeholders to align solutions with business objectives, and recommend innovative security measures to support company growth
* Set and maintain Network Security standards to uphold security, quality and efficiency across all network deployments
* Design, configure and install Network Security devices and solution (firewalls, gateways, proxies, load balancers, reverse-proxy, VPN, QoS, IDS, NAC etc.) both on-prem as in the cloud (Azure, GCP)
* Provide Level-3 support and troubleshooting using tools like Wireshark and NetFlow
* Ensuring compliance towards external and internal Security standards (ISO, NIST, etc.)
* Coordinate and manage major and high priority incidents
* Take ownership and end to end responsibility for the solutions/functions within product team
* Protect H&M Group technical assets, including data, network systems, and solutions, against advanced persistent cyber and information security threats such as hacking, malware and ransomware, and cybercrime (on-prem and in the cloud)
* Understand and mitigate security vulnerabilities in various software and hardware designs


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Strong understanding of IP networking and protocols, including IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, and QoS
* Expert in Network Security solutions and products provided by Cisco, HP Aruba, Zscaler and Citrix NetScaler (proven by certificates)
* Extensive experience with Network Security products and capabilities, including IDS/IPS, proxies, firewalls, reverse-proxies, load balancing, segmentation, VPNs, SIEM, XDR, SSE, SASE, SWG, CASB, ZTNA, and 802.1x
* Experience in network defense mechanisms (incl. identity and access management)
* Perform network scanning, packet collection, and manage certificates
* Security Architecture, Design and Threat Modelling
* Cybersecurity capabilities
* Hardening
* Log management
* Vulnerability analysis and IT-system reviews
* Information flows and key assets
* Rules, policies, routines and guardrails
* Understand regulatory and compliance requirements (GDPR, PCI-DSS, Schrems, etc.)
* Hands-on experience with network diagnostic tools (e.g., Wireshark, NetFlow)
* Expertise in cloud networking and security (e.g., Azure and GCP)
* Proficiency in network troubleshooting and automation (e.g., scripting with Python)
* Experience with DevOps methodology and tools
* Experience from large enterprise networks and or ISP/Telco domain
* Independent problem-solving, addressing complex security challenges with minimal supervision
* English proficiency


**We prefer that you also possess the following:**
* CCNP (Security) or higher certifications such as CCIE or CISSP are highly valued
* Security certifications (e.g., Security+, GCIA, GCIH, GREM, CISSP, CEH, GCFA, etc.)
* Azure Security Engineer, or GCP Security Engineer certification
* Solid understanding of the OSI/TCP/IP model
* Degree in Computer Science or related field
* Experience with Agile methodology and tools (e.g., Jira/Confluence)
* Knowledge of ServiceNow and network automation concepts


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: System administrator to Cellular and Molecular Imaging Plattform
emails: marta.carroni@scilifelab.se, stefan.fleischmann@scilifelab.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, seko@seko.su.se, seko@seko.su.se
description:
**The Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics.** 
 SciLifeLab (SciLifeLab) is a national center for molecular biosciences with focus on health and environmental research. The center combines frontline technical expertise with advanced knowledge of translational medicine and molecular bioscience. SciLifeLab is a national resource hosted by Karolinska Institutet, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm University and Uppsala University. The center also collaborates with several other universities.
   

  

 The employment will be placed at the Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics, at Stockholm university. More information about us, please visit: www.dbb.su.se.
   

  

 Main responsibilities
   

  

 SciLifeLabs Cell and Molecular Imaging (CMI) platform offers access to advanced imaging technologies, from cryo-EM and tomography to super-resolution microscopy. The platform enables visualization of biological systems at multiple scales – from molecules to tissues – using state-of-the-art instruments that are not normally available in individual laboratories.
   

  

 Computational methods and artificial intelligence based on large-scale molecular data are transforming the study of biological systems at all levels – from molecular structures and cellular processes to human health and global ecosystems.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a System administrator to support the operation and further development of our advanced computing and data infrastructure. The role includes administering Linux-based servers and clusters, automating workflows, and assisting users in a dynamic research environment.
   

  

 As a key infrastructure person, you will play a central role in connecting our user communities and developing new data services together with senior experts at the SciLifeLab Bioinformatics Platform and the SciLifeLab Data Centre – to enable groundbreaking research in a new era of quantitative and predictive biology.
   

  

* Install, configure and maintain Linux servers (hardware and software)
* Manage clusters, software environments and automation tools (e.g. Ansible)
* Develop and maintain scripts (Python or equivalent) for automation and monitoring
* Provide user support and collaborate with researchers to ensure efficient system usage
* Ensure efficient management and analysis of large amounts of imaging data
* Communicate with other data generating platforms within the SciLifeLabs Integrated Data Service program
* Collaborate with national high-performance computing (HPC) resources.


 Qualification requirements
   

  

* Very good knowledge of Linux distributions
* Experience in installing and administering servers
* Competence in cluster management and software deployment
* Good proficiency in Python or other scripting languages
* Knowledge of automation tools (e.g. Ansible)
* Strong communication skills and good ability to provide user support.


**Meritorious Qualifications**
* Administration of distributed storage systems (e.g. Ceph)
* Experience with large data sets (e.g. image data)
* Knowledge of network technologies
* Experience with container and virtualization solutions
* Windows system administration.


**About The Employment**
 This is a full-time, indefinite-term employment with a six-month probationary period. Stockholm University applies individual salary setting. Start date as agreement.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University and SciLifeLab an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favourable conditions.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 Further information about the position can be obtained from Dr. Marta Carroni, phone: +46 8 16 10 13, marta.carroni@scilifelab.se, and Stefan Fleischmann, stefan.fleischmann@scilifelab.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
