* Comprehensive health and dental coverage
* A diverse, supportive team that values collaboration and curiosity
* Employee referral bonuses, because great people know great people

title: Produktchef Ekonomi
description:
Vi söker för kunds räkning. För att ansöka till tjänsten, vänligen besök https://karriarguiden.se/sv/jobb/produktchef-ekonomi. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Ludvig och Co erbjuder spetskompetens inom ekonomi, lön, juridik och fastigheter. Med över 1000 medarbetare på närmare 100 orter över hela landet är vi Sveriges närmaste konsultbyrå för företagare och bidrar till trygghet och växtkraft för människor, samhälle och företagande i hela Sverige. Vill du vara med och göra skillnad i vår transformationsresa? Då kan ditt nästa jobb vara Produktchef Ekonomi inom teamet Produktutveckling och IT! Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker en Produktchef med ansvar för leveransprocesser, standardsystem och affärsstöd inom vår ekonomiaffär. I nära samarbete med ditt team, kollegor från verksamheten och andra gemensamma funktioner säkerställer du ett modernt, effektivt och kvalitetssäkrat arbetssätt inom vår kärnaffär samt aktuell och lättillgänglig information som gör det lätt för kollegor som jobbar i processerna att göra rätt. Din chef, Pia Bax, ingår i koncernledningen och leder funktionen Produktutveckling och IT. Du blir en nyckelspelare i ledningsgruppen för Produktutveckling och IT och bidrar till avdelningens utveckling, samverkan och engagemang. Dina främsta ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Definiera målbild, utvecklingsplan och äga budget inom ansvarsområdet.
* Leda utveckling, digitalisering, förvaltning och support av ekonomiprocesser.
* Ansvara för standardsystem och leverantörssamarbeten.
* Löpande omvärldsbevakning inom exempelvis: lagar och regler, teknikutveckling, systemlösningar och nya funktionaliteter.
* Stötta verksamheten i införandet av vårt gemensamma arbetssätt.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt säkerställa information och utbildning.
* Arbetsleda och utveckla teamet genom rekrytering, coaching och resursplanering.
* Etablera ett nära samarbete med verksamheten för förståelse, förankring, efterlevnad och involvering i utveckling. Vi erbjuder Teamet sitter på Ludvig och Co’s huvudkontor i moderna lokaler på Kungsholmen. Här arbetar vi nära ledning, gemensamma funktioner och affärsenheter. Vårt gemensamma mål är att göra Ludvig och Co till det bästa företaget för både kunder och medarbetare – och att ha roligt på vägen. Vi erbjuder stor flexibilitet i hur du utför ditt arbete och mycket goda möjligheter att växa i din roll. Hos oss får du:
* En nyckelroll i en organisation som är i förändring och stark utveckling.
* En arbetsmiljö som präglas av samarbete, affärsmässighet och ständigt lärande. Vem vi söker


 Vi söker en driven ledare som kan växla mellan att sätta strategisk riktning och säkerställa genomförande av prioriterade förändringar. Du är en resultatinriktad ”doer” med hög egen leveransförmåga, samtidigt som du är skicklig på att nå resultat genom samarbete och att bygga engagemang i organisationen. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från liknande roller inom redovisningsbranschen. Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Har god förståelse för leveransprocesser och systemstöd inom redovisningsbranschen
* Är van vid att samverka med både verksamhet och IT
* Är en trygg ledare som skapar samarbete och engagemang både i teamet och över avdelningar.
* Har stark analytisk förmåga och kan balansera strategiska mål med operativa leveranser. Låter det intressant? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan!


 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vi vill därför be dig att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 12:e oktober

title: Lead / Senior Planner
description:
**Overview**
 As a
 **Lead /** 
**Senior** 
**Planner** 
 at Linesight, you will work with highly experienced, culturally diverse, and passionate teams. You will have a strong background in construction planning and will be responsible for developing and managing fully integrated project schedules while ensuring alignment with execution, procurement, and control strategies. The role requires exceptional communication and leadership skills to effectively collaborate with clients, suppliers, and internal stakeholders. For us lasting trusted relationships are everything, both with our teams and our clients.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In This Role You Will**
* Enjoy freedom in managing your own priorities, deadlines, and client engagements.
* Develop detailed, end-to-end project schedules using critical path methodology, covering full project scope, milestones, and timelines.
* Apply Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) methodology to define roles, responsibilities, and deliverables.
* Align all scheduling with the project execution plan, contracting, procurement, and control strategies.
* Establish a robust method for schedule baselining and manage ongoing updates.
* Maintain a fully integrated project schedule viewable at multiple levels of detail and abstraction.
* Lead and facilitate meetings with both clients and suppliers to discuss timelines, progress, and dependencies.
* Negotiate and resolve interdisciplinary and inter-party schedule conflicts to achieve optimal outcomes for the client.
* Deliver regular progress reports to stakeholders, highlighting variances, risks, and mitigation strategies.
* Review and validate supplier and third-party schedules, ensuring alignment with industry best practices.
* Apply working knowledge of Earned Value Management (EVM) to support integrated schedule and cost performance tracking, when required.
* Experience of CQV process is required for some projects.


**We would love to hear from you if you have:**
* Extensive experience in construction project planning and scheduling.
* Proficiency in using Primavera P6 to build, manage, and analyse project schedules.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and can convey complex schedule data in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
* Confidence leading meetings and are able to command attention, facilitate productive discussions, and drive decisions.
* Demonstratable experience with Quantitative Risk Assessment (QRA), including the ability to interpret and clearly communicate findings to stakeholders.
* Excellent technical understanding of planning processes in complex, high-value construction projects.
* A degree or equivalent experience in Project Management, Construction, Engineering, or a related field.


 All interviews are conducted either in person or virtually with video required.
   

  

**About Us**
 Linesight is a highly successful global project and cost management consultancy that keeps clients coming back. And for that we have our people to thank. You see we’re not like the others. We’re different. Unique. It’s our fresh thinking and focus on what matters that has led to our evolving. We are on a journey working in some of the most exciting innovative sectors with some of the world’s most prestigious companies delivering major projects that deliver a more sustainable built environment. We have an open culture and a flat structure where you can expect to be treated with genuine care, respect, and empathy. With Linesight, you can truly discover the power of team!
   

  

 Diversity, inclusion and accessibility
   

  

 Linesight is committed to transparent, equal opportunity employment practices. We are building a diverse and inclusive organisation, accessible to all, based on having a safe culture which enables all our people to be their true selves. We are a people business, and we understand that the more inclusive we are, the happier our people and better our work will be. We will ensure that individuals with disability are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the application or recruitment process and are accommodated in the workplace. If you require assistance or accommodation of any kind, please mention this in your application, we would love to hear from you!

title: Kursadministratör
description:
**Juridiska institutionen** 
 söker nya kursadministratörer! Vill du vara del av en kompetent och engagerad grupp kollegor som med sin kunskap och expertis bidrar till institutionens utveckling i en kunskaps- och forskningsintensiv miljö på ett av världens topp 100 universitet?
   

  

 Juridiska institutionen är en av de största institutionerna vid Stockholms universitet med ca 150 anställda och ca 5 500 studenter per läsår. Drygt 100 lärare är på heltid engagerade för att undervisa och bedriva den forskning som utbildningen vilar på. Ett fyrtiotal professorer med olika rättsvetenskapliga inriktningar finns vid institutionen, som utgör en dynamisk miljö med forskning av högsta klass och med stark internationell prägel.
   

  

 Teknisk/administrativa (TA) gruppen vid Juridiska institutionen är en administrativ grupp om 30 skickliga och hängivna medarbetare verksamma inom flera funktioner såsom ekonomi, HR, kursadministration, studievägledning, studieadministration etc. Vårt mål är att ge service av hög kvalité till både anställda och studenter samt stödja och bidra till utveckling av utbildning och forskning vid institutionen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi fem kursadministratörer som trivs med att jobba med administration, koordinering och att ha många kontakter.
   

  

 Mer information om oss finns på: Juridiska institutionen.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Befattningen innebär ett övergripande administrativt ansvar för de kurser som ligger inom ansvarsområdet. Kursadministratören är en länk mellan studenter och lärare för att ge studenterna bästa möjliga förutsättningar att bedriva sina studier. Med många kontakter och bred tillgång till information inom verksamheten är kursadministratören ett nav som bidrar även till institutionsgemensamma utvecklingsprojekt som en naturlig del av rollen.
   

  

 Som kursadministratör ser du till att institutionens kurser administreras med både hög kvalité och god serviceanda utifrån institutionens och universitetets riktlinjer och regler. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår bl.a. schemaläggning, lokalbokning, rapportering av betyg, hantering och spridning av information via lärplattformen, hemsidan, mejl och telefon, administrativ hantering av externa lärare (arvodering, resor, etc.), samt löpande arkivering och dokumenthantering. Du förväntas att utifrån givna riktlinjer själv planera och utföra arbetsuppgifterna i samarbete med övriga kollegor inom kursadministrationen samt med lärare.
   

  

 Övriga administrativa uppgifter inom TA gruppen kan förekomma, till exempel genomlysning och utveckling av rutiner och processer samt organisation av möten och events. Inom vissa ämnesområden är det också aktuellt med administrativt stöd till forskningsinstitut eller centrumbildningar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst kandidatexamen och minst två års erfarenhet av liknande administrativt arbete. Erfarenhet av kursadministrativt arbete inom universitet eller högskola är högt meriterande. Du ska ha en vana av att kunna arbeta i flera olika IT system samtidigt. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på såväl svenska som engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Arbetet kräver att du är noggrann och strukturerad, serviceinriktad och har mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Arbetsbelastningen varierar och vid exempelvis terminsstart eller tentaperioder kan det vara en hög arbetsbelastning; därför är det viktigt att du kan prioritera vid arbetstoppar.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tills vidare på heltid med sex månaders provanställning. Stockholms universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

 Hos oss får du dynamiken i samspelet mellan högre utbildning och forskning som gör Stockholms universitet till en spännande och kreativ miljö. Du arbetar i en internationell miljö och får förmånliga villkor. Universitetet ligger beläget i Nationalstadsparken med goda förbindelser till city.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet värnar om att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika rättigheter och möjligheter för alla.
   

  

 Kontakt
   

  

 Närmare information om anställningen lämnas av administrativ chef Vladimir Vešović, vladimir.vesovic@juridicum.su.se.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Du söker anställningen via Stockholms universitets rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Anvisningar för sökande finns på webbsidan: att söka en anställning.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet bidrar till det hållbara demokratiska samhällets utveckling genom kunskap, upplysning och sanningssökande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 5 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: SU FV-3500-25 | Facklig företrädare: ST/OFR st@st.su.se, Saco-S saco@saco.su.se, Seko seko@seko.su.se, | Publicerat: 2025-10-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-22

title: LCA Specialist
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow*
**LCA Specialist**
**Temporary Parental Leave Cover - 1st April 2026 – 31st January 2027.**
 This role offers an excellent opportunity to apply your expertise in environmental sustainability and make a meaningful contribution to our team.
   

  

 As our Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) Specialist, you will play a central role in developing Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) models and LCAs for Stegra’s current and future hydrogen, iron, and steel products, based on customer needs.
   

  

 As part of our group sustainability team, you will apply data-driven and analytical approaches to address environmental impacts across the value chain. In this role, you will strengthen Stegra’s LCA and PCF capabilities by developing tools, collecting and analyzing data, presenting findings, and supporting projects across the organization.
   

  

 You will also contribute to digital solutions that improve these processes, deliver accurate customer reporting, and produce Environmental Product Declarations (EPDs) for our product portfolio. Finally, you will support the implementation of processes for monitoring and reporting greenhouse gas emissions in line with the EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS). As a member of the sustainability team, you will also participate in initiatives and projects initiated by the team to drive Stegra’s sustainability agenda and deliver on our promises, as well as providing guidance and expertise to other teams across the company, especially our commercial and product sustainability team.
   

  

 This role offers a unique opportunity to join a company with no legacy; where you will have the possibility to shape the future of environmental modelling. You will report to our Head of Group Sustainability and belong to the Business Development function. You will engage cross-functionally with key stakeholders to ensure sustainability is at the core of our business to build a profitable impact company.
   

  

**Responsibilit** 
**ies:**
* Set up, manage, and develop LCAs and PCF models for current and future hydrogen, iron, and steel products.
* Provide the organization with expertise and guidance in environmental sustainability for our Boden project and other emerging projects.
* Support in the development of Stegra’s Corporate Carbon Footprint.
* Assisting in maintaining the EU ETS Monitoring Plan
* Participate in selected and prioritized sustainability related projects, for instance related to customer experience.
* Compile data, perform in-depth analysis and effectively present findings to support decision- making.


**Qualifications:**
* M.Sc. in relevant field such as Sustainability, Environmental Engineering, Mechanical


 Engineering, Energy Engineering or similar.
   

  

* Minimum of 2 years’ relevant experience in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), preferably within industrial applications; experience in the steel sector is a strong advantage.
* Strong analytical skills with deep understanding within the key elements of Life Cycle


 Assessments and Product Carbon Footprint modelling.
   

  

* Familiarity with relevant standards such as ISO 14040, ISO 14044, ISO 14067, GHG Protocol and EN 15804.
* Knowledge of EU climate regulations, carbon accounting, or emissions monitoring is an


 advantage.
   

  

* Proficient in relevant LCA softwares such as SimaPro and LCA databases such as Ecoinvent, MS Office suite and a general ability to use digital tools. Demonstrable experience in programming languages such as python is a plus but not required.
* Ability to communicate and present results clearly and effectively.
* Excellent skills in written and spoken English; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
* Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, with a passion to learn and grow.


**What We Can Offer You**
 If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.
   

  

**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

 You’ll receive fair, competitive compensation aligned with collective agreements, along with benefits like up to 30 days of paid vacation, occupational pension, parental benefits, and insurance. If you need support with relocation or immigration, our relocation department will help guide you through the process, whether it’s permits, housing or other practical matters. You can also enjoy perks like subsidized gym memberships and bike leases, plus the everyday benefits of life closer to nature.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra Here.**
**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Service Lifecycle Marketing Manager
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**Elekta - Hope for everyone dealing with cancer**
 In our world, billions of people, millions of cancers diagnosed each year. For everyone, it’s personal. Behind every treatment lies a story, a family, a future.
   

  

 Behind every patient, clinic, and care provider, are real complexities, real needs, and a united purpose. We’re not intimidated, we’re inspired, because every difference – from the smallest tumor change to the greatest clinical challenge is a chance to innovate together and advance care. That’s why we’re here. With you. To set the new standard of care, making a meaningful impact on lives, for a world of difference.
   

  

**Provide exceptional service and seamless execution across the customer journey**
 Step into a role where your work directly enhances patient care and clinical excellence. At Elekta, our Services team is driving value in radiation oncology through Elekta Care— the most comprehensive and data-driven service offering in radiation oncology delivered in a personal way. From proactive maintenance and lifecycle upgrades to expert implementation and peer-to-peer training, Elekta Care ensures minimized clinical downtime and maximized patient throughput. Join us and be part of a team that empowers healthcare providers with the tools, support, and insights they need to deliver life-changing treatments.
   

  

**We're looking for a Service Lifecycle Marketing Manager** 
 who sits within the Central Services Marketing team and is based in Region Europe. A successful candidate will be responsible for
   

  

 the end-to-end lifecycle management of the Service Portfolio, including but not limited to lifecycle services (Upgrades HW/SW, Tech Refresh, Obsolescence), educational (Peer-to-Peer) and professional services (e.g., site planning, radiation shielding, go-live support).
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 This person is responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies that maximize customer engagement, satisfaction, and revenue throughout the entire lifecycle of service offerings. This role combines strategic marketing with hands-on operational excellence, supporting the full lifecycle of services. This roles bridges product/service development and market adoption, ensuring that each stage of the customer journey is optimized for value, retention, and growth.
   

  

 Your role will include (but not limited to):
   

  

**New Service Introductions:**
* Conduct research and analysis on trends and new lifecycle service concepts to inform marketing strategies and operational decisions.
* Identify and implement offerings that contribute to lifecycle business growth and customer value (business case development, opportunity assessment, customer needs assessment).
* Lead go-to-market planning, execution, and strategy for new service introductions, including global launch plan, messaging, and sales enablement.


**Lifecycle Management:**
* Define a clear and compelling vision for the service lifecycle portfolio.
* Responsible for lifecycle management (including phase-in and phase-out) and market readiness as part of New Service Introduction Process (NSI). Ensure completion of appropriate deliverables and knowledge transfer.
* Oversee the full lifecycle of service offerings, from launch to renewal and retention, ensuring value delivery at every stage.
* Oversee overall positioning and pricing, tailoring approaches to different markets and customer segments.
* Drive service contract renewals, upgrades, and customer loyalty programs.


**Strategy & Planning:**
* Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies for service portfolios, aligned with business objectives and market trends.
* Analyse market trends, customer insights, and competitive landscapes to inform lifecycle marketing initiatives.


**Campaigns & Communications:**
* Develop compelling service positioning, messaging, and value propositions tailored to customer needs and competitive advantages.
* Plan and execute integrated marketing campaigns (digital, print, events, PR) to promote service offerings and drive customer engagement.


**Sales Enablement:**
* Create and distribute sales tools, training materials, and collateral to support the sales team in communicating service value (e.g., sales collateral, presentation, customer-facing content).
* Collaborate with sales, product, and regional marketing teams to ensure alignment and successful execution of marketing strategies.


**Collaboration Support:**
* Provide services and installed base marketing expertise to regional activities and co-strategize marketing programs with regional teams.
* Participate in regular marketing meetings and support high-level sales and internal training as required.
* Orchestrate cross-functional activities to design service products that deliver new value in new ways for customers. Translate the converged service portfolio strategy into defined service products/offerings. Partner and align with regional leaders, other category product management leaders, and service delivery management on an integrated roadmap in early-stage ideation to ensure the effective delivery of all services.


**The Right Capabilities**
* Excellent downstream marketing skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional, global teams.
* Strong interpersonal skills and stakeholder management experience.
* Self-motivated and able to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to communicate in business, marketing and product management user terms
* Self-motivated and committed to best practice solutions.


**What You’ll Bring**
* We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Healthcare Administration, or related field; advanced degree preferred
* 3-5 years of experience in downstream marketing, with a proven track record of managing service portfolios or a lifecycle portfolio.
* Strong understanding of healthcare industry regulations is advantageous, customer journey mapping, and digital marketing tools.
* Experience with CRM, marketing automation, and analytics platforms.
* Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.


**What you will get** 
  

  

 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, Elekta offers a range of benefits depending on the location where you apply.
   

  

*Please note that for all locations, working in a hybrid model (3 days in the office) is required.*
**Hiring process** 
  

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact** 
  

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Joanna Kozyra at Joanna.Kozyra@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer.** 
  

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic

title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Diabetes and Parkinson's disease
description:
****Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?****
 The Strategic Research Programme in Diabetes (SRP Diabetes) at Karolinska Institutet is funding a prestigious fellowship programme for postdoctoral research fellows. The Programme is focused on research in diabetes and its comorbidities. With this postdoctoral programme SRP Diabetes aims to support the next generation of exceptional young scientists within the diabetes area, including both experimental and clinical research. As part of this programme,
 ***we are looking to recruit an outstanding postdoctoral research fellow who will work on a project examining brain circuit dysfunctions underlying diabetes and Parkinson’s disease comorbidity.***
 Full details and contact information to the PIs can be found at Postdoc Fellowships 2025 - Project 1 | Karolinska Institutet.
   

  

**Your mission**
 Based at Karolinska Institutet, fellows will undertake a cutting-edge research project in a competitive lab and be part of the SRP Diabetes dynamic research environment where several events will be held throughout the year such as high-profile lectures, symposia, internal retreat, etc. giving the fellows lot of opportunities to make new connections both within Karolinska Institutet and internationally within the field of diabetes and metabolism.
   

  

 The fellowships are fully funded, and salary is provided for a 2-year period. The position is available immediately.
   

  

**Short running title of project: Diabetes and Parkinson’s disease.**
**Research Project:** 
**Brain Circuit Dysfunctions Linking Diabetes and Parkinson’s Disease Comorbidity.** 
 We are seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral fellow to join a multidisciplinary project evaluating the metabolic mechanisms underlying diabetes and Parkinson’s disease comorbidity. Under the supervision of Drs. Anders Borgkvist and Cesare Patrone, you will investigate how Type 2 Diabetes exacerbates Parkinson’s disease pathology and how GLP-1 receptor agonists might counteract these effects. The project combines metabolic analyses in a diabetes mouse model with anatomical mapping, electrophysiology, and optogenetics to uncover the brain circuits regulating diabetes-related disruption of dopamine neuron function. This two-year, fully funded position offers a unique opportunity for cross-disciplinary training in cutting-edge diabetes and neurophysiology research, providing a strong foundation for academic independence and future funding opportunities.
   

  

**Key responsibilities of the selected applicant:**
* Plan, manage and conduct an agreed academic research project and associated activities.
* Test hypotheses and analyse scientific data from a variety of sources, reviewing and refining working hypotheses as appropriate.
* Develop research questions, analyse detailed and complex qualitative and/or quantitative data from a variety of sources, and contribute original ideas for new research projects.
* Coordinate multiple aspects of work to deliver novel research data in accordance with established timelines set between you and the Principal Investigator.
* Adapt existing and develop new scientific techniques and experimental protocols to support research.
* Regularly write research articles at an international level for peer-reviewed journals, book chapters, and reviews.
* Formally present your research and represent the research group at internal, national and international conferences and meetings, either with other members of the team or alone.
* Informally present your research to the group at established meetings.
* Act as a source of information and advice to other members of the group on scientific protocols and experimental techniques.
* Mentor undergraduate and graduate students and strategically utilize their contributions to expedite the completion of the project.


**Your profile**
 To be eligible for employment as a postdoctor, a PhD or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a Swedish PhD is required. This eligibility requirement must be fulfilled at the latest at the time of the employment decision. Completion of your doctoral degree within the last three years is considered an advantage. If there are special reasons, your degree may have been completed earlier.
   

  

**Selection Criteria**
**Required:**
* A PhD in neurobiology or neuroscience-related subjects (PhD must have been completed later than 2023).
* Demonstrated knowledge with electrophysiological recording techniques in live brain slices (for example patch-clamp or intracellular recordings).
* Knowledge in virus-assisted tracing, tissue preparation for histology, immunostaining techniques and microscopy–particularly fluorescence confocal imaging.
* Experience with experimental animals (rodents) and proficiency in stereotaxic surgery is essential. FELASA Category B certification.


**Essential:**
* The ability to manage your own academic research and associated activities.
* A strong CV, having published in high impact journals and presented at international meetings.
* Ability to contribute ideas for new research projects and research income generation.
* Ability to work with meticulous attention to detail.
* An enthusiastic interest in metabolism and diabetes research.
* Evidence of excellent interpersonal skills and leadership with keen interest in fostering a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
* Ability to communicate research ideas and results in a clear and logical way and the ability to confidently and effectively interact with colleagues and the broader research community.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.
* A conscientious and enthusiastic working approach.
* Excellent planning, organizational and problem-solving skills.


 Each Fellowship is for two years. To be eligible for employment as a post-doctor a doctoral degree or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a doctoral degree is required. This eligibility requirement must be fulfilled at the latest at the time of the employment decision.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
   

  

**Location:
 *Solna***
**Application**
 An employment application must contain the following documents in English or Swedish:
   

  

* PhD certificate
* A complete resumé, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)


 If you consider that you meet the selection criteria, click on the
 **Login and apply** 
 button on this page and follow the on-screen instructions to register as a user. You will then be required to provide information in a number of screens with your application details, relating to your skills and experience. When prompted, please provide details of
 **three references** 
 .
   

  

 You will also be required to upload a CV and Personal Letter which explains how you meet the selection criteria for the position. The Personal Letter
 **(maximum two pages)** 
 should explain your relevant experience which may have been gained in employment, education, or you may have taken time away from these activities as illness, military service, work for labour unions or student organisations, parental leave or similar circumstances. Your application will be judged in part on the basis of how you demonstrate that you meet the selection criteria outlined above and we are happy to consider evidence of transferable skills or experience which you may have gained outside the context of paid employment or education.
   

  

 Welcome to apply at the latest 2025-10-31
   

  

 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

 Permanent position is initiated by a six months trial period.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**
 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-3868/2025 | Facklig företrädare: Henry Wölling, SEKO henry.wolling@ki.se, Björn Meister, SACO bjorn.meister@ki.se, Magnus Anå, ST-OFR Magnus.ana@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-10-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-31

title: Erfaren konsult till TPA teamet – Stockholm, oktober 2025
description:
Deloitte erbjuder tjänster inom revision, business consulting, finansiell rådgivning, riskhantering, skatterådgivning och relaterade områden. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan att göra en meningsfull skillnad. Vi tror att när våra klienter och vårt samhälle blir starkare, blir vi det också! Det är därför självklart för oss att driva initiativ så som WorldClass, WorldClimate samt vår strategi för mångfald.
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

 I teamet för tredjepartsintyg (TPA), en integrerad del av Assurance & Financial Reporting teamet, stöttar vi våra klienter med att säkerställa att deras affärsprocesser och interna kontroller fungerar och är ändamålsriktigt utformade i förhållande till bolagets riskexponeringar. Vi identifierar och analyserar risker samt granskar och utvärderar hur dessa hanteras. Våra klienter får därigenom en ökad förståelse för sin interna kontrollmiljö och hur en effektiv sådan kan driva kostnadsbesparingar och långsiktigt värdeskapande. Våra klienter är huvudsakligen banker och andra finansiella företag och uppdragens längd varierar från ett par veckor till ett par månader. En diversifierad portfölj innebär att vi jobbar nära våra kollegor inom IT, Data & Analytics, Sustainability, Securitisation och Assurance i både Sverige och internationellt för att leverera AsOne för våra klienter. Oberoende av tjänsteområde och uppdragsform arbetar vi alltid i team.
   

  

  





 Som konsult inom TPA-teamet är du del av ett dynamiskt och växande team med möjlighet att påverka vidareutvecklingen av vår affär. Du kommer fokusera på uppdrag av granskningskaraktär relaterat till kontrollmiljön inom bankers och försäkringsföretags affärsprocesser och regulatoriska efterlevnad. Genom mixen av tjänster vi erbjuder och våra klienters föränderliga behov, kommer du över tid att bygga upp en bred erfarenhetsbas som spänner över många olika perspektiv av granskning och rådgivning inom tredjepartsintyg. I kombination med utbildning i världsklass erbjuder vi fantastiska möjligheter att forma och påverka din framtida karriär samtidigt som du bygger meningsfulla och långvariga kundrelationer.
   

  

  




**Kvalifikationer**

 Vi söker dig med avslutad akademisk examen i företagsekonomi eller annat relevant område och 1-3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med internkontroll eller granskning av internkontrollsystem, gärna i en konsultroll.
   

  

  





 Du har stort intresse av den finansiella sektorn och att fördjupa dina kunskaper inom internkontrolltestning. Erfarenhet inom finansiell sektor, värdepapperisering och tredjepartsintyg är meriterande. Du har förmåga att kommunicera korrekt och effektivt på engelska i skriftlig och muntlig form, samt är flytande i svenska både skriftligen och muntligen.
   

  

  





 Vidare är du en person som gillar utmaningar, har en god analytisk förmåga att lösa komplexa frågor och är trovärdig som person. Du är flexibel, innovativ, lösningsorienterad och ett starkt driv att utveckla dig själv och din omgivning. Du samarbetar väl med dina kollegor och du gillar att hjälpa andra att utveckla och lära sig mer, både tekniskt och för att bygga starka team.
   

  

  




**Ytterligare information**

**Vi erbjuder**




 Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och på en konsultfirma i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig en flexibel och stimulerande arbetsmiljö och möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär och kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.
   

  

  





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.
   

  

  





**Ansökan**
  

 Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:
   

  

  




* CV
* En motivering till varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och den här rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet


**Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval.**

 Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut: https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/.
   

  

  





**Frågor**




 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Sara Johansson, sajohansson@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. Det är på Deloitte du hittar obegränsade möjligheter att lyckas och nå din fulla potential.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - Operational Systems
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Ready to build the technology that fuels our company's success behind the scenes? As a Senior JavaScript Engineer on our Operational Systems team, you'll play a key role in crafting a high impact platform using a modern tech stack: React, Node, GraphQL, and more. You'll collaborate closely with a talented team of designers and product experts to deliver intuitive, customer-centric products. This is a chance to join a highly collaborative team where you'll work closely with designers, product managers, and other engineers to deliver exceptional results.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Implement modern, component-driven architecture using technologies such as React, Node, GraphQL, JSS, Jest, Relay, and TypeScript.
* Collaborate closely with designers and product to build intuitive, customer-centric products.
* Proactively identify architectural improvements and implement innovative solutions.
* Actively contribute to team discussions, task creation, and delivery in a self-organized, agile environment.
* Participate in peer reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentoring less senior developers to build a strong engineering culture.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* 5+ years in developing modern Web applications
* You know JavaScript/TypeScript and React very well
* You have worked with GraphQL
* You can work in a highly collaborative and agile team
* You are used to write Unit Tests


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* You have worked with Relay
* You are familiar with and value Clean Code and Design patterns


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Nordic Health Technology Assessment Manager – Nordic Marketing Company
description:
*Are you an expert in Health Economics and Health Technology Assessment and interested in applying your expertise at a company that transforms scientific ideas into life-changing medicines?*
 Our AstraZeneca Nordic Marketing Company employs around 550 people and has offices located in Espoo, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Oslo. AstraZeneca Nordic is a recognized leader in its core therapy areas and aims to improve the lives of millions of people. This is an area where you are free to be more – you are encouraged to challenge traditional ways and test your curiosity. We drive innovative science, deliver key launches, build close collaboration and partnerships within health care.
   

  

 We are seeking a Health Technology Assessment (HTA) Manager with a strong foundation in health economics to join our team of specialists. Your expertise will be integral to shaping and communicating the economic value of our innovative pharmaceutical products. In the HTA team, we strive for excellence and being the go-to source for health economics and HTA methods and deliverables!
   

  

**The role**
 As the HTA Manager, you will be expected to apply advanced health economic methodologies, including cost-effectiveness and budget impact analyses, to support our strategic objectives. Your role will involve developing robust economic models and conducting in-depth analyses to inform HTA submissions, ensuring alignment with the complex requirements of Nordic HTA agencies.
   

  

 This pivotal position involves leading the development of health economic analyses and HTA submissions/dossiers, driving the success of our innovative pharmaceutical products. In this role, ensuring the successful development of reimbursement dossiers across Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Finland for assigned products/indications is critical. To achieve this objective, it is important to collaborate with cross-functional teams and use the expertise of local Market Access teams. By doing so, we can ensure the best HTA outcomes for subsequent negotiations and market access.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Conduct health economic analyses and develop payer evidence that meet the needs of Nordic HTA agencies and demonstrate the health economic value of AZ assets.
* Lead the development of HTA submissions/dossiers for new products and indications.
* Conduct health economic analyses to inform strategy and tactics.
* Stay current with HTA guidelines and requirements in relevant markets and ensure submissions are aligned with these.
* Provide HTA expertise and guidance to internal teams.
* Collaborate with global and local teams to ensure alignment on HTA submission strategies.
* Participate in projects to shape HTA/Access environment.
* Demonstrate AZ values, ethics, and compliance within all business practices, in alignment with the AZ Governance Framework, internal standards and policies, and external regulations.


**What We Need From You**
 As a diverse and inclusive community, we work together seamlessly to solve challenges and make a meaningful impact. As a HTA manager we want you to be generous with your knowledge and experience. We strive for excellence and being the go-to source for health economics and HTA methods.
   

  

**Essential Experience**
* Health Economics/Economics/Statistics MSc or PhD Degree.
* Minimum 2 years of Health Technology Assessment or economic evaluations within the healthcare industry from the Nordics or similar markets.
* Experience with submissions across the Nordic markets.
* Understanding of regulatory requirements and processes for pharmaceuticals and how it relates to health technology assessment and market access.
* Proficiency in health economics, health outcomes research, and familiarity with HTA methodologies and guidelines.
* Strategic application of health economic science to HTA dossiers.
* Analytical – can make actionable insights out of data in the HTA field   Structured – can manage multiple tasks and competing deadlines.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to optimally present findings and recommendations to various stakeholders.
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to support the assessment and adoption of healthcare. technologies.
* Proficient in English and fluent in at least one Nordic language.


**I&D**
 We are proud to have a unique workplace culture that inspires innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives - and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity.
   

  

**Why AstraZeneca?**
 When we at AstraZeneca see the chance to change, we take this opportunity - for every opportunity, no matter how small, can be the beginning of something big. Delivering medicine that changes people's lives is about having an entrepreneurial spirit - finding moments and understanding its potential.
   

  

**So, what is next?**
 Are you already imagining yourself embracing this fantastic opportunity? Great, because we cannot wait to hear from you.
   

  

 Welcome with your application, in English, latest by
 **the 19th of October, 2025!**
 Applications will be reviewed continuously throughout the application period.
   

  

**To Find Out More**
 Our social media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/astrazeneca/
   

  

 Career site: https://careers.astrazeneca.com/
   

  

 The Nordic Marketing Company,
   

  

**Date Posted**
 01-okt.-2025
   

  

**Closing Date**
 19-okt.-2025
   

  

 Our mission is to build an inclusive and equitable environment. We want people to feel they belong at AstraZeneca and Alexion, starting with our recruitment process. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of characteristics. We offer reasonable adjustments/accommodations to help all candidates to perform at their best. If you have a need for any adjustments/accommodations, please complete the section in the application form.

title: Teknisk förvaltare till Klövern
company_industry: Real Estate, Construction, and Housing and Community Development
description:
**Teknisk förvaltare till Klövern** 




  





 Har du ett stort tekniskt intresse och vill arbeta med förvaltning av bostäder? Trivs du i en bred roll där teknik, hållbarhet och utveckling går hand i hand? Vill du dessutom ha en central position där du driver projekt, utvecklar fastigheter och samordnar den tekniska förvaltningen?
 



  





 Då kan rollen som Teknisk förvaltare hos Klövern vara rätt för dig!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Teknisk förvaltare ansvarar du för att säkerställa att fastigheterna är i gott skick, att tekniska installationer och system fungerar effektivt och att de uppfyller relevanta lagar, myndighetskrav och miljöstandarder. Rollen är bred och central med många kontaktytor – både internt och externt – och innebär ett helhetsansvar för fastigheternas tekniska innehåll och utveckling.
 



  





 Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt: från daglig drift och felavhjälpning till långsiktig planering, upphandling och genomförande av underhållsprojekt. Du analyserar driftdata och energiförbrukning, driver energioptimeringsåtgärder och säkerställer att digitalisering och nya tekniska lösningar implementeras på ett effektivt sätt.
 



  





 Som teknisk sakkunnig stödjer du förvaltaren i projektledning, uppföljning och ekonomiska frågor.
 



 Du leder och samordnar tekniska projekt, ansvarar för service- och leverantörsavtal och säkerställer att myndighetskrav och säkerhetsföreskrifter efterlevs.
 



  





 Du har även en central roll i den tekniska samordningen vid tillträde av nya hyresfastigheter för egen förvaltning, samt erfarenhetsåterföring för optimering av produkten.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Planera och följa upp både förebyggande och akuta underhålls- och reparationsarbeten.
* Upprätta och följa upp underhållsplaner för fastigheter och tekniska installationer.
* Ansvara för drift och optimering av tekniska system (ventilation, värme, kyla, VA).
* Analysera driftdata och implementera energibesparande åtgärder.
* Upphandla och följa upp entreprenörer och tekniska tjänster.
* Leda projekt vid renoveringar, uppgraderingar eller nyinstallationer.
* Genomföra inspektioner och riskbedömningar samt säkerställa myndighetskrav.
* Kostnadsuppföljning och rapportering.



  





**Vem du är** 




 Vi söker dig som har teknisk utbildning inom fastighetsteknik, bygg, VVS, energi eller motsvarande, kombinerat med erfarenhet av teknisk förvaltning av bostäder. Du har goda kunskaper inom driftoptimering och energieffektivisering samt vana av upphandling och avtalshantering.
 



  





 Meriterande är erfarenhet av miljöcertifieringar och digitala fastighetssystem. Du är trygg i din beställarroll och har god förmåga att analysera både tekniska och ekonomiska data.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Du är självgående, ansvarstagande och resultatinriktad med ett proaktivt arbetssätt. Du trivs i en samordnande roll med många kontaktytor och har förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer.
 



  





 Som person är du strukturerad och lösningsorienterad, prestigelös och flexibel – du gör det som behövs för gruppens och fastigheternas bästa. Din kommunikativa förmåga gör att du kan hantera både hyresgäster, leverantörer och kollegor på ett professionellt sätt.
 



  





**Vad Klövern har att erbjuda** 




 Vi är på en spännande resa där vi fokuserar på att bygga en omfattande portfölj av bostäder och kommersiellt bestånd för egen förvaltning. Genom att skapa långsiktiga och hållbara boendemiljöer stärker vi vår grund och säkerställer stabila intäkter över tid. Detta ger oss både flexibilitet och motståndskraft, vilket skapar nya möjligheter och långsiktig tillväxt för våra investerare och samhället i stort.
 



  





 Här får du möjligheten att bli en del av en inkluderande och positiv arbetskultur med korta beslutsvägar, entreprenöriell anda och stort fokus på tillväxt, innovation samt hållbarhet.
 



  





 Hos
 
 Klövern
 
 ges du stort eget ansvar, och du blir del av ett team där alla medarbetare uppmuntras att bidra med egna idéer och lösningar. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att uppnå målet att bli Sveriges ledande fastighets- och utvecklingsbolag!
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Klövern med Fasticon. Du söker tjänsten via annonsen. För att säkerställa att dina personuppgifter hanteras i enlighet med GDPR tar Fasticon inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Vi arbetar utifrån en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsprocess. Det innebär att vi arbetar med fokus på att rekrytera rätt kompetens i förhållande till verksamhetens behov.
 



  





 Har du frågor angående tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Jenny Tell,
 
 jenny.tell@fasticon.se.
 




  





 Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte med din ansökan! Så länge annonsen är publicerad tar vi emot ansökningar. Vi använder oss av tester som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess och slutkandidaten kommer att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll.
 



  





**Om Fasticon** 




 Fasticon är marknadsledande specialister på kompetensförsörjning inom fastighetsrelaterade kompetenser. Vi kombinerar skarp expertis med en djup förståelse för ledarskapsutmaningar, engagerade i att rekrytera och hyra ut yrkesverksamma som bidrar till din organisations långsiktiga framgång. Våra kunder finns över hela Sverige och vi utgår från Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
 



  





 Läs mer på
 
 www.fasticon.se
 
 och sök lediga jobb på
 
 www.fasticon.se/lediga-jobb.

title: Product Engineer
description:

What we're looking for

title: Product Owner / Software & System Engineer
description:
**Want to shape the future of waterborne transport and join a world-class team?**


Candela is the **global leader in electric hydrofoil vessels**. Since 2014, we’ve gone from building our first premium electric speedboat in a small Stockholm workshop to delivering game-changing vessels around the globe. **The Candela P-12** is our latest innovation - the world’s first electric hydrofoil ferry is not just operating in Stockholm, but now attracting orders from around the world.  

Our boats “fly” thanks to **computer-guided** underwater wings under the hull made out of **lightweight carbon fiber.** The wings lift the vessel above the water, which results in cutting energy use by up to 80%, while offering zero emissions and a far better passenger experience than traditional diesel vessels.  

  

And that’s exactly why we do this. Our mission is clear: to **speed up the transition to fossil fuel–free lakes and oceans**.

  

You can be part of the amazing team in Candela now! Are you a technically skilled engineer with a passion for turning complex requirements into smart, customer-focused solutions? We are looking for a **Product Owner / Software & System Engineer** to bridge the gap between technology and business, driving both product development and technical excellence.

**Your core responsibilities will include:**

* Define, maintain, and prioritize the product backlog in alignment with business goals.
* Translate customer and stakeholder requirements into clear, actionable work items and technical specifications.
* Collaborate directly with sales and aftermarket to gather feedback, validate solutions, and build strong long-term customer relationships.
* Own system design, architecture decisions, and hands-on engineering tasks where needed. Assist sourcing in software related topics towards suppliers
* Work closely with cross-functional teams (developers, designers, QA, DevOps) to deliver high-quality releases on time.
* Continuously measure product performance, identify improvements, and adapt the roadmap accordingly.

Conduct risk and threat analysis together with cross-functional teams to ensure a safe and secure product  
* 

  

**What are we looking for?**


In this hybrid role, you will combine product ownership responsibilities with hands-on engineering expertise. You will work closely with customers, stakeholders, and development teams to understand needs, define product requirements, and ensure delivery of high-quality, scalable solutions. With your strong technical background, you’ll be able to dive deep into system architecture and software design, while keeping a clear focus on business value and product strategy.

**Requirements****:**

* Master's degree in Computer science or equivalent
* Experience as a Product Owner, System Engineer, or Software Engineer in an agile environment.
* Understanding of both technical details (embedded software, software architecture, system integration, cloud services, cyber security etc.) and business value.
* Experience with tools like GIT, Jira/Confluence, understanding of CAN (Controller Area Network).
* Strong communication skills and enjoys working directly with customers and internal stakeholders.
* Can prioritize effectively, balancing technical feasibility, customer needs, and business impact.
* Thrives in a fast-moving, collaborative environment.
* Ability to speak fluent English is required, Swedish is a plus

**Form of employment**: Full-time with initial 6 month probation period  

**Start date:** Asap  

**Location/base**: Frihamnen  

**Team**: Product  

**Reporting to**: Niklas Nordin

 **Why people love working at Candela?**  

At Candela, we’re not just building electric vessels - we’re creating a whole new category of clean, efficient waterborne transport. You get the chance to work with **cutting-edge technology**, solving complex challenges, and seeing the results in action - sometimes literally, when we organize test rides for our newcomers! We’re a diverse and ambitious team of over 50 nationalities, united by a **revolutionary spirit and kindness**. That means we work hard, but always with humility and while having fun - whether it’s solving a manufacturing challenge, improving processes, or cheering each other on during **Candela Months**, our year-round calendar of bonding activities and events.  

  

We’re **office-first but not office-only**. We believe collaboration is most powerful when we build together, in person - but we also trust our team to work in ways that fit their life. At Candela, you’ll find a place where bold ideas are welcomed, great people are celebrated, and the ride is just as important as the destination.  

  

**Recruitment process:**  

We aim to keep our recruitment process as straightforward and efficient as possible. As an international company with English as our corporate language, the entire process is conducted in English. Therefore, please submit your application in our corporate language as well. Kindly note that we cannot process applications sent via email due to GDPR so please use our career website for you application.

 **We welcome the opportunity to meet you!**

title: HEAD OF AGILE & AD PRACTICES
description:
Scandinavian Airlines System SAS
  
  

Head of Agile & Application Development Practices
  
  

Are you someone who thrives on driving transformation and enabling teams to deliver high-quality digital solutions? Do you have a passion for agile ways of working and a strategic mindset for modern application development? If so, our Head of Agile & Application Development Practices role might be the perfect fit for you!
  
  

As Head of Agile & AD Practices, you will lead the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working by embedding a unified, business-integrated agile operating model across Digital & IT and the wider SAS organisation, while also driving the evolution of application development practices to enable scalable, high-quality software delivery.
  
  

**Challenges you will work on:**  

In this exciting and dynamic role, you will oversee the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working and application development practices.
  
You will tackle the intricate task of designing and implementing a mature agile setup anchored in agile frameworks, while modernizing engineering capabilities across teams. As the main point of contact for agile enablement and development excellence, you will coordinate with Digital & IT, SAS business units, and external partners to embed agile principles, roles, and ceremonies into cross-functional teams. Your ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders will be crucial in driving agile adoption, uplifting technical capabilities, and aligning delivery with strategic goals.
  
  

**Your ability to collaborate will be crucial as you:**  

* Lead and coach a team of agile professionals (coaches and scrum masters) to support agile adoption across business and IT.
* Define and implement agile metrics, governance models, and continuous improvement practices.
* Facilitate agile training, onboarding, and capability uplift across SAS and its partners.
* Lead the transformation of application development practices, including the adoption of modern engineering principles such as CI/CD, DevOps, automated testing, and cloud-native development.
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to align agile delivery with technical excellence and scalable architecture.
* Ensure integration of agile ways of working with robust application development lifecycles and tooling.


The Team
  
  

As the Head of Agile & AD Practices within our newly created Office of the CIO in Digital & IT, you will play a pivotal leadership role in shaping how SAS delivers value through agile ways of working and modern engineering practices. You will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to collaboration, innovation, and excellence.
  
In this role, you will lead the alignment of agile and application development practices across SAS, working closely with product owners, developers, scrum masters, and transformation teams.
  
  

**To be successful, we believe you have:**  

* Deep understanding of agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and scaling agile in large organisations.
* Strong leadership, coaching, and facilitation skills.
* Ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Strategic thinking with hands-on delivery mindset.
* Excellent communication and change management capabilities.
* Strong grasp of software development lifecycle, engineering principles, and agile technical practices.
* 7+ years of experience in agile roles, including 5+ years leading enterprise-level agile transformations.
* Proven track record implementing SAFe or similar frameworks in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.
* Experience working with both in-house and offshore delivery models.
* Demonstrated experience leading large-scale application development transformations, including modernizing engineering practices and delivery pipelines.
* University degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) certification or equivalent is a strong plus.
* Commitment to work from the office 3 days per week.


Additional Information
  
  

* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/12/25
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period


To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.
  
  

Is this you? If so, come fly with us!
