* Lead the transformation of application development practices, including the adoption of modern engineering principles such as CI/CD, DevOps, automated testing, and cloud-native development.
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to align agile delivery with technical excellence and scalable architecture.
* Ensure integration of agile ways of working with robust application development lifecycles and tooling.
**The Team**
------------

  

As the Head of Agile & AD Practices within our newly created Office of the CIO in Digital & IT, you will play a pivotal leadership role in shaping how SAS delivers value through agile ways of working and modern engineering practices. You will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to collaboration, innovation, and excellence.

  


In this role, you will lead the alignment of agile and application development practices across SAS, working closely with product owners, developers, scrum masters, and transformation teams. You will set the direction for how agile principles and engineering standards are embedded into cross-functional teams, ensuring consistency, scalability, and continuous improvement. As a key driver of SAS’s agile community of practice, you will foster a culture of transparency, learning, and delivery excellence—communicating effectively across the organization to champion agile and technical maturity.


**To be successful, we believe you have:**
------------------------------------------

* Deep understanding of agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and scaling agile in large organisations.
* Strong leadership, coaching, and facilitation skills.
* Ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Strategic thinking with hands-on delivery mindset.
* Excellent communication and change management capabilities.
* Strong grasp of software development lifecycle, engineering principles, and agile technical practices.
* 7+ years of experience in agile roles, including 5+ years leading enterprise-level agile transformations.
* Proven track record implementing SAFe or similar frameworks in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.
* Experience working with both in-house and offshore delivery models.
* Demonstrated experience leading large-scale application development transformations, including modernizing engineering practices and delivery pipelines.
* University degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) certification or equivalent is a strong plus.
* Commitment to work from the office 3 days per week.
**Why SAS?**
------------

At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.
**Our Culture at SAS**
----------------------

  


At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!

**Additional Information**
--------------------------

  

* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/12/25
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.
  


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**  

  

**#LI-VK1**

  

SAS, Scandinavia's leading airline since 1946, operates from its principal hub at Copenhagen Airport (CPH), complemented by hubs in Oslo (OSL) and Stockholm (ARN). Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. Each year, SAS serves more than 25 million passengers and transports 55 tons of cargo to 135 destinations across Europe, the USA, and Asia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. Innovation and societal progress are at the heart of everything we do. For

title: Devops Engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for an Devops Engineer to be based at our customer site in Södertälje, Stockholm.
  
The role
  
The consultant will support the DevOps team in maintaining and evolving CI/CD pipelines and AWS infrastructure, while contributing to the migration from a Conan-based polyrepo to a Bazel-powered monorepo. The work will focus on automation, infrastructure-as-code, cloud-native practices, and ensuring robust, secure delivery pipelines.
  
Furthermore, teamwork is central to us, so we value proactive, communicative individuals who take ownership of their work and contribute to our shared success.
  
  

**Role requirements:****Experience with:**  

* GitLab CI/YAML
* AWS (infrastructure & cloud-native services)
* Terraform
* Kubernetes
* Bazel or Conan build systems
* Docker & Linux
* Python or similar scripting
* Datadog
* JFROG Artifactory


Hybrid, with 2–4 mandatory office days per week. This requirement may change during the course of the assignment, and if necessary, we reserve the right to require up to 5 office days per week.
  
Education
  
Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.
  
If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on then we would love to hear from you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest; each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och ödmjuk **Engineering Manager** som vill leda genom förtroende, tydlighet och närvaro. Du brinner för att skapa förutsättningar för andra att lyckas och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik, produkt och verksamhet. Tillsammans med utvecklare, QA, produktägare och arkitekter driver du fram robusta, skalbara och användarcentrerade lösningar – med fokus på hållbarhet över tid.


Som Engineering Manager får du en nyckelroll i att omsätta mål och strategier till välfungerande leveranser. Du arbetar nära dina team för att coacha, undanröja hinder och säkerställa att vi bygger rätt saker på rätt sätt. Ditt ledarskap är **inlyssnande och förankrande**: du bjuder in till dialog, samlar team och intressenter kring beslut, och säkerställer att förändringar är förankrade innan de genomförs. Du mäter hellre effekt än aktivitet och bygger kultur genom exempel, feedback och transparens.


Hos oss är det agila arbetssättet mer än en metod – det är vår kultur. Vi levererar inkrementellt med täta dialoger med beställare och användare, så att värde uppstår kontinuerligt och lösningarna blir ändamålsenliga och långsiktigt hållbara.


Här får du möjligheten att leda i en miljö där ditt ledarskap, din tekniska förståelse och din förmåga att skapa värde verkligen gör skillnad.

**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda ingenjörsteam (t.ex. som Engineering Manager, Team Lead eller liknande).
* Har bakgrund inom tech – som utvecklare/arkitekt eller i ledande roll på tech-bolag.
* Leder med ödmjukhet: lyssnar aktivt, förankrar beslut, skapar delaktighet och driver kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Är van att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team och att balansera teknisk kvalitet, leveranstakt och affärsnytta.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på **engelska** i tal och skrift; **svenska** är meriterande.

**Meriterande erfarenheter:*** **SaaS, gaming eller annan high-tech-miljö.**
* **Microsoft-miljö** (t.ex. .NET, Azure, M365, DevOps-verktyg).
* Samarbete och dialog på **C-level** (budget, roadmap, portföljstyrning).
* **Industri-/tillverkningsbolag** där produkten når slutkund (fältfeedback, livscykel, eftermarknad).
* Skalning av organisation och processer (rekrytering, kompetensutveckling, metrics/OKR, incident- & förändringshantering).


Ditt uppdrag i praktiken:* Coacha och utveckla människor och team – mål, feedback, karriärvägar och välmående.
* Säkerställa teknisk riktning tillsammans med arkitektur och produkt – från strategi till leverans.
* Förankra beslut tvärfunktionellt och facilitera prioritering utifrån data och effekt.
* Driva förbättringar inom kvalitet, flöde och säkerhet (t.ex. CI/CD, incidentprocess, SLO/SLI).


English summery:
We are looking for an experienced and humble **Engineering Manager** to lead through trust, clarity, and presence. You will coach and support agile engineering teams, enabling collaboration and building robust, scalable, and user-centered solutions with long-term sustainability in focus.


You thrive at the intersection of technology, product, and business, and bring a background from tech – either as a developer/architect or in a leadership role. You lead with humility by listening, anchoring decisions, and fostering inclusion.


Experience from SaaS, gaming, high-tech or Microsoft environments is meriting knowledge, as well as exposure to C-level collaboration, industrial settings with end-customer products. Fluency in English is required; Swedish is a plus.

**Kontakta ansvarig kontaktperson Philip vid frågor**, philip.leopoldson@adavo.se.  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Azure Network Administrator
description:
We are looking for a **Senior Azure Network Administrator** for a global company in **Lund.**

**Start is in October 2025, 1 year's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

 **Technical Skills & Expertise:**

* Strong hands-on experience in managing Azure infrastructure
* Extensive experience in the following areas :
* Azure Policies (custom policies)
* Azure Networking
* Azure Security
* Terraform Automation
* Azure Monitoring
* Azure Kubernetes Services (even if Basics)
* Experience in deploying cloud resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) e.g. Terraform, Ansible
* Identify potential threats and weaknesses of existing cloud infrastructure and conduct regular security assessments

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Minimum 4+ years of experience in Azure cloud administration and total 7+ years of managing IT infrastructure
* Good to have 2+ years of experience in implementing IaC, Kubernetes and CI/CD pipelines
* Desired Characteristics
* Traditional network experience
* Experience working in Agile & DevOps environments
* Good to have experience in managing complex cloud infrastructure
* Passionate for taking initiative and eager to learn and develop their cloud/DevOps skills
* Team player and comfortable conducting knowledge transfer sessions within the team and with stakeholders

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* As a part of Product team, you will be focusing on cloud infrastructure provisioning, administration, automation, configuring security policies, bringing initiatives to optimize cost etc.
* Performing security assessment of cloud resources and taking initiatives to improve security posture.


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Lund. Start is in October, 1 year's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Senior Scrum Master
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 4 års aktuell erfarenhet från de senaste 10 åren av arbete som Scrum Master för ett agilt leveransteam.
* Minst 3 års aktuell erfarenhet från de senaste 10 åren av att arbeta ADS (Azure DevOps server) eller liknande.
* Vara certifierad Scrum Master (t ex PSM, SCM eller motsvarande).
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av arbete som förvaltningsledare utifrån ett utvecklingsperspektiv och i relation till it-infrastruktur, integrationer och drift.
* Erfarenhet av cochande och kommunikativt ledarskap så som coachande ledarskap i agila team.
* Minst 2 års aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila metoder.
* Erfarenhet av minst två års arbete från de senaste 10 åren som Scrum Master i offentlig sektor.
* Flytande på svenska i både tal och skrift.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med förändringsledning.
* Certifierad agil coach.

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 09-10-2025 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: DevOps Integration Engineer
description:

 to strengthen our Integration Platform team. You will be responsible for the

title: Site Reliability Engineer/Architect
description:
Vi söker en erfaren
 **Site Reliability Architect** 
 som vill etablera arbetssättet för SRE från grunden och sätta strukturer, metoder och processer som höjer tillförlitlighet, driftsäkerhet och skalbarhet. Du blir central i kundens förändringsresa – från en tätt sammanlänkad systemmiljö till en mer flexibel och hållbar infrastruktur. Rollen kombinerar
 **strategisk riktning** 
 med
 **hands-on implementation** 
 .
   

  

 Som SRE/Architect arbetar du nära utveckling, drift och produkt för att definiera mål, mäta utfallet och systematiskt förbättra allt från incidenthantering till kapacitetsplanering. Du etablerar mätetal (SLO/SLI), automatiserar bort manuellt arbete och bygger lösningar som fungerar lika bra i vardagen som under peak.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag:**
* Etablera rutiner, processer och ramverk för SRE (SLO/SLI, error budgets, incident & problem management).
* Bygga robusta, skalbara och hållbara plattformar och tjänster.
* Initiera och leda förändringsarbete som minskar kopplingar/beroenden och ökar autonomi.
* Driva automatisering (IaC, CI/CD), observability (logging/metrics/tracing) och resilienstestning.
* Bidra med chaos engineering-praktiker och moderna DevOps-principer.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har flera års erfarenhet som Site Reliability Engineer eller liknande (Production Engineering/Platform).
* Har djup förståelse för drift i stor skala och hög tillgänglighet.
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av molnplattformar, särskilt AWS.
* Har bevisad förmåga att bygga upp SRE-processer och arbetssätt från grunden.


**Meriterande:**
* Infrastrukturkompetens och erfarenhet av Linux-miljöer.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av chaos engineering.
* Erfarenhet av IaC (t.ex. Terraform), containers/orkestrering (Docker/Kubernetes), CI/CD och observability-stackar.


 Här får du möjligheten att sätta standarden: från principer och mätetal till teknikval och implementation – och se resultaten i form av snabbare återhämtning, färre incidenter och nöjdare användare.
   

  

**Kontakta ansvarig kontaktperson Philip vid frågor:** 
 philip.leopoldson@adavo.se
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Azure DevOps Engineer – DataOps & Data Engineering
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Banking
description:
**Role: Azure DevOps Engineer – DataOps & Data Engineering** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Job Type: Contract** 




  





**Experience Level:** 
 7–9 years
 



  





**Job Summary:** 




 We are seeking a seasoned Azure DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on DataOps, data sourcing, data management, and test management pipelines. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in implementing CI/CD pipelines for data platforms, automating data workflows, and ensuring robust data quality and governance. Exposure to Databricks and big data platforms is a strong plus.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 • Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines for data engineering and analytics projects.
 



 • Automate data sourcing, data ingestion, and data transformation processes using Azure DevOps and related tools.
 



 • Develop and maintain test management pipelines to ensure data quality, validation, and lineage. • Collaborate with data engineers, architects, and QA teams to streamline DataOps practices.
 



 • Integrate and orchestrate workflows across Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, and other Azure services.
 



 • Monitor and troubleshoot pipeline failures, performance bottlenecks, and deployment issues.
 



 • Implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, ARM templates, or Bicep.
 



 • Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and privacy standards.
 



 • Participate in Agile ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
 



  





**Required Technical Skills:** 




 • 7–9 years of experience in DevOps, with at least 3+ years in Azure DevOps.
 



 • Strong understanding of DataOps principles and data lifecycle management.
 



 • Experience with Azure DevOps Pipelines, Repos, Artifacts, and Boards.
 



 • Proficiency in PowerShell, YAML, and scripting for automation.
 



 • Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and Azure Storage.
 



 • Familiarity with Databricks, Apache Spark, and Delta Lake.
 



 • Experience with test automation frameworks for data validation and quality checks.
 



 • Knowledge of Git, branching strategies, and release management.
 



  





**Soft Skills:** 




 • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 



 • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
 



 • Ability to work independently and in cross-functional Agile teams.
 



 • Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and reliability.
 



 • Proactive and continuous improvement mindset.
 



  





**Agile & SAFe Ways of Working:** 




 • Experience working in Agile or SAFe Agile environments.
 



 • Participation in PI Planning, sprint ceremonies, and system demos.
 



 • Familiarity with Agile tools like Azure Boards, JIRA, or VersionOne.
 



 • Ability to contribute to Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and Program Increments (PIs).
 



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 • Certifications in Azure DevOps, Azure Data Engineer, or Databricks.
 



 • Experience with Terraform, Bicep, or ARM templates for IaC.
 



 • Exposure to data governance frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).

title: DevOps Engineering Manager
description:
**Vill du vara med på resan och ansvara för att leda vår transformation till Cloud?** 
 Välkommen till oss som vår nya DevOps Engineer Manager!
   

  

 Vi är ett framgångsrikt produktbolag som fokuserar på att leverera en FaaS-tjänst för redovisning, ekonomi och lön till våra kunder. Sen vår start för 10+ år sedan har vi vuxit organiskt och med sunda finanser. Kleer är i starten på ett omfattande tekniskt initiativ och behöver förstärka vår organisation! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 På Development är vi idag cirka ca 35 kollegor som arbetar tillsammans för att driva innovation och kontinuerligt vidareutveckla vår produkt. Vi jobbar i en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

**👉🏼 Om rollen**
 Som DevOps Engineering Manager kommer du arbeta operativt och spela en avgörande roll i vårt team som idag består av 2 personer. Du kommer ha ansvar för att leda och utveckla vår operations och infrastrukturprocesser. Vi söker dig som är operativt involverad i arbetet i teamet men vill gå in i en ledarroll och bli en del av ledningsgruppen på Development.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelspelare i att säkerställa smidighet, effektivitet och stabilitet i vårt team. Du kommer även vara ansvarig för att leda vår transformation till cloud.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden som DevOps Engineering Manager:**
* Operations och Infrastruktur: Ansvara för övervakning, underhåll och optimering av vår infrastruktur.
* Releasehantering: Leda utvecklingen och implementeringen av automatiserade byggpipelines och säkerställa effektiva releaser.
* Metrics och Incidenthantering: Implementera och övervaka KPI:er och metrics för systemets hälsa, samt leda incidenthantering och problemlösning.
* Tekniskt Ledarskap: Agera som en mentor och ledare inom teamet, driva projekt framåt och vara proaktiv i att identifiera och åtgärda tekniska utmaningar.
* Cloud Transformation: Spela en ledande roll i vår övergång till cloud-baserade lösningar, inklusive arbete med Kubernetes och andra cloud-teknologier. Samt arbeta med att optimera vår cloud-drift.
* Personalansvar: Utveckla och stödja teamet som finns idag genom mentorskap, feedback och individuell utveckling för att skapa en stimulerande och positiv arbetsmiljö.


****💜 Vem söker vi?****
 Vi söker dig som har relevant utbildning samt stark bakgrund inom DevOps, med bevisad erfarenhet av att hantera operations, infrastruktur, och releaseprocesser. Vidare tror vi att du har;
   

  

* Erfarenhet från liknade tech stack: Java, MySQL, Jenkins, Maven, ELK, Prometheus, GitLab.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av cloud-teknologier, särskilt inom cloud transformation och Kubernetes, är mycket meriterande.
* Förmågan att arbeta självständigt, ta initiativ och leda både projekt och människor.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och en proaktiv inställning till utmaningar.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmågan att samarbeta effektivt inom ett team.


 Vi erbjuder en spännande roll i hjärtat av vår tekniska transformation. Vi har en dynamisk och stöttande arbetsmiljö där dina idéer och bidrag värderas högt. Du kommer få en möjlighet till professionell utveckling och tillväxt inom företaget.
   

  

 Det finns så mycket mer att berätta om både Kleer som bolag, vår vision att göra svenska företag mer framgångsrika, vår kultur, utvecklingsteamet, produkten m.m. Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill veta mer! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Önskad start:** 
 Så snart vi hittar rätt person för rollen, enligt överenskommelse. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.

 •Monitor and troubleshoot pipeline failures, performance bottlenecks, and deployment issues.
 



 •Implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, ARM templates, or Bicep.
 



 •Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and privacy standards.
 



 •Participate in Agile ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
 



  





**Required Technical Skills:** 




 •7–9 years of experience in DevOps, with at least 3+ years in Azure DevOps.
 



 •Strong understanding of DataOps principles and data lifecycle management.
 



 •Experience with Azure DevOps Pipelines, Repos, Artifacts, and Boards.
 



 •Proficiency in PowerShell, YAML, and scripting for automation.
 



 •Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and Azure Storage.
 



 •Familiarity with Databricks, Apache Spark, and Delta Lake.
 



 •Experience with test automation frameworks for data validation and quality checks.
 



 •Knowledge of Git, branching strategies, and release management.
 



  





**Soft Skills:** 




 •Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 



 •Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
 



 •Ability to work independently and in cross-functional Agile teams.
 



 •Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and reliability.
 



 •Proactive and continuous improvement mindset.
 



  





**Agile & SAFe Ways of Working:** 




 •Experience working in Agile or SAFe Agile environments.
 



 •Participation in PI Planning, sprint ceremonies, and system demos.
 



 •Familiarity with Agile tools like Azure Boards, JIRA, or VersionOne.
 



 •Ability to contribute to Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and Program Increments (PIs).
 



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 •Certifications in Azure DevOps, Azure Data Engineer, or Databricks.
 



 •Experience with Terraform, Bicep, or ARM templates for IaC.
 



 •Exposure to data governance frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta som DevOps Engineer och söker en ny utmaning i karriären? Då kan vi på Centric hjälpa dig! Vi har flera kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor i Stockholm som växer och därför söker vi nu flera DevOps som kan bidra med sin kunskap och stärka verksamheterna.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som DevOps Engineer spelar du en nyckelroll i att bygga och underhålla infrastruktur som stödjer olika utvecklings- och driftprocesser. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteamet och kravställare.
 



  





***I denna roll som DevOps Engineer kommer du bland annat arbeta med att:***




*• Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter* 




 • Skapa och underhålla molninfrastruktur med hjälp av verktyg som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud
 



 • Felsöka och lösa tekniska problem relaterade till utveckling och drift
 



 • Implementera och hantera CI/CD-pipelines för kontinuerlig integration och leverans
 



 • Automatisera driftprocesser med hjälp av verktyg som Terraform, Ansible eller Kubernetes
 



 • Samarbeta med utvecklings- och driftavdelningar för att förbättra arbetsflöden och optimera system
 



 • Hantera incidenter
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Rollen kräver ett proaktivt tankesätt och du har ett intresse för att automatisera processer samt lösa komplexa problem. För att lyckas i en roll som DevOps Engineer hos någon av våra kunder ser vi att du har minst två års erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps-verktyg och tekniker som Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Git etc.
 



  





 Som person är du kreativ och tar initiativ till att utveckla och förbättra. Du vågar att testa nytt och tänka annorlunda. Du kan arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du har god samarbetsförmåga.
 



  





**Krav** 




 • Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter
 



 • Goda kunskaper om molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, GCP)
 



 • Stark förståelse för infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och automatiseringsverktyg (Terraform, Ansible)
 



 • God kännedom om nätverkskonfiguration och säkerhetsprinciper
 



 • Mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska
 



  





**Meriterande** 




 • Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av systemadministration i en Linuxbaserad produktionsmiljö
 



 • Erfarenhet av scriptprogrammering i Linuxmiljöer så som Python, Ruby, Perl eller motsvarande
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands.
   

  

 As a Platform Engineer within our AI, Analytics & Data department, you will:
   

  

 → Design, develop, and manage scalable data platforms on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
   

  

 → Implement and manage infrastructure as code using Terraform
   

  

 → Automate deployment processes using GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to ensure data availability and quality
   

  

 → Monitor and optimize data pipelines for performance and cost-efficiency
   

  

 → Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations
   

  

 → Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data infrastructure
   

  

 → Work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used across the globe
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of the AI, Analytics & Data department; a dynamic and innovative team at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. You’ll collaborate with passionate technologists and leaders who are driving the digital transformation of H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
 → Equivalent hands-on experience in a similar technical role or a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
   

  

 → Strong expertise in GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Workflows, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, etc.)
   

  

 → Experience with CI/CD tools, particularly GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Experience with dbt for data transformation
   

  

 → Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices
   

  

 → Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or similar languages
   

  

*And people who are:*
 → Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to take full ownership of initiatives
   

  

 → Excellent problem-solvers with attention to detail
   

  

 → Strong communicators and collaborators
   

  

 → Comfortable working independently and as part of a team
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 → A tech-driven environment with cutting-edge tools and platforms
   

  

 → Opportunities to grow and shape the future of data and AI at H&M
   

  

 → A collaborative culture that values innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning
   

  

 → All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
   

  

 → All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things: our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
 Resources needed: 2

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**About Hypertype**
 We’re building the next generation of AI products and AI Agents in the Customer Support space. Focused on manufacturing but with clients across other sectors like fintech, health tech and more we are giving hundreds of companies across the globe the capacity to transform their customer journey with the latest advancements in AI. Our customers proudly recognise us for delivering the "highest quality answers in the market... outsmarting Gemini, Fin, Microsoft Copilot etc". —a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and precision in every interaction.
   

  

 We are a group of people that work the extra mile together, that fearlessly push the boundaries to new heights and that deeply own what they deliver. We look for those who are ambitious, humble and fast to build together things humankind has not witnessed yet.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Platform engineer at Hypertype you’ll design, operate, and evolve the cloud foundation that keeps our AI products fast, reliable, and cost-efficient. You’ll own GCP architecture (networking, security, deploys), Terraform-based IaC, observability, and SLOs. Your days will involve shaping golden paths for services, improving CI/CD, and partnering with engineers to keep latency and unit costs down as we scale.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build and maintain secure, scalable infrastructure on GCP (Kubernetes, VPC, Pub/Sub, etc.).
* Define and manage Terraform modules, CI/CD pipelines, secrets and safe rollouts/rollbacks.
* Establish observability (logs, metrics, tracing), SLOs/SLIs and on-call playbooks; drive incident response improvements.
* Optimise performance and cost (autoscaling, casing, connection pooling, query tuning, storage cycle).
* Collaborate with Software and ML Engineers to set targets, debug production issues and improve developer experience.


**Who Are You**
* +4 years in Platform/SRE/Cloud Engineering operating production systems.
* Deep experience with GCP or equivalent cloud; strong Terraform/IaC fundamentals.
* Solid grasp of networking, security hardening and least-privilege access.
* Hands-on with observability stacks and SLO/error-budget practices.
* Commitment to very solid reliability, simplicity and creating paved roads for developers.


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to be part of an early, well-funded and promising startup. The right place at the right time.
* A role and position that gives you the freedom to develop your skills and persona the way you want.
* Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront on solving the world's AI challenges and work towards AGI.
* Competitive salary + stock options + maximum growing opportunities.

title: Test Engineer
description:
**Role Description**




  





 1. Test Preparation and Role Definition: Business Test Conducted by end users or requesters to validate functionality from a business process perspective. Formal Technical Test Verification of correct implementation of workflows and processes. Test Planning Creating and expanding test scenarios in DevOps (e.g., via TestPlans in Visual Studio). Test Automation Supplying test cases to the test automation team.
 



  





 2. Test Execution Business Regression Tests Performing tests at task or bug level, or regression tests across the entire lifecycle. Role Tests Checking whether new roles are correctly assigned and whether the content (e.g., reports, dashboards) is displayed as expected. Negative Tests Ensuring that roles can only access the intended data (e.g., a role for Sweden only shows SE data).
 



  





 3. Test Environments and ToolsUse of test systems such as SAP ERP, which are connected to the HR portal. Error reproduction.
 



  





 Skills/Requirements:
 


* Knowledge of TestComplete
* Workflow and process analysis skills.
* Ability to perform error analyses.
* Coordination with project stakeholders in English.
* Documentation and tracking of test activities.
* Participation in meetings on system integration and rollout planning.
* Quality Assurance Supplying data for internal and external audits.

title: Test Engineer (IAM)
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Test Engineer (IAM / Medior)
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (with possible presence in Helsingborg)
 



**Hybrid** 
 : 2-3 days per week on-site
 



**Duration** 
 : 6-12+ months
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking a
 **Test Engineer** 
 with strong expertise in IAM (Identity & Access Management) to support testing activities across business and technical processes. The role involves preparing and executing tests, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring compliance with audit and quality standards.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Test Preparation & Planning**
* Create and expand test scenarios in DevOps (e.g., TestPlans in Visual Studio).
* Supply test cases to the test automation team.
* Support business and technical testing of workflows and processes.
* **Test Execution**
* Perform business regression and role-based tests.
* Validate correct role assignments (e.g., dashboards, reports).
* Conduct negative testing to ensure correct data access restrictions.
* **Test Environments & Tools**
* Work with systems such as SAP ERP connected to HR portals.
* Reproduce and analyze errors across IAM workflows.



**Requirements** 




**Technical:** 



* Strong knowledge of IAM systems (Omada required; EntraID, Active Directory, File Shares desirable).
* Experience with workflow and process analysis.
* Ability to perform error analyses and handle AD groups/permission structures.
* Familiarity with automated QA tools (e.g., TestComplete).



**Organizational:** 



* Experience coordinating with stakeholders and project teams in English.
* Ability to document and track testing activities.
* Participation in integration and rollout planning meetings.



**Compliance / Quality Assurance:** 



* Provide testing evidence and data for internal/external audits.



**Experience & Competencies** 



* **Experience:** 
 6–10+ years in IT testing (IAM testing highly preferred).
* **Communication:** 
 Strong ability to work with stakeholders and clients.
* **Supervision:** 
 Able to work independently with moderate guidance.

title: Senior Platform Engineer (Infrastructure)
company_industry: Software Development, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**Platform** 




**Gelato** 
 is an
 **AI-first** 
 , cloud-native platform transforming local, on-demand production and delivery — with zero physical assets. We power:
 


* **Global production orchestration** 
 : connecting e-commerce customers to 130+ partners across 32 countries. From AI-guided plate design to smart routing and logistics, we deliver to over 5 billion people in under 72 hours—faster, greener, smarter.
* **GelatoConnect** 
 : our AI-driven print production OS that helps producers master digital printing — from inventory to shipping — by automating every step: procurement, prepress, printing, packaging, and dispatch. It’s machine-agnostic, real-time, and built for uptime, precision, and profitability.



  





**AI at the Core** 




 We are not just early adopters of AI — we’re
 **AI-native builders** 
 . Across engineering, product, and operations, we embrace AI to accelerate innovation:
 


* **AI-first development** 
 using LLMs for code generation, testing, documentation, and design exploration.
* **Autonomous AI agents** 
 driving platform resilience, observability, cost control, and internal workflow automation.
* **AI-native product features** 
 built into GelatoConnect and the core platform — improving routing, personalization, and production optimization.
* A culture of
 **continuous experimentation** 
 with RAG, agent orchestration, prompt engineering, and model fine-tuning.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Ensure 24/7 platform operations, including on-call support and incident response.
* Build and evolve
 **AI agents** 
 that automate scaling, recovery, and diagnostics through control-plane patterns and event-driven logic.
* Manage
 **multi-cloud infrastructure** 
 , including serverless, through declarative, automated workflows.
* Collaborate with the
 **Delivery Platform** 
 team to improve DevEx with intelligent internal tooling.
* Drive
 **reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency** 
 across Gelato’s global infrastructure.
* Enable engineers with
 **self-service, secure, and scalable delivery pipelines** 
 .



  





**Qualifications** 



* Deep understanding of
 **Linux fundamentals** 
 (processes, I/O, filesystems, networking, memory management, system internals).
* Deep experience with
 **AWS** 
 (primary)
 **and GCP** 
 (bonus), including cost optimizations, EKS, networking, S3, VPC peering, IAM, and related services.
* Strong understanding of
 **Kubernetes internals** 
 , including networking, security, and cluster operations.
* Hands-on experience with
 **GitOps workflows** 
 (e.g. ArgoCD) and
 **Infrastructure as Code** 
 using Terraform.
* Proficient in
 **Python, Go** 
 , or other languages — with a willingness to learn Go if not already familiar.
* Comfortable using
 **AI development tools** 
 like Cursor, Claude, and coding with LLMs.



  





 Experience with or strong interest in building
 **AI agents and RAG workflows** 
 , with a commitment to learn if needed.
 



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Senior ETL Developer
description:

 Location : Sweden - Stockholm

 We are looking for a results-driven ETL Developer with deep expertise in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and Teradata, along with hands-on experience in Azure Data Services and Databricks. The ideal candidate will be part of a cross-functional agile team, contributing to the design, development, and optimization of scalable data integration solutions in a SAFe Agile environment.
 



  





**Required Technical Skills** 




 • 5+ years of experience in ETL development using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI).
 



 • Strong expertise in Teradata including performance tuning and query optimization.
 



 • Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and scripting (Shell, Python).
 



 • Experience with Azure Data Services: Data Factory, Synapse, Blob Storage.
 



 • Hands-on experience with Databricks and Apache Spark.
 



 • Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and data lake architectures

 • Certifications in ODI, Teradata, or Azure Data Engineer Associate.
 



 • Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps practices in data engineering.
 



 • Understanding of data security, compliance, and governance in cloud environments

title: Platform Success Manager
description:
**FICO (NYSE: FICO)** 
 is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 100+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
*“As a Platform Success Manager, you will serve as a strategic advisor and trusted partner to enterprise customers leveraging the FICO Platform. Balancing business acumen with technical understanding, you will ensure customers achieve measurable value through effective platform adoption, operational alignment, and ongoing engagement. Your mission is to drive customer success by aligning platform capabilities with strategic goals, ensuring both business impact and operational excellence.”* 
 - Platform Success, Senior Director
   

  

**What You'll Contribute**
* Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with business stakeholders, product owners, and executive sponsors.
* Conduct strategic planning and regular business reviews to align platform usage with customers' evolving goals.
* Drive value realization by linking platform capabilities to business outcomes across industries like banking, insurance, and telecom.
* Lead enablement and ongoing engagement efforts to maximize customer adoption and satisfaction.
* Promote usage of platform features through best practices, tailored training, and data-driven recommendations.
* Facilitate change management and empower customers to become self-sufficient users of the platform.
* Partner with technical teams (DevOps, Engineering, IT) to ensure secure, scalable, and compliant platform deployments.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), usage patterns, and service health to proactively identify risks or optimization opportunities.
* Support incident response and ensure timely communication, transparency, and continuous improvement.
* Act as the voice of the customer across internal teams, influencing product direction and support priorities based on field insights.
* Work closely with Sales and Professional Services to identify expansion opportunities and align on customer growth strategies.
* Develop and maintain success plans that integrate functional outcomes, platform performance metrics, and strategic objectives.


**What We're Seeking**
* 5+ years of experience in customer success, platform consulting, or strategic account management, preferably with enterprise SaaS/PaaS platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to engage both business and technical stakeholders, translating complex concepts into clear value propositions.
* Strong business acumen and experience driving measurable outcomes in highly regulated or data-driven industries.
* Familiarity with cloud-native platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), APIs, and platform health metrics—enough to collaborate effectively with technical teams.
* Excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.


**Our Offer to You**
* An inclusive culture strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
* The opportunity to make an impact and develop professionally by leveraging your unique strengths and participating in valuable learning experiences.
* Highly competitive compensation, benefits and rewards programs that encourage you to bring your best every day and be recognized for doing so.
* An engaging, people-first work environment offering work/life balance, employee resource groups, and social events to promote interaction and camaraderie.


**Why Make a Move to FICO?**
 At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimization, and much more.
   

  

 FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
   

  

* Credit Scoring — FICO® Scores are used by 90 of the top 100 US lenders.
* Fraud Detection and Security — 4 billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
* Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.


 Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We help many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success. Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
   

  

 Learn more about how you can fulfil your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
   

  

 FICO promotes a culture of inclusion and seeks to attract a diverse set of candidates for each job opportunity. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all candidates without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Research has shown that women and candidates from underrepresented communities may not apply for an opportunity if they don’t meet all stated qualifications. While our qualifications are clearly related to role success, each candidate’s profile is unique and strengths in certain skill and/or experience areas can be equally effective. If you believe you have many, but not necessarily all, of the stated qualifications we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Information submitted with your application is subject to the FICO Privacy policy at https://www.fico.com/en/privacy-policy

title: Plant Maintenance Manager
description:
**SAP PM Expertise:** 
 Minimum
 **10+ years** 
 in SAP PM (Plant Maintenance) implementation and support.
 



**S4HANA:** 
 Proven experience in
 **S4HANA implementations & migrations** 
 .
 



**Fiori Applications:** 
 Solid hands-on experience with SAP Fiori in PM.
 



**Integration:** 
 Strong knowledge of SAP PM integration with MM and other modules.
 



**Communication:** 
 Excellent English (spoken & written), able to work in multinational setups.
 



**Blueprinting & Documentation:** 
 Skilled in gathering requirements, writing blueprints, and preparing functional specifications.
 



**DevOps:** 
 Experience working with Microsoft DevOps for SAP projects is a plus.
 



**Agile/Scrum:** 
 Comfortable working in agile teams and collaborative cross-functional setups.
 



**ABAP (Optional):** 
 Basic knowledge of ABAP programming for troubleshooting custom developments.

title: Data Engineer
description:

* SQL expert, ideally BigQuery: window functions, partitioning/clustering, table decorators, EXPLAIN, maximum\_bytes\_billed, materialized views.
