All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: CEO/Co-Founder for EdTech Company
description:
**Note this is an unpaid job.** 




  





**Compensation & Benefits:** 




 Equity stake in the company. Opportunity to lead as full CEO after successful internship period. Hands-on experience building a high-tech startup from the ground up. Mentorship and collaboration with a technical co-founder and founding team. This role is ideal for a highly motivated, entrepreneurial leader passionate about AI, software, and sustainable energy, who is willing to invest their time to shape a company with high growth potential.
 



  





**Company Description** 




 Virtwin-Energy AB is an EdTech/Software company revolutionizing how industrial software is used in combustion and energy production. Our flagship product, Ignite-AI, envisions a world where engineers, researchers, and students can seamlessly access professional-grade tools for combustion science, fuel innovation, and energy system design—eliminating the traditional expert-only barriers.
 



 We are building the first AI-native combustion and techno-economic cloud platform, where industries, researchers, and students can collaborate, innovate, and accelerate the transition toward sustainable energy effortlessly. Our mission is to democratize access to industrial intelligence and empower a new generation of energy innovators.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 We are seeking a visionary CEO/Co-Founder to join Virtwin-Energy AB, based in the Greater Stockholm Metropolitan Area. As CEO/Co-Founder, you will be a driving force in shaping the company from inception, defining its strategy, operations, and growth trajectory.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 




 • Company Strategy & Operations: Define and execute the company’s business model, go-to-market strategy, and operational processes.
 



 • Fundraising & Financial Leadership: Secure initial funding, manage investor relations, and establish financial sustainability.
 



 • Customer Acquisition & Partnerships: Drive early customer acquisition, build key industry partnerships, and validate product-market fit.
 



 • Team Leadership: Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing team while fostering a collaborative, innovative culture.
 



 • End-to-End Business Management: Oversee all aspects of planning, operations, and commercial activities to ensure alignment with the company’s mission.
 



 This is a hands-on role for a leader passionate about AI, software, and sustainable energy solutions—someone capable of navigating the challenges of a high-growth startup environment.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 • Strong command of English is essential; knowledge of Swedish is advantageous..
 



 • Proven experience in startup leadership, including fundraising, business development, and scaling operations.
 



 • Strong expertise in strategic and business planning, with a track record of executing complex projects.
 



 • Experience in sales, marketing, and early customer acquisition, ideally in software, industrial tech, or energy sectors.
 



 • Solid understanding of finance, budgeting, and investor relations.
 



 • Technical familiarity with software products, ideally AI, SaaS, or EdTech platforms, and the ability to collaborate closely with engineering teams.
 



 • Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with experience building and motivating teams.
 



 • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.
 



 • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or a related field; MBA or equivalent experience preferred.
 



  





**Company Journey & Roadmap** 




 Virtwin-Energy AB is at a pivotal stage in its journey to transform industrial software for combustion and energy systems. Our MVP, Ignite-AI, is already deployed online, currently offering core functionality in flame speed and equilibrium calculations. This early release validates our vision and provides a foundation for building a comprehensive AI-native platform for engineers, researchers, and students.
 



  





**Our team is small but highly skilled:** 




 Technical co-founder: A professor and researcher with experience at leading universities, bringing deep domain knowledge in combustion science and energy systems.
 



 Software co-founder: Holds two master’s degrees in coding and software development, responsible for the platform’s technical development and implementation.
 



 Other partners: Supported by students, colleagues from KTH and Scania, and researchers from related fields, contributing expertise and collaboration to accelerate product development.
 



  





**Our immediate roadmap focuses on:** 




 Expanding platform capabilities beyond the current MVP to offer advanced combustion and techno-economic analysis tools. Joining an incubator to accelerate product development, gain mentorship, and access early-stage investors. Securing seed investment to scale operations, hire additional talent, and bring the platform to market. Building early partnerships and first customers to validate product-market fit and refine features. This is a high-impact opportunity to join a lean, expert team at the ground level, contribute to shaping the company’s strategy, and drive innovation in sustainable energy software.

title: DATA & AI STRATEGY LEAD
description:
**Data & AI Strategy lead**
 Do you see the big picture in data and have a passion for turning AI potential into real business value? Are you driven by strategic thinking and thrive in shaping the future of aviation through innovation? If so, our Data & AI Strategy Lead role could be your next great adventure!
   

  

 As a Data & AI Strategy Lead you will serve as a key figure in guiding the direction of AI at SAS, both from a business and capability perspective.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this exciting role, you’ll support the development and refinement of SAS’s Data & AI strategy, helping to translate complex insights into actionable roadmaps and investment cases in close collaboration with the Head of Data & AI and other departmental leaders. You’ll contribute to the execution of AI initiatives, ensuring they align with strategic priorities and deliver measurable value across the organization. By staying informed on industry trends, you’ll assist in evaluating their impact on SAS’s technology landscape and provide input to guide leadership decisions. You’ll also help coordinate alignment among senior stakeholders and contribute to progress reporting for the Executive Leadership Team.
   

  

**The Team**
 You will be part of the AI & Data leadership team and work closely with your peers and their respective team that are composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds, Our team’s values collaboration, innovation, and a commitment to excellence. We support each other and thrive on creating a positive and inclusive work environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 You will report directly to
 **Jonas Blomqvist, Acting Head of Data & AI** 
 , until this position has been permanently filled.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* A University degree, Master of Science or equivalent
* 2–5 years of experience in management consulting or business development
* 2–5 years of hands-on experience with AI and data technologies
* Deep understanding of AI concepts, trends, and use cases—especially within complex industries like aviation.
* Comfortable interacting with senior leadership and aligning across executive stakeholders.
* Experience in leading or supporting digital transformation initiatives, with a strong understanding of emerging technologies.
* Solid technical knowledge of how AI influences enterprise architecture and system design.
* Ability to translate technical insights into actionable business recommendations and investment cases.
* Proven ability to initiate, manage, and report on cross-functional projects with measurable outcomes.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 15/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Nordics
description:
**Who We Are**
 Designed with simplicity in mind, Verkada's six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace, and intercoms — provide unparalleled building security through an integrated, cloud-based software platform. Over 33,500 organizations, including 96 companies in the Fortune 500, across 93 countries worldwide trust Verkada as their physical security layer for easier management, intelligent control, and scalable deployments. Founded in 2016 with more than $700M in funding raised to-date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 15 offices and 2,200+ full-time employees.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Verkada is currently searching for a talented and ambitious sales representative to grow out our Enterprise function from the ground up in the Nordics region. You would be directly responsible for a greenfield territory with a virtually untapped market of enterprise customers.
   

  

 Verkada is building a world-class sales organisation. Our business requires highly motivated and capable sales professionals. We prioritise drive and demonstrated success in whatever sales role you’ve been in before — we care far less about fancy pedigrees, schools, or a resume with “brand name” companies. We have a fun, positive culture of success and reward.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Source and close new business to consistently meet or exceed quarterly sales quotas
* Build an intimate understanding of Verkada products and their place in the industry
* Manage the full sales cycle: Prospect for new customers, host online demos, create proposals, and close deals
* Maintain accurate pipeline management with expert-level forecasting
* Aggressively exceed goals consisting of outbound phone calls, emails, online demos, and trials every quarter
* Act as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert to customers and channel partners
* Provide market/client feedback to Verkada’s product/engineering team
* This role requires regular travel, estimated to be more than 50% of the time, including both domestic and international destinations as needed. The successful candidate must be comfortable with frequent travel to support business operations, customer and partner engagements and team collaboration.


 What You Bring
   

  

* 5-10+ years of quota exceeding Sales experience working for a technology vendor selling Enterprise solutions
* Experience selling B2B solutions
* A track record of developing a greenfield territory, adding net new logos in an Enterprise software role
* Hunter mentality with solid sales DNA
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* Extensive customer network
* BS/BA degree strongly preferred
* Fluent in Swedish & English


**This position requires you to be based in Sweden.**
**Additional Information**
* We do sponsor and take over sponsorship of employment visas for this role. If we make you an offer, we will make every reasonable effort to get you a visa.


**Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer**
 As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. All applicants for positions at Verkada will be treated without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.
   

  

*Your application will be handled in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Policy.*

title: PRODUCT ADMINISTRATOR
description:
**Product Administrator, Customer Service**
 SAS Customer Service annually manages millions of customer contacts with the assistance of our external partners and contact centres. We recognize a growing need to enhance our digital capabilities to provide customer-centric solutions and services to our travellers, partners, and internal agents.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 As a Salesforce Product Administrator, you will play a vital role in our agile Salesforce development team, actively contributing to the release of new functionality according to our roadmap and backlog. Your primary mission is to facilitate swift adjustments to system configurations and rule engines, ensuring the efficient utilization of all functionalities in our Salesforce Service Cloud. You are expected to stay ahead of knowledge regarding new system functionalities and developments, utilizing this knowledge to support your team members. Additionally, you will be responsible for overall administration of user accounts and permissions for Salesforce, as well as other customer service systems.
   

  

**As a Product Administrator at SAS, you will work on:**
* Configuring and customizing Salesforce Service Cloud to meet business needs and requirements
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather feedback and requirements for continuous improvement of functionalities
* Supporting the management and maintenance of customer cases, queues, and assignment rules within Service Cloud
* Monitor and resolving incidents across customer service channels, including providing technical support for Salesforce
* Creating and maintaining custom reports and dashboards for stakeholders
* Evaluating system usage to suggest improvements to both users and the development team
* Administering user accounts, licenses and permissions in Salesforce and other customer service systems
* Acting as subject matter expert for fraud, including maintaining product data, configuring features and supporting user testing


**To be successful, we believe you have**
* Relevant Bachelor's or Master's university degree
* Salesforce Administrator certified
* Minimum of 2 years of professional experience
* Experience working in Salesforce Service Cloud
* Experience with agile ways of working (i.e., scrum)
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written
* Familiarity with GitHub
* Familiarity with CRM platforms or customer service software (e.g. Salesforce, Zendesk, Hubspot etc.)
* Experience from previous customer service organization is meriting
* Experience in Fraud detection is meriting
* Experience in Voice-bot configuration is meriting


**Personal Qualities**
* Self-motivated, proactive, and taking great responsibility for your tasks
* A methodical and logical approach, with good problem-solving skills
* Ability to adapt to evolving customer service requirements and prioritize tasks accordingly
* Team player mentality with a willingness to collaborate and support colleagues in achieving customer service goals.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 19/10/25. Please send us your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process.


 If you have questions about this position, you are welcome to contact Janni Ridderström, Acting Head of Digital Customer Service & Analytics via Email: janni.ridderstrom@sas.se
   

  

 Come and fly with us!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta som DevOps Engineer och söker en ny utmaning i karriären? Då kan vi på Centric hjälpa dig! Vi har flera kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor i Stockholm som växer och därför söker vi nu flera DevOps som kan bidra med sin kunskap och stärka verksamheterna.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som DevOps Engineer spelar du en nyckelroll i att bygga och underhålla infrastruktur som stödjer olika utvecklings- och driftprocesser. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteamet och kravställare.
 



  





***I denna roll som DevOps Engineer kommer du bland annat arbeta med att:***




*• Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter* 




 • Skapa och underhålla molninfrastruktur med hjälp av verktyg som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud
 



 • Felsöka och lösa tekniska problem relaterade till utveckling och drift
 



 • Implementera och hantera CI/CD-pipelines för kontinuerlig integration och leverans
 



 • Automatisera driftprocesser med hjälp av verktyg som Terraform, Ansible eller Kubernetes
 



 • Samarbeta med utvecklings- och driftavdelningar för att förbättra arbetsflöden och optimera system
 



 • Hantera incidenter
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Rollen kräver ett proaktivt tankesätt och du har ett intresse för att automatisera processer samt lösa komplexa problem. För att lyckas i en roll som DevOps Engineer hos någon av våra kunder ser vi att du har minst två års erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps-verktyg och tekniker som Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Git etc.
 



  





 Som person är du kreativ och tar initiativ till att utveckla och förbättra. Du vågar att testa nytt och tänka annorlunda. Du kan arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du har god samarbetsförmåga.
 



  





**Krav** 




 • Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter
 



 • Goda kunskaper om molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, GCP)
 



 • Stark förståelse för infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och automatiseringsverktyg (Terraform, Ansible)
 



 • God kännedom om nätverkskonfiguration och säkerhetsprinciper
 



 • Mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska
 



  





**Meriterande** 




 • Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av systemadministration i en Linuxbaserad produktionsmiljö
 



 • Erfarenhet av scriptprogrammering i Linuxmiljöer så som Python, Ruby, Perl eller motsvarande
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.

title: Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft
description:
Är du passionerad om cybersäkerhet och vill arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Microsofts ekosystem? Vill du vara en del av ett team där innovation, kompetens och gemenskap står i centrum? Då kan det här vara ditt nästa steg!
   

  

**Om rollen – Din chans att stärka cybersäkerheten i framkant! 🛡️**
 Som
 **Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft** 
 hos oss får du en
 **central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder skydda sina IT-miljöer** 
 . Du kommer att:
   

  

* Analysera och identifiera säkerhetsbehov hos våra kunder, med fokus på Microsofts ekosystem.
* Utforma och implementera säkerhetslösningar som skyddar mot dagens och morgondagens hot.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom cybersäkerhet.
* Samarbeta med olika team för att skapa säkra, effektiva och hållbara IT-lösningar.
* Utbilda och vägleda kunder i bästa praxis för en säker digital arbetsmiljö.


 Den här rollen är perfekt för dig som vill
 **kombinera teknisk expertis med strategiskt tänkande** 
 och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för företag och organisationer! 🚀
   

  

**Vi söker dig som…**
* Har erfarenhet som konsult inom IT-säkerhet, gärna inom Microsofts ekosystem. ✅ Är kunnig inom identitetshantering, hotdetektering och säkerhetsarkitektur.
* Har erfarenhet av verktyg som Microsoft Defender, Sentinel, Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD) och liknande.
* Är en problemlösare som gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste säkerhetshoten.
* Har en god förståelse för både tekniska och organisatoriska säkerhetsutmaningar.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska, för att det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


**Vad vi erbjuder 💜**
**Flexibilitet** 
 – vi tror på balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Utvecklingsmöjligheter** 
 – utbildningar, certifieringar och nätverkande inom säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**En inkluderande och engagerad företagskultur** 
 – vi tror på att ha kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner** 
 – för att du ska känna dig trygg och motiverad.
   

  

**Spännande projekt** 
 – jobba med ledande företag och organisationer i säkerhetskritiska miljöer.
   

  

**Vem är vi? 🤗**
 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , en del av B3 Consulting Group – ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag. Vi hjälper våra kunder att bygga framtidens IT-miljöer genom modern molnteknik och cybersäkerhet. Vi är ett
 **team på cirka 40 experter inom moln och säkerhet** 
 , och vi älskar att samarbeta, utvecklas och lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans! 💡
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: Enterprise Account Manager – Growth & Retention
company_industry: Software Development, Technology, Information and Media, and Broadcast Media Production and Distribution
description:
**About Vionlabs** 




 Vionlabs uses AI to help streaming platforms personalize user experiences. Its cognitive AI analyzes video to generate sentiment-based metadata for mood-driven recommendations, AI previews, targeted ads, and automated tagging. This boosts content discovery, search, and engagement. Trusted by global leaders, Vionlabs’ award-winning AI enables streaming services to deliver a Netflix-like experience.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As an
 **Enterprise Account Manager** 
 at Vionlabs, your mission is to expand and deepen relationships within our client base. You will focus on driving increased revenue and product usage across existing customers, while identifying new opportunities within wider group structures and subsidiaries.
 



 This is a highly strategic role where you will build long-term account plans, foster strong relationships with both C-level executives and internal champions, and ensure Vionlabs becomes an essential partner across multiple levels of the customer’s organization.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Expand relationships within enterprise accounts to maximize revenue and product adoption.
* Develop and execute long-term account strategies, including QBRs and growth initiatives.
* Identify and drive upsell and cross-sell opportunities across customer organizations.
* Map and manage stakeholders across all levels, from champions to senior executives.
* Open doors into new entities and business units within larger corporate groups.
* Lead complex sales cycles including procurement, RFPs, and negotiations.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customers realize full value from Vionlabs’ solutions.



  





**Must-haves / Who You Are** 



* 5+ years of experience in enterprise account management or enterprise sales within SaaS, tech, software, or IT.
* Proven track record of
 **growing revenue and driving adoption** 
 within strategic enterprise accounts.
* Demonstrated success in upsell, cross-sell, and expansion initiatives.
* Strong skills in stakeholder mapping, relationship-building, and consultative sales.
* Confident in engaging with both C-level executives and operational teams.
* Experience applying enterprise sales frameworks (e.g., MEDDPIC, Challenger, or similar) combined with strong forecasting accuracy.
* Proactive, self-driven, and highly effective at navigating complex sales cycles in dynamic, high-growth environments - with a strong self-starter, go-getter attitude.
* Social, collaborative and accountable - with the ability to build trust and foster teamwork across both internal and external stakeholders.



  





**Why Join Vionlabs?** 



* Shape the future of AI in media and entertainment with global enterprise customers, cutting-edge technology, and products that reach millions of users worldwide.
* Join a diverse, international team where innovation, curiosity, and impact truly matter.
* Enjoy competitive compensation, growth opportunities, and the potential to become a shareholder through option programs.
* Collaborate with passionate, creative colleagues at the forefront of personalization and content discovery.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Solution Architect with a passion for collaborating towards success in a high-tech, innovative environment? Join our forward-thinking Solution Architect team at ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Solution Architect**
 You would be responsible for designing and implementing scalable, secure, and reliable solution architectures to address our evolving business needs. This role involves close collaboration with development teams, system architects, vendors, and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Develop end-to-end IoT solution architectures that address current and future business requirements, including data collection from sensors, equipment, and appliances.
* Support the teams in designing and implementing cutting-edge technology solutions that align with ASSA ABLOY's business goals and objectives.
* Assess existing systems and technologies to identify areas for improvement and provide technical expertise and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Monitor emerging technology trends and proactively suggest innovative solutions to enhance our capabilities.
* Conduct technical due diligence to support the M&A team in evaluating potential acquisitions.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Solution Architect in industrial products, IoT cloud environments, data and analytics architectures, or a similar field.
* Proven expertise in designing and implementing scalable, secure solutions in cloud environments, with hands-on experience in IoT-based wireless technologies such as ZigBee, BLE, and similar protocols.
* A strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
* Good understanding of IT security including cryptography and preferably also PKI infrastructure
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and budget.
* A bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.


 Ideally, you also have relevant certifications in AWS or Azure or have experience in M&A and in the hospitality industry.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Solution Architect
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about creating business value through technology, and thrive on balancing strategic thinking with pragmatic solution realization in a sustainable architecture approach? If your answer is yes, we might have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 My name is
 **Claes Cegrell** 
 , and I lead
 **the IT Architecture & Roadmaps team at Telia Sweden.** 
 We’re a forward-thinking group of expert enterprise & solution architects working in an end-to-end business and IT context. A team dedicated to bridging the gap between business strategy and technology realization - designing IT architectures that drive modernization, simplicity and innovation, supporting Telia’s digital transformation and AI journey.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Solution Architect** 
 to join our team - someone who’s eager to collaborate across the organization, working close with our business stakeholder and translate our business needs into robust technology requirements, and craft scalable, future-proof solutions that deliver measurable outcomes. If you enjoy working in a dynamic environment where your ideas shape the future of IT, and you’re motivated by the challenge of integrating complex technologies to enable sustainable value creation, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**As a Solution Architect, you’ll…**
 Lead the design and implementation of scalable, secure, and high-performing solutions that directly support our business objectives and IT strategy. You’ll translate complex business needs into robust technical requirements, design optimal IT architectures, select the right solution technologies, and ensure seamless integration across platforms.
   

  

 In Telia we follow SAFe agile ways of working. As a Lead Solution Architect, you’ll take ownership of analysis and design work in close collaboration with business and delivery stakeholders across the organization. You’ll also play a proactive role by identifying architectural challenges and proposing strategic evolutions to our target architecture and vendor landscape. With a continuous improvement mindset, you’ll monitor the effectiveness of our solutions and recommend adjustments to keep us aligned with Telia’s long-term goals.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For…**
 We’re looking for a strategic thinker with strong business acumen and a passion for solving complex technical challenges and getting things done. You communicate clearly, collaborate across diverse teams, and bring a resilient mindset to evolving technologies and shifting priorities. You take ownership, learn from experience, and foster innovation by encouraging new ideas and better ways of working.
   

  

 You have deep experience in telecom IT domains such as OSS, BSS, and Core Networks, and a proven track record in enterprise architecture, solution integration, and SAFe agile methodologies. You’ve led technical teams, navigated governance processes, and managed software product lifecycles in large enterprise environments.
   

  

 You thrive on collaboration, actively engaging stakeholders to align solutions with business goals and IT strategy. You share knowledge across teams and help shape a culture of learning and modernization.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 If you are in for a fantastic opportunity - join my team! The position is available in
 **Solna, Sweden** 
 . We´re looking forward to your application
 **by 31st of October** 
 . Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via other channels.
   

  

 Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to
 **Claes Cegrell** 
 at
 **claes.cegrell@teliacompany.com** 
 .
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Launch Your Data Career with Curamando
description:
**Are you graduating in the spring of 2026? Are you interested in a career within data science, data engineering and AI? Are you curious about consulting?**
 Throughout the years, Curamando has continued to attract forward-thinking individuals who are passionate about data and analytics. That's why we're continuing with our popular analyst program, now targeting students interested in becoming the next generation's top data consultants.
   

  

 This fall, we welcome students to an informal evening at our office in Stockholm. There'll be food, drinks, presentations about Curamando, our graduate program, and a fun team challenge. This is a great opportunity to get to know us at Curamando and gain insights into careers in data science, AI, and data engineering.
   

  

 Since there are a limited number of spots available, we'll be selecting participants based on their applications and CVs. We're looking for curious, analytical minds who are eager to tackle real-world challenges and grow within our collaborative environment.
   

  

**What To Expect**
* Networking with current analysts and senior consultants
* Interactive presentations about our projects and career paths
* Some casual "hacking", showcasing practical problem-solving
* Q&A sessions about our graduate program and application process
* Delicious food and drinks in a relaxed atmosphere


**When:** 
 Thursday 16th of October 2025, 17:30 - 21:00
   

  

**Where:** 
 Eidra Office, Grev Turegatan 1, Stockholm
   

  

 Don't miss out on this chance to see if Curamando is the right fit for your career journey. We can't wait to meet you!
   

  

 Curamando offers tailored consulting services with the best people and assets to help clients build competitive digital marketing and sales capabilities to reach their business goals.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Senior Data & AI Platform Engineer
description:
**From ideas to reality. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

**Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!**
**About The Role**
 Because you’re not here to just provision another VM or deploy another pipeline—you’re here to help build the
 **Global Data & AI Platform** 
 that powers the future of data, analytics, and AI across Electrolux. Our mission? To enable delightful Developer Experience (DevEx) for:
   

  

* Data Engineers building scalable, high-quality pipelines
* ML Engineers deploying models that predict and generate the future
* Analytics Engineers transforming raw data into actionable insights
* AI Engineers building GenAI and Agentic architectures


 All while embedding security, governance, observability, and automation into every layer.
   

  

 We’re the team that keeps the platform resilient, scalable, and future-ready. If you love building tools that make other engineers high-five their screens, this is your playground.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 As a
 **Data & AI Platform Engineer** 
 , you’ll be a key contributor in designing, building, and operating our next-generation cloud-native platform on Azure. You’ll work across infrastructure, DevOps, and data domains to enable scalable, secure, and automated capabilities for our global engineering teams.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Design and operate cloud-native data & AI platform components on Azure
* Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform for secure, repeatable deployments
* Build and manage CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and platform services
* Collaborate with data and ML engineers to enable data mesh and domain-oriented architectures
* Develop self-service capabilities for data and AI product teams
* Ensure security, governance, and compliance are embedded into platform solutions
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize platform performance, availability, and cost
* Drive adoption of cloud-native best practices (resilience, scalability, automation)


 Who you are
   

  

* Proven experience in platform engineering, DevOps, or cloud infrastructure roles
* Strong hands-on skills with Microsoft Azure services (Data Lake, Synapse, Event Hubs, AKS, ADF, ADSL, Databricks etc.)
* Solid experience with Terraform and infrastructure automation
* Deep understanding of CI/CD tooling (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions etc.)
* Strong grasp of cloud networking, security, and identity management (AAD, RBAC, managed identities)
* Knowledge of data platform concepts (data mesh, lakehouse, governance, ML platforms)
* Ability to translate business/data needs into infrastructure designs
* Excellent problem-solving, troubleshooting, and collaboration skills


**Additional Skills**
* Experience with containerization & orchestration (Docker, AKS/Kubernetes)
* Exposure to observability stacks (Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics)
* Familiarity with IaC(HCL), Python, PowerShell, or Bash for automation
* Understanding of cost optimization strategies in cloud platforms
* Experience in enterprise-scale data mesh or data platform implementations


 Where you’ll be
   

  

 This is a position based at our
 **Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 We are proud of our culture of inclusivity and diversity. At our Global Headquarters, we have 60+ nationalities working together toward common goals. You will be part of this dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

 Benefits include
   

  

* Flexible work hours and hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Insurance policy plan
* Gym, sauna, and massage
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**Ready to redefine the developer experience for Data, Analytics, and AI Engineering?**
 Apply now and help us turn Electrolux into a Data & AI engineering powerhouse. As part of Electrolux Group, we are committed to continuously investing in your development, ensuring there are no barriers to where your career can take you

title: Solution Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Data Services
description:
**Impact Frends Growth Journey 🚀** 




  





 At
 
 Frends iPaaS
 
 , we are dedicated to redefining the future of integrations and automation. Our mission is to make integrations fast, easy, and transparent.
 



  





**We are looking for a new Solution Architect from Finland or Sweden** 
 to join our centralized Solution Architects team. If you enjoy working with a Nordic iPaaS leader and global challenger, a niche area to focus on technically, high speed, and growth with great people and a low hierarchy culture, this opportunity could be great for you!
 



  





 Frends has offices in Stockholm, Sweden, and Espoo, Finland, so we prefer that you be located in these countries and can visit the office when needed.
 



  





**Frends iPaaS is** 
 a modern European, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries.
 **Frends** 
 is recognized 3rd year in the
 **Gartner**
*®*
**Magic Quadrant™**
 for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends is also awarded in
 **G2 review**
 with the "Momentum Leader (API Management)," "Best Usability," "Easiest to Use & Admin," "Highest User Adoption," "Most Implementable," "Fastest Implementation," and "Fastest Time to Value" badges in 2025. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.
 



  





**In this role, you will be responsible for:** 



* Providing technical and sales engineering support to sales
* Identifying and presenting the value of Frends for the potential customers
* Bridging the gap between technical and business personas
* Solutions design and architecture within sales cases



  





**📝 What You´ll Do?** 



* Supporting and guiding sales as a technical architect with strong sales engineering acumen
* Actively taking part in sales meetings to showcase, present, and demonstrate the Frends value, capabilities, and use cases
* Acting as a leading technical expert and advisor in the sales process: technical discovery, value assessments, demos, proof-of-concepts/pilots and RFI/RFPs
* Hands-on architecting solutions in various sales cases: mid to enterprise customers
* Working with new and existing customers to land new opportunities
* Helping and guiding customer organizations and development teams to success
* Advocating Frends features and modern integration patterns
* Providing a feedback loop to the Frends product organization
* Participating in marketing events



  





**🏆 We offer you** 



* a competitive salary adequate to your expertise
* exciting and challenging role in a growing team
* **growing field of integrations**
 where it's worth investing your time and skills
* opportunity to be a crucial part of Frends growth journey
* own modern expanding Nordic platform Frends with our own R&D
* safe and modern workplace - we stand firm with a strong backbone
* an employer who supports in various
 **life situations**
 and invests in
 **people´s happiness**
* low hierarchy and an open atmosphere - be yourself and ask whatever you have in mind
* skilled co-workers and a supporting supervisor and team - you are not left alone
* dynamic and evolving
 **Frendszone with the cornerstones**
 of trust, freedom,
 **flexibility,**
 and responsibility
* flexible working times and remote work mode from either Finland or Sweden



  





**Read from our
 
 blog
 
 why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.** 




  





**💡 What You Bring** 




 The ideal candidate will already have work experience in the iPaaS/SaaS sector in a similar role and great skills as a conductor of customer relations.
 



  





**We highly value** 
 excellent communication skills, a positive and sales-oriented mindset, curiosity about learning new technologies, and the ability and willingness to work in a growing, dynamic, and fast-paced IT environment. As a person, you are flexible and proactive and enjoy cooperation with different stakeholders and new environments. You are interested in customer's needs and businesses and want to understand and further develop and grow them.
 



  





**To succeed in this role,** 
**we also value** 



* 5+ years of experience in solutions architecture or sales engineering
* Supporting successful sales teams to land new business and meet customer requirements
* Engaging directly with various customer personas (technical and C-level stakeholders)
* Working in close partnership with account executives or key account managers
* Hands-on software or architecture development
* Implementing and using various integration and architectural patterns (e.g. APIs, ETLs, event-driven, AI solutions)
* Working with cloud platforms



  





**The role requires professional English (both verbally and in writing), and living in either Sweden or Finland.** 




  





**⭐ Interested in joining us?** 




 If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and let us know more about you!
 



  





**Additional Information** 



* The start will be in autumn and will be flexible according to your situation.
* We offer permanent, full-time employment (no consultancy / freelance contracts).
* The role requires professional written and spoken English and living in either Sweden or Finland. Frends has offices in Stockholm, Sweden, and Espoo, Finland, so we prefer that you be located in these countries and be able to visit the office when needed.
* Travelling will be required occasionally to meet the customers and the team and join events when needed.
* The salary will be a fixed monthly salary plus a bonus model.
* Please note that we accept applications for this position only through our career website.

title: Senior SAP Basis Architect
description:
**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Senior SAP Basis Architect** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in
 **SAP Basis administration, architecture, and implementation** 
 , with strong leadership qualities to guide a team of administrators. This role involves
 **designing, implementing, and optimizing SAP environments** 
 while ensuring system performance, security, and reliability.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, implement, and manage
 **SAP Basis architecture and infrastructure** 
 .
* Perform
 **system installations, upgrades, migrations** 
 , and patch management.
* Monitor, optimize, and ensure
 **high availability and performance** 
 of SAP systems.
* Troubleshoot and resolve
 **critical SAP Basis issues** 
 in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with cross-functional and technical teams to support SAP initiatives.
* Develop, review, and maintain
 **documentation, processes, and procedures** 
 .
* Lead and mentor
 **junior SAP Basis administrators** 
 , fostering knowledge sharing.
* Ensure compliance with
 **security policies, IT standards, and best practices** 
 .
* Represent the team in
 **Solution Design Authority boards** 
 , providing architectural insights and solution recommendations.



  





**Qualifications & Experience** 



* **15+ years** 
 of experience in SAP Basis administration and architecture (minimum 10 years required).
* Proven expertise in
 **SAP S/4 HANA implementation** 
 .
* Strong knowledge of
 **SAP NetWeaver, SAP HANA, and related technologies** 
 .
* Experience in
 **SAP system installations, upgrades, and migrations** 
 .
* Proficiency in
 **performance tuning, system optimization, and troubleshooting** 
 .
* Strong
 **problem-solving, analytical, and leadership skills** 
 .
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead and collaborate across teams.
* **SAP certification(s)** 
 preferred.



  





**Preferred Skills** 



* Hands-on experience with
 **configuration in SAP systems** 
 .
* Exposure to
 **Microsoft Azure cloud platforms** 
 .
* Knowledge of
 **SAP Solution Manager & SAP Focused Run** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **ITIL processes** 
 and best practices.
* Experience with
 **database administration** 
 (Oracle, SQL Server, etc.).



  





**Key Competencies** 



* Ability to
 **analyze and resolve critical issues quickly** 
 .
* **Team player** 
 with proven leadership abilities.
* Willingness to
 **accept development challenges** 
 and drive resolutions.
* Commitment to
 **on-time delivery** 
 and working in
 **shift-based environments** 
 when required.



  





**Location** 



* **Primary:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
* Other Locations: Helsingborg, Sweden

title: Data Privacy Lead
description:
**Job Description**
 WHAT YOU’LL DO
   

  

 The Data Privacy Lead is overall responsible for managing privacy compliance within in the region (UK, Ireland, Sweden, Demark, Norway, Iceland, Finland). For this role your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

 OWNERSHIP & COMPLIANCE – Ensure data privacy compliance across the Region in alignment with global privacy frameworks. Stay updated on local regulations and practices and translate them into pragmatic regional processes, guidelines and best practices.
   

  

 AWARENESS & TRAINING – Drive awareness and build data privacy competence across the Region. Collaborate with Regional Management and local teams to embed a strong compliance culture and coordinate relevant training and support.
   

  

 BUSINESS SUPPORT – Provide hands-on guidance on new or evolving uses of personal data. Proactively support business plans by identifying data privacy needs and ensuring solutions align with both compliance and business goals.
   

  

 CONTROL & FOLLOW-UP – Identify and prioritize risks and set risk-based action plans to close compliance gaps. Lead breach management in coordination with the central data privacy team, and report to key stakeholders. Support with audits and reviews.
   

  

 COLLABORATION & CONTACTS – Act as the main contact for regional privacy matters. Maintain strong internal and external relationships, including with local authorities, in partnership with the central data privacy team.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 The Data Privacy Lead will work closely with key functions across the region, including Legal, HR, IT, Marketing, Store Operations, and E-commerce, to ensure compliant handling of personal data and support privacy-by-design practices.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with
   

  

* Law Degree
* At least 4 years working experience within same or similar field


 And people who have
   

  

* Profound updated knowledge and experience of GDPR and relevant regional data protection legislation and legal compliance
* Strong business acumen with a pragmatic mindset and ability to prioritize and manage risk.
* Great cooperation and communication skills. Having the ability to make the complex simple and able to communicate and engage at all levels as well as with both formal and informal stakeholders
* Strategical, abstract and conceptual thinking ability with a flexible mindset and the ability to see, formulate and propose different solutions in a way that are easy to understand for others
* Ability to identify and recognize opportunities for new or improved technologies to enable a more effective data protection compliance function and improvements
* Curious by nature and interested in learning and developing yourself within your area of expertise
* Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well both independently and as part of a team


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, apply by sending your application through the career site as soon as possible but no later than August 8th, 2025, and initiate the dialogue with your current manager.
   

  

 This is a permanent position. The position is based in our Regional office in Stockholm and reports to Regional Legal Manager.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Security Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Join our highly skilled team of developers — breaking new ground and shaping the future of retail.** 




  





**We dare to dream big, we have the courage to keep raising the bar, and we’re committed to being a force for good in retail - helping both established and fast-growing brands meet the ever-changing expectations of their customers.** 




  





**Sitoo is a fast-growing technology company exploring how far we can take innovation to deliver the world’s best Unified Commerce Platform and Point of Sale. Our technology is used in more than 20 countries - a number that keeps growing thanks to our incredible team of developers. And we have no intention of slowing down. Are you the Security Engineer we’re looking for?** 




  





**Your mission at Sitoo** 




  





 As a Security Engineer at Sitoo, you will be a key driver in safeguarding our Point of Sale and Unified Commerce Platform, ensuring we remain at the forefront of secure, reliable, and scalable cloud services. You will blend hands-on engineering with strategic leadership—setting security mandates, automating robust standards, and championing a distributed security model across our engineering organization.
 



  





 As a key driver, you will lead by example and influence through knowledge-sharing, working closely with our teams to elevate security practices across the organization. Your ability to communicate complex security concepts and mentor others will be essential for building a security-minded culture throughout Sitoo.
 



  





**What you will do** 




  




* Build robust and secure cloud solutions.
* Manage our multi-account AWS environment with IaC, implementing security, compliance, and automation to enable teams to deploy workloads securely and independently.
* Provide expertise in authentication and authorization (OAuth2, OIDC, SAML), and guiding teams to implement secure, scalable, and robust access solutions
* Enable automated vulnerability scanning, threat detection, and compliance checks, integrating security into CI/CD and AI development workflows.
* Promote a culture of shared security ownership by delivering training, clear guidance, and best practices, empowering teams to make independent, security-conscious decisions.



  





**What you’ll bring to the table** 




  




* Strong hands-on server-side development experience and experience in building scalable, reliable and secure cloud services in AWS.
* You confidently interact with individuals, teams and organizations to make sure they are informed, to be able to keep them accountable.
* Professional English, both verbal and written.



  





  





**Why Sitoo** 




  





 We are forward thinkers. By turning curiosity into knowledge — and knowledge into continuous improvement — we break new ground and shape the future of retail.
 



  





 We believe in an inclusive culture where everyone feels like they belong. We support each other, win together, celebrate success together, and overcome challenges together.
 



  





 Today, we are close to 100 dedicated experts with a positive and solution-oriented mindset. Most importantly, we take care of each other, and we never forget to have fun.

title: Engine Test Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about engine technology and ready to drive the development of next-generation automotive powertrains? Nexer Engineering Process is currently looking for Engine Test Engineers to join our team, representing us at client sites within the automotive industry.
  
As part of our team, you’ll get the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects in the heavy-duty engine sector. We value engineers who are not just experts in engine testing and validation but also thrive on innovation and problem-solving to make an impact on the future of automotive engineering.
  
What you will work with
  
As a consultant with Nexer Engineering Process, you'll work with an experienced team, supporting our automotive clients in engine-related roles. You’ll help develop and validate engines, powertrains, emissions systems, and testing protocols in the automotive industry, with tasks such as:
  
**Engine Testing & Validation:** Conduct and manage engine performance tests, including emission control, fuel consumption, efficiency, and thermal management testing
  
**Test Rig Management & Development:** Build, configure, and maintain test rigs with specialized equipment (e.g., gas measurement, Urea injection, HC injection, pressure/temperature sensors)
  
**Test Planning & Execution:** Develop, program, and execute test sequences for engines, including the testing of catalytic performance, HV components, and transmission systems
  
**Fault Tracing & Data Evaluation:** Evaluate and quality control test data, trace faults in engines, test equipment, and emissions systems, ensuring accurate results and system performance
  
**Collaboration with Development Teams:** Work closely with engineering teams (mechanical, electrical, controls) to ensure optimal test conditions, validation, and test system integrity
  
**Safety & Compliance:** Ensure adherence to EHS standards, LEAN methods, and process safety for all testing and rig maintenance
  
  

Your exact responsibilities will vary depending on the client’s needs, but they will always involve technical leadership and support in engine development, testing, and validation.
  
Who we are looking for
  
We are looking for engineers with a strong mechanical or mechatronics background who are familiar with test environments, data handling, and validation processes. You are problem-solving and passionate about pushing the boundaries of automotive engine technologies.
  
  

**Your background likely includes:**  

Experience with engine testing, emissions testing, or powertrain development
  
Hands-on experience in building and managing test rigs, programming test sequences, and calibrating equipment
  
Proficient with test equipment from AVL, Horiba, or similar manufacturers
  
Solid understanding of test protocols, measurement systems, and fault tracing techniques
  
Knowledge of automotive engine systems (e.g., fuel, emissions, combustion, exhaust aftertreatment systems)
  
Familiarity with software such as ATI Vision, MATLAB, Simulink, CATIA V5, or similar
  
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Automotive Engineering, or a related field
  
Fluency in English, both written and spoken, with Swedish as a bonus
  
  

Why Nexer Engineering Process?
  
At Nexer, you’re not just a consultant — you’re part of a team that values knowledge sharing, support, and continuous improvement. We offer:
  
Challenging projects in cutting-edge automotive powertrain development
  
Opportunities for career growth through continuous learning and mentoring
  
A collaborative and supportive work culture that encourages innovation and creativity
  
Flexibility in your work environment with a strong work-life balance
  
The opportunity to represent Nexer at top automotive companies, contributing directly to impactful projects
  
  

Our promise - Promising Future
  
We believe that great technology begins with great people. At Nexer, we strive to make a positive difference — both in the automotive industry and for the engineers who work with us. We value diversity, encourage bold ideas, and believe in a strong team spirit.
  
Ready to accelerate your career in engine testing and development?
  
Do you feel like one or several of the mentioned skills apply to you? Apply today to be a part of Nexer Engineering Process and help drive the future of automotive powertrains. We would love to hear from you!

title: Patent Attorney
description:
### **Patent Attorney**

  

Oticon Medical BAHS specializes in developing, producing, and distributing advanced bone-conduction hearing systems, including long-term implants, sound processors, software, and surgical tools. We are a global leader in hearing solutions, and we are currently looking for a Patent Attorney to join our Legal team in Sisjön, Gothenburg, Sweden. The location for this role will be Gothenburg and could follow a hybrid working schedule.

  

You will be responsible for Oticon Medical’s Intellectual Properties with the primary objectives of strengthening the patent portfolio and ensuring that Oticon Medical launches products with the lowest litigation risk. You will advise and strategically partner within the business, including with leaders within the business, with respect to patent and related activities. You will utilize high level expertise on specific topics for assigned portfolios and tasks, and within the IP area.

  

You will be responsible for

  

Understanding the business of Oticon Medical as part of the bone conduction industry, and the role of IP in the business at that level  

* 

Undertaking and leading core and some complex patent activities in role, e.g. patent drafting and prosecution, patentability and freedom to operate analysis, IP due diligences, litigation, and contract IP terms  
* 

Establishing and managing the relationship with external counsels  
* 

Managing a patent and design portfolio relating to a key product, multiple products, or other strategic assets in selected count  
* 

Applying expertise in national patent law and practice and superior working knowledge of foreign patent law and practice  
* 

Understanding other forms of protection relating to exclusivity and applies as required  
* 

Ensuring framework for recording of inventions disclosures (IDs) relating to technical ideas  
* 

Ensuring overall global management of trademarks  
* 

Ensuring risk assessment of product development and launch  
* 

Building relationships and counsels senior colleagues and key Business Partners on complex and high value/impact IP-related matters and represents IP on respective boards/meetings as needed  
* 

Managing patent and other exclusivity litigation with some independence according to the agreed process  
* 

Contributing to management of budget through careful planning, management of external counsels, and applying cost containment strategies  
* 
* Contributing to implementation and applies IP policies and guidelines

  

About you

  

You have an educational background as engineer or scientist, M.Sc.E, M.Sc., or Ph.D. and more than 10 years of practical experience within IP – possibly from practicing in the industry or in private practice. You have either concluded parts of European Qualifying Examination for European Patent Attorneys (such as pre-exam) or other national qualifying courses within IP. And last, your technical knowledge must include physics, mechanics or electronics.

  

As a person, you have strong analytical skills and are able to quickly grasp new areas. In your work with IP, you have an eye for details and, at the same time, can communicate clearly and concisely with different stakeholders. You are structured and systematic and have an interest in understanding Oticon Medical’s business. You have well-developed research and critical thinking skills, and sound decision-making abilities, with attention to detail to produce consistently accurate work. You have a strong customer-service experience & focus on building and sustaining effective partnerships with key stakeholders and project teams. You need to be fluent in English.

  

Why Oticon Medical?

  

Oticon Medical have over 300 employees, with the main HQ offices located in Gothenburg, Copenhagen, Denmark and Nice, France. At our Office in Gothenburg, we are a team of around 70 employees spanning R&D, marketing, operations, QA/RA and project management. Collaboration is our greatest strength, as we believe the best results come from a team-driven approach.

  

We foster a culture of trust, openness, respect, and kindness. We also offer flexible working conditions and prioritize work-life balance. By joining our growing global company, you will directly contribute to enhancing the lives of individuals worldwide.

  

Interested?

  

Submit your application and CV through our online recruitment system. Please note that we do not accept applications via email. Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the recruitment process may close before the stated deadline of 2025-10-31.


If you have questions regarding the position, please contact VP of Research & Development, Eric Pepin Lehalleur on +33 6 19 17 40 08.


We look forward to hearing from you!
