title: Production Test and Instrumentation Engineer
description:
**About Piab Group:**  

At Piab Group, we enhance our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through innovative industrial automation solutions. Since 1951, we have been committed to creating an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of approximately 3 billion SEK and over 1,400 employees, Piab is a global organization serving customers in more than 100 countries. We are owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB.
  
  

**Job Overview:**  

As a Production Test and Instrumentation Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and efficiency of our production processes. You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining testing procedures and instrumentation systems for our industrial products. This role requires a strong background in both hardware and software, as well as excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Instrumentation Engineering, or a related field.
  
Proven experience in production testing and instrumentation, preferably in an industrial setting.
  
Strong knowledge of both hardware and software testing methodologies.
  
Experience in developing test software using LabVIEW, Python, or similar programming languages.
  
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  
Strong communication and documentation skills.
  
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Production Test Development:** Design, develop, and implement hardware and software testing procedures for production.
  
**Production Support:** Provide ongoing support to production teams to ensure smooth and efficient operations.
  
**Instrumentation:** Manage and maintain instrumentation systems for monitoring and controlling production processes.
  
**Documentation:** Create and maintain detailed documentation of testing procedures, instrumentation systems, and production processes.
  
**Planning:** Plan and organize production test schedules and processes to meet production goals.
  
**Programming:** Develop and maintain test software using LabVIEW, Python, or similar programming languages.
  
**Electrical Design:** Design and oversee electrical components and systems used in production.
  
  

**You can expect the following with us:**  

**Innovative Culture:** Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation.
  
**Global Impact:** Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions.
  
**Global Presence:** Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach.
  
**Sustainable Vision:** Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency.
  
**Professional Growth:** Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.
company_description: .In a world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured Piab, and our technology have an important role to play.

title: Electronics Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Electronics Engineer, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications we are passionate about innovating tomorrow’s solutions for a smarter and safer world. We have already delivered a great number of groundbreaking products and we are underway to develop many more. Our camera products generate both attention and appreciation. We are now looking for an Electronics Engineer to join our Fixed Camera & Radar Product Development Unit at Axis HQ in Lund, Sweden.*
Who is your future team
You will be a part of our camera product electronics team, together with a dozen engineers as your colleagues. In our organization we also have electronics audio and radar teams.
The role
With each new generation of our network cameras, we are upgrading our camera sensors and all the rest of the system solutions towards breathtaking performances. We are constantly adding new core technologies like radar and audio. Our electronics engineers deliver key parts of Axis products, and the role carries accountability for the electronics solutions in the product development.
What you will do
You will work with camera electronics design & development; from concept development all the way to volume production. We contribute to reference design development, for the benefit of several departments, and that will also be part of your tasks. You will simulate and develop designs, and you will verify and validate the solution. You take part in cross functional project teams with other competence categories like software, mechanics, and product management. You will collaborate with many camera teams in the company as well as the core technology departments. Externally, you will work with suppliers, test houses and our EMS partners (production) together with our operations organization. Now and then you will also meet our customers.
Who are you?
Axis is characterized by being an unpretentious company based on strong core values and a unique Axis team spirit. When joining Axis, you will notice the high level of ambition and how helpful and supportive everyone is towards each other. Therefore, we believe you are a team player with an open and generous attitude fueled by high personal ambitions.
You are passionate about electronics, and you possess a relevant university degree in the subject. Preferably, you have years of experience in electronics engineering & design. We believe you will be energized by seeing your concept materialize into a world class product, finally in the hands of the end customer.
What Axis can offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Welcome to send us your application!  

In case of questions, please reach out to the recruiting manager Magnus L Johansson; +46 76 180 67 81.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-10-29*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Senior engineering manager - System solutions
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Business Manager - Commercial&Portfolio **Your Role and Responsibilities**


Are you ready to lead advanced system deliveries in a global market? We’re seeking a dynamic and experienced **Senior Engineering Manager** to head our new **System Solution Department**, driving innovation and excellence in crane and terminal automation systems. As part of our management team, you’ll oversee a multifaceted organization, guiding everything from system architecture and software design to cybersecurity and technical support.


This is a unique opportunity to shape large-scale engineering solutions, collaborate across borders, and make a lasting impact in a system-oriented business. If you’re a strategic leader with a strong background in software engineering, a passion for continuous improvement, and a knack for inspiring teams—this role is for you.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead large-scale system deliveries in the global market.
* Oversee complete system delivery, including overall system architecture, application and software design, data communication interfaces, machinery safety, cybersecurity, and technical support for crane and terminal automation systems.
* Manage a department consisting of six sub-departments, each led by a line manager.
* Foster cross-functional collaboration across departments and global teams, ensuring seamless integration of expertise and driving innovation through shared knowledge and collective problem-solving.

**Qualifications**

* Master of Science degree (or equivalent) in a relevant field, with at least five years of management experience.
* Proven experience in software engineering and development.
* Strong track record of executing customer projects within a system-oriented business.
* Demonstrated ability to actively manage teams and drive continuous improvements in design, operational excellence, quality, and customer satisfaction.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken; additional language skills are a plus.
* A collaborative leader who enjoys guiding others and working in teams.


What’s in it for you?


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.


More about us


ABB Marine & Ports designs and develops intelligent terminal automation solutions and services for container and bulk cargo handling as well as world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, and optimized container terminals. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees.


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employ-ment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


Recruiting Manager Björn Henriksson, +46 702 09 57 00 will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives: Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Sara Vestin, +46 724 64 46 88


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Service Engineer
description:
Be visionary
Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.  

Job Description  

Reporting to the Manager, Thermal Imaging Product Service in our Täby, Sweden facility, the Service Engineer plays a vital role in preserving TeledyneFLIR’s position as the Global Leader for thermal imaging solutions through the evaluation, diagnosis and repair of thermal imaging products and systems. The work environment is team-based, and collaboration is encouraged. Completed work assignments are evaluated by the Lead Technician who provides coaching and skill development—fostering an environment of personal accountability, empowerment, and growth. Compliance with Global Trade, ISO, ATEX, and NFPA directives is a requirement of the position.  

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:* Receives work assignments from the Service Manager and/or Lead technician; works within a team of technicians tasked with the full range of after-market and repair services for thermal imaging product solutions.
* Employs knowledge of electronic theory, thermography, and optics throughout the performance of daily work assignments.
* Utilizes the full range of hand tools and electronic test equipment common to the industry.
* Performs software/firmware updates on camera products—leverages knowledge of embedded programming languages/computer information systems in the performance of service actions.
* Documents all product evaluation and repair actions using the SAP PR1 Customer Service module and Oracle case management platform.
* Participates in ISO, ATEX/HazLoc and NFPA training and certification efforts; ensures all service actions are performed in accordance with relevant work instructions and regulatory policies.
* Works in a collaborative manner with Customer Service personnel to develop repair estimates for provision to customers; periodically engages customers to explain complex technical issues and proposed solutions.
* Receives cross-training in other disciplines to increase team capacity—takes direction and demonstrates a positive attitude and willingness to learn new skills.

  

Job Qualifications:* AS in an electronics/engineering discipline or comparable work experience.
* 2+ years’ experience of hands-on experience in an electronics repair/assembly role.
* Demonstrated ability to operate electronic test equipment and to navigate computer operating systems and embedded programming languages.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. All internal and external communication is expected to be courteous and professional.
* Must be able to take direction and work as a member of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* The successful candidate will be self-motivated and one who employs strict attention to detail in the performance of all work assignments.

  

Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
#### **About Hypertype**


We’re building the next generation of AI products and AI Agents in the Customer Support space. Focused on manufacturing but with clients across other sectors like fintech, health tech and more we are giving hundreds of companies across the globe the capacity to transform their customer journey with the latest advancements in AI. Our customers proudly recognise us for delivering the "highest quality answers in the market... outsmarting Gemini, Fin, Microsoft Copilot etc". —a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and precision in every interaction.


We are a group of people that work the extra mile together, that fearlessly push the boundaries to new heights and that deeply own what they deliver. We look for those who are ambitious, humble and fast to build together things humankind has not witnessed yet.

#### **About The Role**


As a Machine Learning engineer at Hypertype you’ll build and productionize the systems that power our AI products. You’ll own RAG pipelines, LLM orchestration layers, evaluation harnesses and the data plumbing that turns customer knowledge and product usage into measurable quality improvements. Your days will involve Python, vector search, prompt/policy iteration and close collaboration with the whole team to hit quality, latency, and cost targets.

#### **What You’ll Do**

* Develop and maintain LLM systems, AI Agents and ML models that serve thousands of customers each day.
* Own RAG pipelines end-to-end: chunking, embeddings, retrieval, re-ranking, caching, etc.
* Build offline/online evaluation frameworks and maximum observability for all our AI systems.
* Own the data ingestion pipelines that transform multimodal customer data into actionable knowledge for our AI systems.
* Collaborate with business, product and sales to ship features that deliver maximum impact at scale.
* Build for optimal inference and serving latency/cost; add guardrails and safety checks to keep everything under control.

#### **Who Are You**

* +2 years experience in AI/ML engineering shipping production AI-powered products.
* Proficiency in Python, vector databases and data engineering (SQL, GraphQL, pipelines, etc.)
* Deep understanding of the mathematical foundations behind Machine Learning and fluency in Prompt Engineering.
* Solid understanding of software design principles, development tradeoffs and scalable architectures.
* Strong experience building fault-tolerant products with maximum observability.
* Great capacity to make grounded technical decisions that balance speed and quality.

 **What we offer**

* The opportunity to be part of an early, well-funded and promising startup. The right place at the right time.
* A role and position that gives you the freedom to develop your skills and persona the way you want.
* Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront on solving the world's AI challenges and work towards AGI.
* Competitive salary + stock options + maximum growing opportunities.

title: Graduate Trainee Engineer
description:
Job ID
476099
Posted since
26-Aug-2025
Organization
Digital Industries
Field of work
Internal Services
Company
Siemens Industry Software AB
Experience level
Early Professional
Job type
Full-time
Work mode
Hybrid (Remote/Office)
Employment type
Permanent
Location(s)
* Solna - Stockholms laen - Sweden
**We are Siemens**

  

Siemens is a leading global technology company that has stood for technical excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than 175 years. Operating worldwide, we focus on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems, on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. With our technology, we connect the real world with the digital world. We want to develop technical solutions that benefit a more environmentally friendly and sustainable world. To achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for new talents who share our pursuit of a sustainable future.


We are now looking for a talented graduate, to join our team at Siemens Digital Industries Software.

 **About the Position**

  

Over 25 intensive and exciting months, the program will provide you with unique expertise within Siemens and the opportunity to establish a global network within the organisation. You will be able to manage and plan rotations within the organisation yourself and gain experience working on real project assignments based on business needs. To be successful, it is essential that you are proactive and genuinely committed, and that you are attracted by the advanced technology and innovations that characterise Siemens. You will work with the latest technology and build the competencies you need for the future. As a graduate with us, you will have a permanent position from day one and a dedicated manager and mentor to support your career in the company.  



  

**We offer you:**

  

* A permanent position after completing the program.
* Several rotations based on your own ambitions and interests.
* Opportunities for study visits both within Siemens and at other companies.
* Training in, for example, company and product knowledge, sales, leadership, and project management.
* An exciting job where you will work at the forefront of digitalisation and help the Nordic market remain leading and sustainable.
* We provide you with the network, knowledge, and competence to strengthen your career in the best possible way. Siemens Digital Industries Software's Swedish offices are located in **Stockholm.**

**About you:**

  

* You will graduate with a Master of Science in Engineering degree no later than spring 2025 and are at the beginning of your career; your degree should not be older than two years.
* You are a communicative team player with the ambition to develop yourself, the business you work in, and our customers in various industries.
* You are a goal-oriented and driven person.
* You have very good written and spoken knowledge of both Swedish and English.
* You have a valid work permit.
* You are attracted to working in an international environment.
* You want to work closely with technology and business development.

 **What else do I need to know?**

  

The program starts from mid-October 2025, and you will be permanently employed by Siemens Industry Software AB. After completing the program, you will take the next step in your continued career with a placement within Siemens Digital Industries Software in Stockholm, Solna, Arenastaden.

 **Selection Process!**


Selection, interviews with future managers and former trainees, and feedback will take place continuously during the advertising period. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible if you are interested and to avoid missing out on this opportunity.


To apply, please prepare your CV and cover letter in English. The application window closes on **Friday, October 3rd**, but we encourage early submissions to maximise your chances.


We look forward to receiving your application and potentially welcoming you to our Siemens team!

 **Why Working at Siemens Software?**

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

**Transform the everyday and shape the future of your career with us.**


Siemens Digital Industries Software is your place to thrive. Whether you’re a current student, recent graduate or postgraduate. In our talent hiring programs you will find the trust and freedom to succeed, while building a solid foundation for your professional career. You will have the chance to work on real projects, providing value to our future success and making an impact for our customers.


Visit: https://www.sw.siemens.com/en-US/careers/student-programs-and-early-careers/
company_description: We are a leading technology company - focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare - that transforms the everyday of billions of people.

title: Python Backend Engineer (Transcripts)
description:
**Who We’re Looking For**
 Join Quartr as a Python Backend Engineer specialising in text processing to help us drive real-time, reliable data solutions for the finance industry.
   

  

 Are you passionate about backend engineering, Python development, and working with large-scale text data? At Quartr, we are looking for a Python Backend Engineer to play a key role in scaling and improving our transcripts pipelines. If you love engineering robust software, extracting information from text, and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Our transcripts team builds and maintains the pipelines that power one of Quartr’s most important data assets: transcripts. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers and product managers. This is an end-to-end role: design, build, and ship reliable backend systems that handle transcript ingestion, parsing, transformation, enrichment, and storage. Your work will provide the core data foundation that powers essential product features and drives future product development.
   

  

**Why join Quartr**
**Do your life's work:** 
 We focus passionately on doing things with a very high quality across our entire organization.
   

  

**Join the foundational team:** 
 We are still in the very early innings of what we believe to be a multi-decade journey.
   

  

**Skin in the game:** 
 We truly believe in the power of incentives and in sharing the company's success with the team. Therefore, every employee is offered qualified stock options.
   

  

**Rapid, global growth:** 
 Among our clients are some of the world's most influential companies in finance and tech. With proven products and a go-to-market strategy, we're steadily grabbing market share in a multi-billion-dollar industry.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build scalable systems for transcript ingestion, processing, and enrichment from diverse text sources.
* Optimise backend performance for high-volume, text-heavy workloads and parallel processing.
* Work on text processing and information extraction: entity recognition, metadata enrichment, and semantic structuring of transcripts.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to shape features from concept to release, ensuring outstanding user experiences.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure smooth operation and timely data delivery


**Required Technical Skills**
* 3+ years of professional experience building robust backends in Python, preferably for large-scale or data-intensive systems.
* Proven experience developing and maintaining REST APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django.
* Familiarity with asynchronous programming and distributed processing.
* Ability to explain code and technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to propose durable, simple solutions to complex problems


**Preferred Skills**
* Hands-on experience with AWS services like Lambda, EC2, ECS, and S3
* Knowledge of ETL processes, large-scale data pipeline management, and workflow tools like Apache Airflow; experience handling streaming or batch data ingestion
* Experience with Docker for deploying and managing backend services
* Good understanding of databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or similar).
* Experience with document/text ingestion libraries or frameworks (bonus if you’ve worked with speech-to-text outputs).


**Desired qualities**
* Self-driven, proactive, and confident in taking full ownership of projects.
* A keen interest in NLP, speech-to-text, or large-scale text pipelines is advantageous.
* Comfortable learning new technologies and eager to improve products and processes.
* Balance pragmatism and craftsmanship, knowing when to move quickly and when to build for long-term scalability - even in complex systems with many interdependent components.
* Communicate clearly and effectively, thriving in a high-paced, collaborative environment


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary
* Company option plan
* Top-notch equipment of your choice
* Wellness allowance
* Occupational pension
* Flexible work arrangements (remote or hybrid in Stockholm/Gothenburg)
* Must be based in Sweden with a valid work permit


**Note: We are not seeking assistance from consultants or recruitment agencies.**
**About Quartr**
 Every day, leading companies and financial institutions worldwide rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster. The product suite includes: Quartr API, enabling third parties to build custom solutions powered by Quartr's unique live earnings calls and transcription technology, and its extensive global database of IR material – including public company filings, archived earnings call transcripts, and slide deck presentations. Quartr Pro, a desktop research platform that increases efficiency and precision in qualitative public market research for top hedge funds, asset managers, equity research departments, and IR professionals. A free mobile app allowing users to always stay informed and conduct research anytime, anywhere.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Gilion:**
 Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting, ultimately enabling access to financing and non-dillutive funding, - in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform
   

  

 Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.
   

  

**About the role:**
 You’ll join our data team to build the backbone that powers Gilion’s AI-driven financial analysis. Your mission: make customer data analysis-ready and accessible to AI agents in a scalable, automated way. This means building services, data models, and integrations.
   

  

* Design, build, and maintain backend services that process and serve customer data for AI agent analysis.
* Define and implement semantic layers and metrics (e.g., lifetime value) to standardize analysis across customers.
* Collaborate with AI orchestration systems to ensure agents have the right tools (MCPs) and data for their tasks.
* Continuously refine automated analysis workflows to improve accuracy, scalability, and robustness.
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to expand data capabilities and handle new data types or sources.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and services.


**Background/Profile:**
* Experience in analytics engineering or data engineering roles.
* Backend development skills (Python or similar), with ability to build services and APIs.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling and data warehouses.
* Understanding of data quality principles and automated data validation.
* Interest in or exposure to AI-driven data analysis - comfortable working in an environment where AI agents consume your data pipelines.


**What we offer:**
* Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
* Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* Experienced founders, backed by top investors
* A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
* AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

title: Java Developer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**Java Developer – Join Kambi Engineering in Stockholm**
 Are you ready to take your development career to the next level? Kambi Engineering is looking for a Java Developer to join our Stockholm-based team.
   

  

 With offices in Malta (HQ), Philadelphia, London, Bucharest, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala, and Stockholm, we’re a global team of 950+ passionate, highly skilled individuals. We pride ourselves on being at the forefront of the sports technology industry. Here's your chance to be a part of our success story!
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Java Developer, you’ll help strengthen our teams’ ability to turn user stories into high-quality, shippable code. To succeed in this role, we believe you should have previous experience in building scalable and maintainable applications that run and fail gracefully. You should possess both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software development.
   

  

 At Kambi, we strongly believe in self-organized teams. You’ll work in a cross-functional, self-managing team where you will:
   

  

  

* Participate in discussions, grooming sessions, and retrospectives to continuously improve our product and processes.
* Collaborate with Product Owners to share technical insights.
* Troubleshoot and solve production incidents in a complex, high-performance environment.


**Tools & Frameworks**
 Here are some of the tools and technologies we use in our backend teams:
   

  

  

* Java / Kotlin
* REST/Json
* Linux
* AWS
* Helm
* Kubernetes
* Apache Kafka
* Git
* Postgres
* Redis


 We operate in DevOps teams, which means you’ll have the opportunity to take full ownership of our products and components, from idea to deployment and support. This also includes being on call.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 To fit well in our team, you should have a curious mindset, be triggered by challenges, and love working collaboratively. You’re passionate about development, eager to learn, and thrive in an environment where knowledge-sharing is key. As an international company, our main working language is English.
   

  

**What’s in It for You?**
* An opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing international company.
* We operate in the AWS cloud and offer an exciting environment where you can grow and learn.
* The ability to influence your team’s work environment and processes directly.
* Access to continuous learning: internal training, industry conferences, hackathons, and other collaborative events.


 At Kambi, we believe in the importance of work-life balance and making it part of our everyday culture. We believe that both you as well as Kambi benefit from having happy, healthy colleagues. You will join one of our Stockholm-based development teams with a hybrid work setup.
   

  

 We’re curious about your story. If you’d like to meet us, please apply with your CV.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Fullstack Data & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data/AI Application Development:
+ Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.

* Collaboration & Integration:
+ Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.

* Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
+ Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.

* Optional Chatbot Development:


 Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements
   

  

* Technical Expertise:
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* Collaborative Skills:
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Backend Engineer
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About 0TO9:** 




**Team Is All** 




 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
 



**0TO9 exists to change that.** 




 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
 



 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
 



 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
 



 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
 



  





**About the role** 




 At 0TO9, you won’t just build services - you’ll shape the core banking platform powering the next wave of fintech ventures. This is a chance to work with and solve complex problems at scale, and be part of building something from the ground up.
 


* Build and maintain C#/.NET Core microservices on AWS ECS for the banking platform
* Collaborate with product managers, architects, and engineers to deliver high-performance APIs
* Write clean, testable code following SOLID principles
* Apply DDD and CQRS to create modular, scalable, and maintainable systems
* Design event-driven communication using NATS
* Ensure reliability through idempotency, retries, and self-healing services
* Implement observability: logging, metrics, tracing, and performance monitoring
* Working with both relational (MS SQL Server) and NoSQL (DynamoDB) databases.
* Contribute to secure design (auth, secrets, compliance)
* Improve CI/CD, containerized workflows, and engineering practices



  





**About you** 




 We think you’ll be a great fit if you:
 


* Have backend experience working with microservices and distributed systems, C# and .NET Core and AWS
* Take ownership, challenge unclear requirements, and prioritize reliability
* Have applied DDD and CQRS in real-world systems
* Understand event-driven architectures (ideally with NATS)
* Care about writing clean, maintainable, testable code



*Nice to have:* 



* Previous fintech or banking industry experience
* Hands-on experience with integration testing, contract testing, or end-to-end service testing
* Knowledge of observability tools and testing strategies for microservices
* Understanding of cloud security, governance, and compliance



  





**What we offer:** 



* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm
* Strong opportunities for growth and development

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
*We're at a pivotal moment for both Tibber and the planet. When joining Tibber, you won’t just help scale a forward-thinking tech company – you’ll contribute to a real shift in how people consume electricity. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 . We’re looking for an Analytics Engineer to join us in making the energy transition happen – maybe that’s you?
 



  





**Job Mission 🚀** 




 In the
 **Data Team at Tibber** 
 , you’ll play a crucial role in shaping how data is modeled, structured, and made accessible for business and analytical use. We are a group of
 **data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists,** 
 working together to
 **turn raw data into actionable insights** 
 that drive smarter energy decisions for our customers.
 



 As an
 **Analytics Engineer** 
 , you’ll be a core enabler of our data-driven business, ensuring that data is
 **well-modeled, reliable, and easy to use** 
 across the company. You’ll own the
 **semantic layer** 
 and be responsible for
 **transforming raw data into well-defined, trusted datasets** 
 that service both downstream customer-facing applications as well as empower our business teams.
 



  





**What you'll do ✅** 



* **Model & Transform Data** 
 – Design, build, and maintain curated, analytics-ready datasets using dbt, optimized for both analytical reporting and machine learning applications.
* **Create & Maintain the Semantic Layer** 
 – Define business-friendly tables, metrics, and dimensions that serve as the foundation for reliable decision-making.
* **Optimize for Self-Service Analytics** 
 – Ensure that stakeholders can easily find, understand, and trust the data they need, reducing reliance on ad-hoc requests.
* **Collaborate with Data & Business Teams** 
 – Work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data needs and improve accessibility.
* **Ensure Data Quality & Trust** 
 – Implement data validation, monitoring, and governance practices to reduce inconsistencies and improve data reliability.
* **Refine & Standardize Data Practices** 
 – Define best practices for data modeling, documentation, and transformation logic, ensuring a scalable and maintainable data ecosystem.



  





**What we're looking for⚡** 



* **Passion for the Power of Data.** 
 You love data that is reliable and accessible because you understand that data is the lifeblood of an organization. You care about
 **data governance, documentation, and quality** 
 , ensuring that data is trustworthy and easy-to-use across Tibber.
* **Data Modeling & Transformation Expertise.** 
 3+ years of experience designing
 **clean, reusable data models** 
 and transformation logic, ideally with
 **dbt.**
* **SQL Mastery.** 
 Strong ability to write
 **optimized, scalable SQL** 
 for data transformation, performance tuning, and complex analytical queries.
* **Analytics Enablement.** 
 Experience
 **designing, structuring, and optimizing datasets** 
 to support
 **downstream applications** 
 as well as BI tools like
 **ThoughtSpot or similar platforms**
* **Collaboration & Communication.** 
 Ability to
 **bridge the gap between data engineering and analytics** 
 , working cross-functionally to align on data definitions and improve accessibility
* **Version Control & CI/CD.** 
 Familiarity with
 **Git-based workflows and CI/CD pipelines** 
 for managing transformations and data models efficiently.



  





**The Tibber Mindset 💆🏻 ♀️💆🏽 ♂️** 




 Tibber is not your typical energy supplier. Our tech helps hundreds of thousands of households lower and shift their energy consumption to more sustainable hours. We’re here to accelerate the energy transition – not in theory, but in everyday life.
 



  





 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users. We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
 



  





 Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki. We will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
 



  





*Diversity of thought fuels better products, so we welcome applicants of every background, identity and lived experience. Ready to be part of powering the energy transition?* 
***Apply below!***

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
   

  

 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
   

  

 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge, and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers

**Requirements**
* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

 Welcome packs & occasional gifts

title: System Engineer Hardware
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
**Din roll**
 Hos oss på Naval Combat Systems kommer du som systemingenjör vara med och vidareutveckla världens främsta ledningssystem. Våra produkter används marina plattformar, såsom ytfartyg och ubåtar, och har till uppgift att sammanställa information från sensorer, datalänkar och vapensystem i syfte att ge operatören bästa möjlighet att fatta rätt beslut.
   

  

 I huvudsak kommer du att arbeta med våra utvecklings- och leveransprojekt med spännande teknik i avancerade system. Du är med i projektens olika faser från initial kravanalys via utveckling, produktion, vidmakthållande till utfasning. Du kommer också att ha en mängd kontakter med både interna och externa parter samt delta i olika nätverk och forum. Du kommer arbeta produktorienterat och projektorienterat.
   

  

 Som systemingenjör kommer du att bland annat ansvara för den tekniska kravställningen och gränssnittsfrågor i någon av våra högteknologiska produkter. Du kommer att ha nära samarbete med många av de olika sektionerna som ingår i vår designavdelning men också med andra intressenter inom vår organisation. De många kontaktytorna och delaktigheten i hela produktlivscykeln gör denna tjänst både flexibel och stimulerande.
   

  

 Arbetet som systemingenjör HW omfattar i huvudsak följande:
   

  

* Ansvar för att hantera tekniska krav på våra produkter och bryta ner dessa till hanterbara nivåer med fokus på HW
* I samarbete med produkt- och projektledning, kunder och andra kravställare säkerställa att aktuellt systems kravställning motsvarar förväntad leverans
* Under utvecklingsfasen följa systemet genom utveckling, integration och verifiering
* Att vara ett stöd till HW utveckling
* Delta i offertarbete vid behov


 Har du även arbetat med något av områden nedan är det meriterande:
   

  

* Miljökvalificering och testverksamhet enligt militära standarder
* Erfarenhet av arbete kopplat till nätverk och switchar ur ett hårdvaruperspektiv


 Tjänstens placering är i Järfälla till en början, men framöver kommer vi att flytta till nya lokaler i Solna Strand. Resor kan förekomma. Vi levererar till kunder både i Sverige och utomlands och behöver nu bli fler eftersom våra system är alltmer efterfrågade. Hur vill och kan du bidra?
   

  

**Din profil**
 Mest sannolikt har du några års erfarenhet som systemingenjör eller liknande där du arbetat nära utveckling med teknisk kravställning. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är strukturerad, tycker om att tänka analytiskt, strategiskt och kommersiellt. Vi tror också att du arbetar bra i team och har god nätverksförmåga. Har du erfarenhet av arbete med våra 9LV-produkter är det meriterande. Arbete i kravhanteringsverktyg som DOORS ser vi också som meriterande.
   

  

 Nödvändiga färdigheter:
   

  

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjör eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling
* Utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga på engelska och svenska, skriftligt och muntligt


 Utöver ovanstående färdigheter sätter vi stort värde på personliga egenskaper, förmåga att bidra med positiv energi, att du är bra på att entusiasmera, engagera och kommunicera och på så sätt få teamet att jobba mot samma mål.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Stockholm** 




  





**About eghed** 




  





 eghed is an expertise group passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.
 



  
 



**About The Role** 




  





 We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer who shares our passion for creating something new and has the courage to explore uncharted territories. Here at eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.
 



  
 



**Your Responsibilities May Include** 




  





 ·      Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
 



 ·      Gather, clean, and process data, develop and train algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
 



 ·      Study and transform data science prototypes and apply appropriate machine learning algorithms and tools 
 



 ·      Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.
 



 ·      Run machine learning tests and experiments, and document findings and results 
 



 ·      Train, retrain, and monitor machine learning systems and models as needed 
 



 ·      Construct optimized data pipelines to feed machine learning models
 



 ·      Consult with managers to determine and refine machine learning objectives 
 



  
 



**We Believe That You** 




  





 ·      Have at least 5 years of experience as an ML Engineer, in academia and industry domain.
 



 ·      Have a university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Software Development, Engineering etc.
 



 ·      Have proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
 



 ·      Have proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts. In-depth knowledge of machine learning frameworks, like Keras or PyTorch
 



 ·      Have strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
 



 ·      Have excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.
 



 ·      Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
 



 ·      Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.
 



  





**Why eghed?** 




  





 At eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.
 



**Application** 




 Does this sound like something for you? Apply or send your application and CV to info@eghed.se as soon as possible. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: Integrationsarkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till MuleSoft, WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

 Som integrationsutvecklare är din huvudsakliga uppgift att utveckla plattformar som möjliggör integrationen av olika system att jobba sömlöst tillsammans.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Utveckla API:er och integrationer med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Camel, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Ha tät dialog med kund, teamet och användare för att designa och implementera de bästa tekniska lösningarna
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i Mulesoft Anypoint Platform, WSO2 eller annan ledande integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Sr. Integration Engineer
description:
**Who We Are** 




 SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance providing solutions to clients and brokers around the world. Bermuda-headquartered with offices in New York, London, Stockholm and other locations, we are listed on the New York Stock Exchange (SPNT). We have licenses to write Property & Casualty and Accident & Health insurance and reinsurance globally. Our offering and distribution capabilities are strengthened by a portfolio of strategic partnerships with Managing General Agents and Program Administrators. With approximately $2.7 billion total capital, SiriusPoint’s operating companies have a financial strength rating of A- (Excellent) from AM Best, S&P and Fitch, and A3 from Moody’s.
 



  





**Join Our Team** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Integration Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies, excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively, strong communication skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. The role reports to our AVP, Enterprise Architect and Integrations.
 




 Your responsibilities will include:
 



* Design, develop, and maintain applications using Microsoft .NET Framework and .NET Core.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
* Assist in maintaining code quality, organization, and automation.
* Develop and implement RESTful services and microservices architectures.
* Conduct thorough code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
* Stay updated with the latest industry technologies, frameworks, patterns and services



  





**United behind common goals** 




 At SiriusPoint we work as one team across our global business, and we unite that team behind common goals, understanding the positive impact we can all make at SiriusPoint. We aim to retain and attract great people, knowing they can achieve a rewarding and enriching career.
 



 Our Purpose is to provide security and resilience in an uncertain world.
 



 Our Vision is to be recognized as a best-in-class insurer and reinsurer utilizing deep risk capabilities to protect our customers. Blending our talent, expertise and data to provide intelligent risk solutions.
 



 Our culture is one of performance and accountability. Our people are our experts and you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative and purposeful environment.
 



 Our Values are at the heart of our business, and which guide every day actions and decision making.
 


* Integrity: Integrity, respect and trust are our core principles
* Customer Focused: Our customers are the reason we exist
* Solution Driven: Creating solutions is our mindset
* Diversity: Diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger
* Collaboration: Collaboration drives outperformance



  






 Your skills and abilities should include:
 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum of 7 years of experience in software development.
* Proficiency in .NET development, specifically with .NET version 6 and above. Extensive experience with C# and ASP.NET Core.
* Strong understanding of the Python programming language, including core concepts, data structures, and algorithms.
* Hands-on experience with AWS services, including but not limited to Lambda, Glue, Step Functions, S3, RDS, SQS.
* Skilled in using Docker for containerization, Kubernetes for orchestration, and Helm for managing Kubernetes applications.
* Database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server, Redshift, Aurora, DataBricks, SnowFlake, including experience with database design and optimization.
* Strong understanding of and hands-on experience in designing and implementing MicroService architectures.
* Expertise in developing and consuming RESTful APIs.
* Proficient in using Azure DevOps for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Experience with version control systems, such as Git.
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform



  





**Why Should You Join SiriusPoint?** 




 Our people are our experts, and from day one you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative, and purposeful environment. Our Values - Integrity, Customer Focused, Solution Driven, Diversity, and Collaboration - are at the heart of our business, and they guide our everyday actions and decision making. We also unite our global team behind common goals, ensuring you can make a meaningful impact.
 



 We aim to retain and attract great people, knowing they can achieve a rewarding and enriching career. We offer a competitive and above market compensation package.
 



  





**We Achieve More Together** 




 At SiriusPoint, we know that diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger. We value and are committed to supporting the unique voices, backgrounds, cultures, lifestyles, and contributions of the diverse global employee base that make up our business.
 



 We know that a diverse and equitable culture, where all voices are included and heard, is critical to our success as an employer. We are committed to developing our DE&I strategy to ensure that SiriusPoint remains a supportive and empowering place of work.
